loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Determination and hard work are what Mrs. Marilou O. believes in. Abject poverty is inevitable for them. It drives her to do her part in improving their income. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last September, 2007, having faith in its true service and assistance to needy people. She wishes to access a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to have additional capital for fruit and vegetable vending.

Mrs. O. is 38 years old, married and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has five children--two in secondary school and three in primary grades. Her husband is a carpenter. The couple’s aspiration is to possess a stall in the public market some day. They also hope to be able to send their children through school to obtain degrees and to be able to provide a good quality life.

loans.use: For fruit and vegetable vending

loans.name: Julia Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas D. Oro” en  Distrito D. Puno, la  provincia D. Puno, departamento D. Puno, tiene 70 años D. edad, es casada madre D. 05 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Cesar Vallejo, ella no estudio. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, es socia fundadora  la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta D. chuño, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, los cuales pagara en 4 cuotas; este préstamo le servirá para comprar mas chuño para luego venderlo en el mercado, su deseo seguir trabajando.

Asimismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha las reuniones, y los préstamos que da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is a member of the Palomas D. Oro (Doves of Gold) Communal Bank in the District, Province and Department of Puno. She is 70 years of age, married and the mother of five children. She lives in the Cesar Vallejo neighborhood and has never gone to school. Julia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years now and was a founding member of her Bank. The activity that she devotes herself to is buying and selling "chuño" (naturally freeze-dried potatoes). Her first loan was for 300 New Sols. Presently she would like an additional loan of 500 New Sols which she will repay in four installments. This loan will allow her to buy more chuño for later sale in the market. She wants to continue working. She also related that she really likes the meetings and the loans that Manuela Ramos provides.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chuño.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec en moyenne 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Djaka kin de Kirango Markala (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié, de voisinage, d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle et font essentiellement le commerce de poisson sous toutes ses formes.
Afin d’augmenter le volume de leur activité génératrice de revenus, elles se sont réorganisées pour intégrer le programme de crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois  prêts précédents.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 44 corbeilles correspondant à 660 kg de poisson frais. Tandis qu’une partie du poisson est vendue à l’état frais en ambulant au quartier service kin de Kirango, l’autre partie est d’abord séchée avant la vente. Elles se ravitaillent en poisson frais sur les berges du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec leurs maris spécifiquement  et pendant les périodes de crise avec d’autres pêcheurs de la place. Le poisson ainsi obtenu est revendu au comptant à Ségou, dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Bousssin et Siribala à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA qui sera  utilisé pour l’épargne et pour l’entretien des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’élever des animaux (bovins).  
NB : Absence sur la photo de Marama Dembélé pour accouchement à l’hôpital
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Sabougnouman are married in, for the most part, monogamous families and average 26 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in the Djaka Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of friendship, community, and membership in the same traditional association. And they do commerce essentially in fish, in all its forms. In order to increase the volume of their income-earning business, they became organized to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having correctly repaid the three preceding ones. They intend to use this new loan to buy 44 baskets of fish, equal to 660 kg. While a portion of the fish is sold fresh door-to-door in the Service Kin district of Kirango, the other portion is first dried and then sold. Supplies of fresh fish are gotten on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango from their husbands specifically and from other local fishermen in times of crisis. The fish thus obtained is resold in cash transactions in Ségou, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Bousssin, and Siribala, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 32,500 francs CFA that will be put into savings and used to take care of the children. Their ambition is to raise animals (cattle). Note: Marama Dembélé is absent in the photo due to her giving birth at the hospital

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. is 40 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children. 

Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in dried-fish vending. Her business is a big help financially, specifically in their daily basic needs and school allowances.

Mrs. U. is now on her 4th loan, obtaining PHP8,000. Her loan is intended for additional capital for dried fish vending. Her regular customers are her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs, having a stall in the public market and being able to send their children to school and having them attend a degree course.

loans.use: As additional capital for dried-fish vending

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta C. G.  es una señora de 55 años de edad, quien  vive en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería para doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Esta zona frecuentemente se ve afectada por las inclemencias del tiempo, tales como las fuertes lluvias que provocan inundaciones, por lo que perjudica considerablemente a la agricultura y facilita el desarrollo de plagas que afectan al ganado. Por lo tanto, ha encontrado en la actividad avícola una buena opción de desarrollo microempresarial con un menor riesgo.

Doña Modesta tiene 6 hijos pero ya todos son mayores de edad por lo tanto no viven con ella pero si la ayudan  con diferentes gatos. Ella  se dedica a la avicultura, específicamente a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras - para la producción de carne y huevos respectivamente -. Ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad. 

Actualmente doña Modesta  está solicitando un microcrédito de ¢684,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de más pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras, así como compra de concentrado para su alimentación y productos para la prevención y  tratamiento de enfermedades, además de ampliar y reforzar su local. 

Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a más clientes y ofrecerles mejores productos. Todo esto ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder ayudar a sus hijos.

Doña Modesta es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Modesta C. G. is 55 years old and lives in a small rural community of Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, located in the province of Alajuela. The activities that are carried on in this area are commerce, raising of milk and beef cattle, growing of basic grains such as rice, beans and corn among others. This area is frequently affected by inclement weather, such as strong rain storms that cause flooding. These have a considerable negative effect on agriculture and promote the development of diseases that afflict the cattle. Therefore, the raising of poultry is a good alternative for a small business, with less risk. Doña Modesta has 6 children, all of whom are grown and therefore do not live with her, but help her with various expenses. She makes a living raising poultry, specifically the raising of chickens for fattening up and laying hens, for the production of meat and eggs respectively. She sells her products to her neighbors in the community, who are very satisfied with their quality. Currently doña Modesta is requesting a small loan of 684,000 colones for the purchase of chickens for fattening and laying hens, also extract for their feeding and products for the prevention and treatment of diseases. She also needs to enlarge and reinforce her premises. She expects her small business to grow more after this investment, she will be able to tend to more customers and provide better products. This will help to improve her living conditions and she will be able to assist her children. Doña Modesta is a member of the Community Credit Company Datraban, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan with which she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level, in addition to actively participating in the credit organization of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement of the premises and purchase of chickens.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La señora Dominga es una cliente antigua tiene cinco niños en edad escolar, ella es migrante de la region sur del pais(Tarija) por lo tanto no tiene casa propia vive en casa alquilada, conjuntamente su esposo tienen un taller de carpinteria, así mismo la señora para ayudar en la manutencion de su familia se dedica a la elaboracion de pan y empanadas, para lo cual ella cuenta con un hornito domestico, en el que diarimente elabora panes y los distribuye diariamente en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz
texts.en:
Ms. Dominga is an old client who has 5 school-age children. She is a migrant from the southern region, Tarija, which is why she doesn't have her own home and has to rent. She and her husband have carpentry workshop. She also makes bread and empanadas to help maintain her family. She has a small oven that she makes breads on each day and distributes them on the south side of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cliente invertira en la compra de materia harina y otros insumos para la elaboracion de panes

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Mrs. Daisy C. of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 49 years old and married to a fisherman. They have 6 children, all of whom are single and living with them. 

Daisy has been engaged in fishing activities as a member of Paglaum MPC since November 2007. Having completed her 4th loan cycle, she is requesting a new loan of eight thousand pesos to purchase materials such as a fishing net. The increased profit she expects as a result of this loan will enable her and her husband to send their children to school and see them through college

loans.use: Purchase fishing net

loans.name: Dominga Esperanza

texts.es: Dominga Esperanza G. vive en Lourdes Colon departamento La Libertad, Dominga es casada y madre de cuatro hijos Rosita de 11 años, Leonardo de 8 años, Luis de 5 años y el pequeño Gerber de 2 años de edad. José el esposo de Dominga  aporta económicamente a la familia 200$ mensuales, el se dedica a la albañilería trabajo que no es muy estable ya que es por contrataciones eventuales, es por ello que Dominga busco otra fuente de ingresos para su familia y tuvo la idea de poner una tortillería en su casa, de esta manera siempre estaría pendientes de sus hijos y a su vez trabajar, Dominga hace tortillas todos los días para la hora del almuerzo, lleva ya 11 años de tener su negocio, Dominga solicita este créditos para materia prima utilizada en la elaboración de tortillas.
texts.en:
Dominga Esperanza G. lives in the Lourdes Colon area of La Libertad. Dominga is married and the mother of 4 children: Rosita, 11, Leonardao, 8, Luis 5, and little Gerber who is 2 years old. Dominga's husband, Jose, brings in $200 a month for the family. He works in construction which is not that stable since it's by contract. This is why Dominga is looking for another source of income for her family. She had the idea of opening a tortilla shop in her home. This way she could look after her children and work at the same time. Dominga makes tortillas everyday for lunch. She's been doing this for 11 years. Dominga is asking for a loan for the ingredients used in making tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Insumos para la elaboración de tortillas

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell staple goods

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Mrs. Alba S. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children who are currently studying. Her life as a widow is full of challenges, especially financially. 

Alba runs a sari-sari (convenience store). Her customers are the employees of different offices, neighbors, relatives, and friends. She started with minimal capital with the help of Paglaum MPC. Now she is seeking additional capital that will enable her to purchase goods such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store, and dreams that her children will graduate from college and have a good future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara A. is married with one child. She has received an education through senior high school. She works as a trader selling provisions at Yamoransa in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2003. While Barbara is employed as a trader, her husband works as a driver.  Barbara will use her loan to purchase provisions in bulk or wholesale for the purpose of reselling. With her newly gained profits, she plans to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase provisions in bulk or wholesale for the purpose of reselling.

loans.name: Las Brisas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
el Grupo las Brisas del Sur, esta ubicado en coyolito, a escasos minutos del muelle de amapala, este grupo esta integrado por 3 personas las cuales son muy honrradas y trabajadoras. ademas tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar juntos. Las actividades de este grupo son las siguientes:
La sra. gladys F. de 48 años de edad, es soltera y reside en coyolito desde hace 35 años, ella de dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, tortillas con quesillo, tacos y tambien hace cenas de frijolitos con huevos, queso y tortillas. ella tiene 20 años de realizar esta actividad, de ella solo depende un niño y el esta en edad escolar. ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas productos y asi tener una mejor ganancia.
Trinidad F. de 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive en coyolito, ella se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace mas de 15 años, ella vende refrescos y tiene una pequeña pulperia la cual no tiene mucho producto en ella por eso es que necesita el credito para poder surtirla.
Maura L. tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con el Sr. Pablo Campos, el es dueño de un taxi el cual le genera ingresos para cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales estan en la escuela, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y necesita comprar mas productos para producir sus comidas las cuales se venden muy bien ya que este lugar de coyolito es un lugar turistico de honduras porque por aqui se tiene que pasar para ir a la isla de Amapala.
texts.en:
The "Brisas del Sur" group is in Coyolito, just a few minutes from the Amapala wharf. The group is made up of three honest and hard-working people who have worked together for a long time. Their business activities are: Gladys F. is 48 years old, single, and has lived in Coyolito for 35 years. She sells soft drinks, juice, tortillas with farmer's cheese, and tacos, and she also makes dinners with beans, eggs, cheese, and tortillas. She has been doing this for 20 years. She only has one child to support, and he is school-aged. She needs this loan to buy more supplies so she can have higher profits. Trinidad F. is 57 years old, a single mother of 2 children, and lives in Coyolito. She has been in business for more than 15 years. She sells soft drinks and has a small store, which does not have much merchandise. She needs this loan to stock it. Maura L. is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Pablo Campos. He is a taxi driver and earns enough money to cover some of the household costs. They have two children who are in school. Maura sells candy and needs to buy more supplies to prepare her meals, which sell very well since the area of Coyolito is a tourist attraction in Honduras. You have to pass through it to get to Amapala Island.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, meats, vegetables, canned juices, California brand juices, general merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mme T. Akouwa est âgée d’une quarantaine d’années avec cinq (05) enfants en charge. Elle réussit  bien dans son commerce de charbon de bois, lequel commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et surtout à la scolarisation de ses enfants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour stocker en grande quantité du charbon et satisfaire régulièrement sa clientèle. Avec le revenu de son commerce, elle contribuera aux conditions d’existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Akouwa is 40-something and has 5 children to support. Her business is successful, and this enables her to provide for her family, especially for schooling for her children. This is why she's requesting financing, so as to build up a large quantity of charcoal and to satisfy her customers regularly. With the revenues from her commerce, she will help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal

loans.name: Ludis Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ludís Antonio Gutiérrez , tiene la edad de 29 años, habita en el barrio Lomas del Gavilán en Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida , la cual trabaja como comerciante , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo , dos hijos , una niña de siete años , que actualmente estudia , y una varón de tres años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Ludís desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia el cultivo es diversificarlo, él inicio esta actividad agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para aplicar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ludis Antonio is 29 years old, and lives in the Lomas Gavilan neighborhood of Ticuantepe along with his wife. She works as a businesswoman in order to assist with the household expenses. They are responsible for their two children, a girl of 7 who is currently studying, and a boy of 3. The family plans to improve their living conditions. Mr. Gutiérrez has worked in agriculture for the past 20 years, and the major difficulty he has face in that time is the lack of financing. He plans to diversify his crops, and wants financing to purchase the necessary inputs and crop fertilizer to use on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to improve his crops.

loans.name: Emerencia

texts.en: Mrs. Emerencia A. is 58 years old. She is married with 6 children- 5 are married and 1 is still studying in secondary school. She is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental,Philippines. Her husband is a farmer. She started her business when she became a member of Paglaum MPC in April 2005. She is now on her 8th loan cycle, and is seeking Php6,000.00 for additional capital for her sari-sari store- to buy additional stocks such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated an excellent loan repayment record. She aims to have a successful business and would eventually like to have a concrete store and be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and resupply her store

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en: Mrs. Rubilyn A. is from Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 30 years old and is married with 2 children. Her husband is a driver /mechanic. Her husband's salary is not enough, especially as the children grow older. Five years ago she started her store with only Php10,000.00 in capital. A friend told her about Paglaum MPC, which provides financial assistance to those needing it. She became a member of the PAGLAUM COOP and was able to apply for additional funds. With their hard work, patience and determination they believe that they can send their children to college so that they can finish a degree and have a decent life in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Hodalo

texts.fr: Mme PASSAÏ Hodalo est une femme très dévouée à la cause sociale. C’est pourquoi elle s’est très tôt lancée dans la vente de pagne pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement pour élargir son étalage, commander de nouveaux pagnes pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices seront mis à la disposition des familles démunies et des enfants déshérités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hodalo PASSAÏ is a woman very much devoted to the social cause. This is why she started selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) early on, in order to provide for her family. She's seeking a loan to expand her stall and to order new pagnes, in order to better meet customer demand. Profits will be given to destitute families and underprivileged children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Akeie

texts.fr: Mme A. Akeie est née en 1976 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de famille, elle vend du riz préparé au bord de la route pour soulager les charges de sa famille. Très reconnue dans la localité pour la qualité de son repas, elle est constamment fréquentée par se nombreux clients. Elle sollicite  donc un financement pour stocker du riz en quantité suffisante et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Les bénéfices tirés de son activité serviront à l’amélioration de leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akeie A. was born in 1976 in Tsévié. She's married and the mother of a family. She sells cooked rice on the roadside to alleviate the expenses of her family. Well-known locally for the quality of her food, she's constantly serving numerous customers. She's seeking a loan to stock a sufficient amount of rice, in order to increase her revenue. Profits of her business will be used to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice for her food-serving business

loans.name: Ángel Ernesto

texts.es: Ángel Ernesto R.  vive en el barrio Concepción ubicado en el departamento de San Vicente, Ángel de 24 años de edad es un joven muy luchador y trabajador, se dedica a la venta de zapatos en un local ubicado en San Vicente, los ingresos de sus ventas los utiliza para sus estudios de la universidad, y también para su familia; ya que vive con madre y abuela que solo cuentan con el apoyo de Ángel. Este crédito lo solicita para comprar nueva mercadería en zapatos y de esta manera  podrá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Angel R. Ernesto lives in the Concepcion neighborhood of the San Vicente department. Angel is 24 years old, and is a very young fighter and worker. He sells shoes in a room in San Vicente, and uses the revenues from his sales to support his studies at university and also to help support his family. He lives with his mother and grandmother, who only have Angel to count on. Angel is requesting this loan to buy new shoes and merchandise in order to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Dulce Nombre Group

texts.es:
el grupo dulce nombre esta integrado por 4 personas las cuales se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, sus actividades son las siguientes:
el sr. Amilcar G. tiene 30 años de edad, el vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos esta en la escuela., el se dedica a la venta de leña, el para vender este producto lo traslada en su carro para diferentes comunidades aledañas a jicaro galan, la leña se vende mucho en esta zona ya que muchas casas no tiene luz electrica y para cocinar siempre tienen encendido el fogon con leña.
La Sra. Iris V. tiene 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, pra vender su producto ella sale a difentes casas de su comunidad ya que la mayoria de las tortillas que vende son por encargos diarios.
el Sr. Ramon L. tiene 20 años de edad tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como ser desodorantes, shampoos, glases, jabones, cremas, lociones etc. el para vender su producto se traslada en su motocicleta para la cuidad de nacaome ya que ahi hay un buen mercado para la venta de estos productos.
La Sra. Melecia O. tiene 52 años de edad es casada y tiene 13 hijos de los cuales sollo 4 dependen de ella al 100%, ella se dedica  a la venta de tortillas, negocio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a todos sus hijos, todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante  con sus familias.

loans.use: compra de leña, pollo, carne de cerdo y res, tomates, repollo, yuca, papas, platanos, maiz, cal, lociones, cremas, desodorantes.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme A. Akouvi est née en 1983 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de famille, elle n’a pas eu la chance d’évoluer dans les études par faute de moyens financiers. Elle s’adonna ainsi au commerce de vente de maïs frais pour se prendre en charge. Mme A. Akouvi sollicite donc un financement pour se ravitailler quotidiennement. Les revenus lui permettront de contribuer aux charges du ménage et à l’amélioration de son existence.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi A. was born in 1983 in Tsévié. She's married and the mother of a family. She didn't get the chance to pursue her studies, due to a lack of financial means. To support herself, she started selling fresh corn. Mrs. Akouvi A. is seeking a loan to get her daily supplies. The profits will enable her to help with the household expenses, and to improve her existence.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily supplies of fresh corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies of corn

loans.name: The Good Friend Group

texts.es:
el grupo el buen amigo esta integrado por 3 personas que viven en la misma comunidad y tienen muy buenas relaciones entre ellos, las actividades de este grupo son las siguientes:
Al Sr. Bonerges O. tiene 59 años de edad, es cadado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende al 100% de el, se dedica a la venta de comidas y golosinas como ser: pollo frito, carne asada, camarones, enchiladas, tacos, tajadas de platano, yuca frita, refrescos. el tiene su puesto en un lugar muy bueno ya que esta ubicado enfrete del hotel oasis colonial y muchos clientes van donde el a comprar su comida.
la Sra. Juana Delmy M. tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos estudian, ella se dedica a la venta de baleadas, cafe, cereal con leche, osmil, este negocio lo tiene ubicado frente a la posta policial de jicaro galan,
la Sra. Rita L. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 estsan en la escuela y uno en el colegio, tiene una pulperia en la cual vende arrozm frijoles, azucar, cafe, mantequilla, manteca, aceite, pan, carnes, pollo, jugos, refrescos.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder invertirlo en sus negocios ya que son la unica fuente de ingresos que tienen y ellos desean mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group "The Good Friend" is composed of 3 people living in the same community who have very good relations between with one another. The activities of the group are: Mr. O. Bonerges is 59 years old, and married with 5 children, of which only one depends on him 100%. He sells meals and snacks such as: fried chicken, roast beef, shrimp, enchiladas, tacos, banana slices, yuca frita, and soda. His location is great because it is in front of a Oasis Hotel where many customers buy their food. Ms. Juana Delmy M. is 43 years old, and is single with 3 children. Two of them are students. Juana sells candy, coffee, and cereal with milk. Her business is located in front of the Jicaro Galan police post. Rita L. is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children, of which 3 are in school and 1 is in high school. Rita has a shop where she sells beans, sugar, coffee, butter, lard, oil, bread, meat, chicken, juices, and soft drinks. Each of these group members need a loan to invest in their business because they are the only source of income they have and they want to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their businesses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools and raw materials

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora María P. se dedica a su labor de atención de su pulpería el cual posee desde hace 10 años siendo este negocio el que le permite sustentar a su familia.

Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ya que los necesita con urgencia y para ello espera muy confiadamente en que será beneficiada y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Mrs. María P. has run a shop for the past 10 years. Her shop has supported her family during this time. Mrs. P. came to Ceprodel for a loan to purchase products that she urgently needs, for which she hopes to receive help and move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La señora Maximina G. muy esforzadamente se dedica a su trabajo de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son elaboradas por ella misma con la más alta calidad atrayendo a sus clientes a diario que les gusta mucho consumir estas tortillas elaboradas por ella. 

Hoy en día ella espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas para la compra del maíz y la leña y de esta manera salir adelante en su actividad en la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maximina G. sets herself strongly to her work of the production and sale of tortillas which are made by her with the highest quality, daily attracting her customers who very much like to eat her tortillas.

Today she trustingly hopes that Ceprodel will provide her a loan to purchase premium ingredients for the production of the tortillas, to purchase corn and firewood, and thereby get ahead in her business in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of premium ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria Gómez , tiene la edad de 34 años , habita en el barrio la Francia numero uno , ubicado en las afueras del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo seis hijos , todos menores de edad , ellos actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultora y comerciante , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la cenizas del volcán , con el financiamiento obtenido va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo y obtener mejores ganancias al venderlas a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Gómez is 34 and lives in the Francia Número Uno neighborhood, which is located on the outskirts of the city of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who helps her support their home. They have six children, all of whom are minors and who are in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions. She has worked for 25 years as a farmer and merchant. The most difficult thing she faces is the lack of financing and the ashes from the volcano. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops so she can have a better crop and sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Isabel S. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado Central de Chinandega donde ella ofrece el servicio de alquiler de los servicios sanitarios siendo visitada a diario por las personas que visitan el gran mercado central.

De igual forma, ella también comercializa caramelos pero su mayor fuerza es el alquiler de los servicios sanitarios que mantiene en perfecto estado. Hoy en día ella espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para lavar las paredes y el piso de los baños y de igual forma para la compra de papel higiénico entre otros. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará brindar mejores condiciones a los servicios sanitarios.
texts.en:
Maritz Isabel S. works in the Central Market of Chinandega where she rents out sanitary services to people who visit the large central market every day.

She also sells candy, but her major efforts are in renting out sanitary services, which she keeps in perfect condition. Now she hopes to get a loan from Ceprodel to buy cleaning products to wash the walls and the floor of the bathroom. She also hopes to buy toilet paper, among other things. This loan will help her a lot and will allow her to offer better sanitary services.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cleaning products

loans.name: Julia Lilly

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Julia P. se dedica a laborar en la venta de muebles de madera como lo son mesas, sillas, pequeños roperos y algunos productos metálicos.

El negocio hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de hacer pronta inversión para su respectivo desarrollo y para ello espera fielmente en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de dichos productos de madera de sus proveedores y así suplir su establecimiento y mejorar su condición económica actual.
texts.en:
In the central market of the city of Cinandega, Mrs. Julia Perez works in the sale of wooden furniture such as tables, chairs, small wardrobes, and some metallic products.

Today the business is in need of a quick investment for its development, and due to this she faithfully hopes that Ceprodel will provide a loan for the purchase of the aforementioned wooden products from her suppliers and to thereby supply her establishment and to improve her current financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wooden furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To store and sell charcoal

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado central, la señora Ana J. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa y productos personales como lo son prensa pelos, pulseras, aros y collares siendo comercializados en su propio establecimiento.

Ella hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos productos para así continuar con su negocio y lograr satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan para comprar la ropa y los productos personales.
texts.en:
In the area of Chinandega, specifically in the central market, Mrs. Ana Jiron works at her business of the sale of clothes and personal products such as hair irons, bracelets, earrings, and necklaces in her own establishment.

Today she has come to Ceprodel to be favored with a loan for the purchase of the aforementioned products in order to be able continue her business and to achieve the satisfaction of her customers who visit her to purchase the clothes and personal products.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothes and personal products

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony N. is single with no children and has received an education through Senior High School. Anthony works as a businessman, selling phone units for all networks at Yamoransa in Cape Coast.  He has been in business since 2007.  Anthony uses his income to pay for his own school fees. Anthony will use the loan to purchase more phone card units in bulk and with his newly gained profits Anthony plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: Anthony will use the loan to purchase more phone card units in bulk

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Juan Antonio López Ríos tiene la edad de 27 años , habita en el barrio Los Ríos en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a sus padres , los cuales están a su cargo , el es soltero , no tiene hijos aun , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder terminar de construir su casa , desde hace 12 años , se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , junto al apoyo de su papá , durante este tiempo la mayor parte que le ha afectado es la falta de financiamiento y el precio de la piña que por temporadas baja su precio. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Antonio L. R. is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los R. in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his parents who are in his care. He is single and does not have children yet. His plans for his family are to be able to improve their living conditions and to be able to finish the construction of their house.

For 12 years he has worked as a farmer together with the support of his father. During this time the main thing that has affected him is the lack of financing and the price of pineapple which is seasonally low. With this loan he is going to purchase fertilizers and products for cultivation in order to have a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and fertilizers to improve the harvest

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela Maria García R. , tiene la edad de 35 años , habita en las pilas Oriental , ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su esposo el cual , trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo 4 hijos , los cuales le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas en sus tiempos libre , ya que estos jóvenes estudian , los panes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , desde hace 13 años trabaja como agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad con la ayuda de su papá , la mayor dificulta que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y la sequilla que le afecta bastante . Con el financiamiento obtenido, a va comprar los insumos que requieren los cultivos y poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela Maria García R., 35, lives in Las Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband who works to help her pay their household expenses. They have four children who go to school. The children help with the farming work in their free time. The plan for their family is to improve living conditions. The biggest difficulty they have is the lack of financing. She has worked as a farmer for thirteen years. She started this work with her father’s help. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing and the drought, which greatly affects her. With the loan she will buy the necessary supplies for her crops to be able to have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Margelia Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Margelia del Rosario S. , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el barrio Piedra quemada , ubicado hacia carretera a Masaya , junto su esposo , el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ,ella desde hace 15 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener parte del cultivo , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para comenzar a sembrar la cosecha y así que ninguna plaga dañe su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margelia del Rosario S., 26, lives in the Piedra Quemada neighborhood, which is located on the road to Masaya. She lives with her husband who works to help her with the household expenses. They have two children who go to school. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. She has worked as a farmer for fifteen years. Through her own efforts she has been able to maintain part of her crops. The biggest problem is lack of financing. Her plan for her crops is to diversify. The loan is to buy fertilizer and supplies so that when she plants her crops no insects can damage them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crops

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Since 2007 Naomi F. has worked as a trader selling provisions at Yamoransa in Cape Coast.  She is married with 1 child and has received an education through Senior High School. Her husband works as a pharmacist.  She is responsible for paying for her family’s various expenses, primarily utilities. Her loan will be used to purchase provisions in bulk for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the enterprise.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase provisions in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Martha Luz R. vive en Lourdes, municipio del departamento de la Libertad.  A sus 25 años, Martha es la cabeza de su hogar, que incluye a sus dos sobrinos, y su mama de ochenta años, quien debido a su vejez, es incapaz de vivir sola. Martha además de hacerse cargo de los gastos de vivienda y gastos diarios, cuida a su mama y ayuda en la educación de su sobrino menor, quien no termina aun bachillerato. Martha Luz tiene montada una pequeña tienda, donde vende todo tipo de artículos para el hogar  y diversidad de alimentos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para poder invertir un poco más en su tienda, y adquirir nueva mercadería que le permita ampliar la gama de sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha Luz R. lives in Lourdes, a municipality in the La Libertad department. She is 25 and the head of her household, which includes her two nephews and her eighty year old mother. Because of her old age, her mother cannot live alone. Besides being in charge of the household expenses and daily expenditures, Martha also takes care of her mother and helps her youngest nephew with his education. Her nephew does not have his high school degree yet. Martha Luz has started a small store where she sells all types of household items and a variety of food. She currently is asking for a loan to be able to invest a little more in her store. She will also get new merchandise, which will allow her to expand the range of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Juana  Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Juana Hernández C., tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene seis hijos , todos casados , de los cuales dos son docentes , un albañil , una cajera , un cocinero y una ama de casa . Los planes de doña Juana es poder darle a sus hijos una herencia para que construyan su casa, ella desde hace 21 años trabaja como agricultora, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la perdida de producto por sequilla y los gases del volcán que afectan al cultivo, con sus propios esfuerzos inicio esta actividad, y los planes hacia su cultivo es poder darle todo es mantenimiento requerido para obtener una mejor producción. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Hernández C. is 55 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. She has six children, all of whom are married. Of her children, two are teachers, one is a builder, one is a cashier, one is a cook, and one is a housewife. Mrs. Juana plans to be able to give her children an inheritance so that they can build a house. For 21 years, she has working in agriculture. Her biggest difficulty is when she loses products to drought and volcanic gasses that affect her crop. With her own efforts, she began this activity, and she plans to maintain her crop in order to get the best production. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crop.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers to apply to her crop

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yessenia Elizabeth L. D. L. vive en Lourdes, municipio del departamento D. La Libertad.  Hace ya nueve años, Yessenia trajo al mundo  a su único hijo, Melvin, quien actualmente cursa tercer grado.  Tras el nacimiento D. su hijo, Yessenia cambio por completo sus expectativas D. vida, y tan solo dos años después  D. dar a luz, abrió un negocio propio. Una sala D. belleza que mediante esfuerzo y apoyo D. su esposo, ha logrado sacar adelante. Yessenia y su esposo solicitan un préstamo, para comprar nuevos productos  para obtener mayores ingresos que ayudaran a construir un respaldo económico.
texts.en:
Yessenia Elizabeth L. D. L. lives in Lourdes, a town in the department of La Libertad. For nine years, Yessenia has given the world to her only son, Melvin, who is in third graD. now. Because of the birth of her son, Yessenia completely changed her expectations of life and only two years later, she opened her own business. She has a beauty salon and through effort and the support of her husband, she has succeeded in going forward. Yessenia and her husband are requesting a loan to buy new products so that she can have more earnings that will help her build a financial base.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her beauty salon

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: el Sr. Pilar tiene 64 años de edad, el se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para irse a la terminal de buses de la localidad para comprar las semillas en sacos y fardos de maiz y frijoles, esto es para venderlo en diferentes caserios y comunidades cerca de donde el vive, su producto lo vende por libras y asi obtiene una buena ganancia, el maiz se vende muy bien ya que de ahi se hacen las tortillas, este alimento con los frijoles es indispensable en muchas familias de nuestro pais. el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mejores ganancias y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Pilar is 64 years old. He wakes up at 5 in the morning to go to the bus station in his town to buy sacks of seeds and bundles of corn and beans. He sells all of this in different hamlets and communities near where he lives. He sells his product by the pound and, in this way, he earns a good income. The corn sells very well since tortillas are made from it. This food, along with beans, is indispensible for many families in his country. He needs this loan to buy more merchandise and, thus, to have more earnings and to be able to go forward with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and beans in seeds and bundles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Arcadia

texts.es: Maria Arcadia S. vive en Santa Tecla, dentro del departamento D. la Libertad en la zona occidental del país, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Carecer D. educación básica y formal, nunca ha sido un impedimento para Maria, quien ha recompensado su ausencia en la escuela, con un vivido espíritu D. lucha que distingue al emprendedurismo.  DesD. hace ya nueve años, Maria Arcadia maneja un cafetín donD. emplea a dos personas más. Maria solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, y adquirir materia prima y productos alimenticios que le permitan obtener las herramientas necesarias para expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Arcadia S. lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad, in the western area of the country, with her husband and two children. Lacking a basic and formal education has never been an obstacle for Maria, who has compensated for her absence of schooling with a fighting spirit of an enterprising person. For nine years, Maria Arcadia has managed a small tavern, where she employs two people. Maria is requesting this loan to reinvest in her business and buy raw materials and food products, which will allow her to obtain the necessary tools to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia C. A. vive en  Santa Tecla, dentro del departamento de La Libertad.  Nadie nunca le enseño como cocinar, como administrar y mucho menos como montar un negocio, y es precisamente montar su propio negocio que junto a ser madre, eran sus sueños. Con perseverancia y fe en si misma y respaldo de su familia, montó hace ya 5 años una pequeña tienda en su propia casa, donde empezó vendiendo tortillas, y ahora vende toda clase de productos de uso diario. Curiosamente su única hija, Erica tiene también 5 añitos, lo que deja en claro el inmenso giro que Ana Cecilia ha dado en su vida, en tan solo media década. Ana solicita un préstamo, pues considera que es el tiempo justo para, apostar un poco más en su familia, y adquirir nueva mercadería para ampliar su tienda, pues la vida le ha enseñado, que el deseo acompañado del esfuerzo, pacientemente, da frutos.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia C. A. lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad. No one ever taught her how to cook, how to manage, and much less how to run a business. Her dreams were precisely to have her own business with her mother. With perseverance and faith in herself and the support of her family, she has had a small store for five years in her own house, where she started selling tortillas. Now she sells all kinds of products that are used on a daily basis. Curiously, her only daughter, Erica, is also 5 years old, which clarifies the great turn that Ana Cecilia took in her life in only half a decade. Ana is requesting a loan, since she considers this to be the right time to bet a little more on her family and buy new merchandise to grow her store. As life has taught her, desire, accompanied with effort and patience, leads to results.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sohar Gricelda

texts.es: La Sra. Sohar tiene 45 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para hacer sus compras en el mercado de la localidad y asi llevar el producto para su negocio, ella necesita surtir el negocio por esa razon esta solicitando el credito, ella tiene dos hijas las cuales le ayudan con la atencion del negocio cuando ella sale a hacer compras para el mismo, dice que su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande que sea como un supermercadito, tambien la meta de ella es que sus hijas se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sohar is 45 years old and a single mother. She gets up at 5 in the morning in order to go shopping at the local market and then bring the products to her business. She is requesting a loan because she needs to stock up her business. She has two children who help take care of the business while she leaves to make necessary purchases for it. She says that it is her dream to be able to have a large store, like a supermarket; another goal is to have her daughters graduate from university.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, butter, rice, sugar, soft drinks, juices, cookies, churros, candies, milk, toilet paper, toothpaste, soaps, milk products and tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Juan O. tiene 48 años de edad, el compra semillas de marañon para procesarlas y venderlas ya quemadas, este proceso lo hace en su casa, la semillas quedan crujientes y con un buen sabor, tambien las empaca para venderlas en diferentes negocios y pulperias de la ciudad de choluteca, el vive con su hija que tiene 18 años de edad la cual estudia, ella le acompaña los fines de semana para vender su producto en guasaule que es la frontera con nicaragua.
en estos momentos el necesita el credito para comprar mas semillas ya que hay semanas que no le ajusta la produccion y el pierde mucho dinero los fines de semana cuando no tiene producto ya que no viaja a  la frontera. por tal razon necesita el credito para invertirlo en mas materia prima.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan O. is 48 years old, he purchases cashew seeds in order to process, roast and sell them. He does this process in his house, the seeds remain crispy and with a good flavor. He also packages them to be sold to different businesses and grocery stores in the city of Choluteca, where he lives with his 18 year old daughter who studies. She accompanies him on the weekends to sell the product in Guasaule, which is on the border with Nicaragua. At the moment he needs a loan in order to purchase more seeds because there are weeks when the production is low, therefore he loses a lot of money on the weekends when there is no product and he does not travel to the border. For this reason he needs a loan in order to invest in raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco cuenta con un taller de tapiceria, ubicado en la colonia San Francisco, esta es una colonia muy populosa de Comayaguela, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este tipo de trabajo, su negocio esta equipado con todas las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar cualquier tipo de trabajo, el tiene muchos clientes fijos y ellos tambien lo recomiendan con otras personas ya que su calidad de trabajo es muy buena, tambien hace trabajos en vehiculos, el vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el sueño del Sr. Francisco es construir una segunda planta a su casa y asi poder ampliar su negocio, el en su vecindario es muy querido por todos ya que tiene una costumbre todos los años de celebrarle el dia del niño a todos los niños que viven cerca de donde el y todos estos gastos son cubiertos por el mismo.
el ha tenido una vida dura ya que desde muy niño le toco empezar a vender periodicos en las calles, luego crecio y logro poner su taller con mucho sacrificio. en la colonia todo mundo lo conoce por PACO.
texts.en:
Francisco has an upholstery workshop, located in the San Francisco neighborhood, a populous section of Comayaguela. He has 10 years experience in this type of work. His business is equipped with all of the necessary tools to do his work, and he has many dedicated clients, who also recommend him to others because his work is so good. He also works on cars. He lives with his wife and their two children. Francisco's dream is to build a second floor on his house, in order to expand his business. He is very well liked in his neighborhood, and has a custom of celebrating Children's Day with all of children that live near him, covering all of the costs himself. Francisco has had a very difficult life. When he was a child he started selling newspapers in the streets at a very young age. Later, after he grew up, he made many sacrifices in order to start his workshop. In his neighborhood everyone knows him as Paco.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fabric, thread, sponges and wood

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es: El grupo "Don Bosco" esta representado por la señora Jhovana y conformada por 13 miembros que van cursando su cuarto ciclo juntos demostrando responsabilidad y capacidad para poder administrar bien sus fondos y generar cada vez mas ingresos otorgándole una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias, es así que cada uno de los socios a mejorado en sus actividades comerciales de venta de comidas y barrotes en tiendas de barrio que ya se encuentran mas surtidas de productos de mayor demanda, aquellos dedicados al transporte publico mejoraron sus herramientas de trabajo. El destino de este nuevo financiamiento es para obtener capital de trabajo y poder obtener contratos más grandes como fiestas de matrimonio y otro tipo de eventos para la elaboración de los platos servidos o bocaditos y así generar un mayor ingreso y poder crecer todos juntos. Dentro del rubro de venta de productos y comida existe bastante competencia pero la calidad de los productos de las socias asegura un ingreso diario para la manutención de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Don Bosco" group is represented by Jhovana and made up of 13 members, now in their 4th cycle together, demonstrating responsibility and the ability to manage their funds and generate increasing income, providing a better quality of life for their families. Through this group, the members have improved their businesses, selling food and other groceries in stores in the neighborhood, which are now better stocked with the most popular products; and those providing public transportation services have improved their equipment. The purpose of this new financing is to provide capital to obtain larger contracts, such as weddings and other catered events with appetizers and entrees provided, in order to generate greater income and growth. Within the food sales sector there is much competition, but the quality of products of these members insures a daily income that they can maintain their families with.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Trojes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Trojes” se encuentra representado por el señor Víctor y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades comerciales como ser la venta de helados, comida, F., verduras frescas y artesanías, pero una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros debido a al gran demanda que existe dentro de la ciudad y sus alrededores. El destino del financiamiento es para la mejora de sus herramientas de trabajo ya que los alrededores de la ciudad no cuenta con buenos caminos y es necesario contar con un buen vehiculo para conseguir pasajeros, las socias dedicadas al comercio necesitan el financiamiento para estocar mejor sus puestos de venta y para la compra de insumos para sus productos terminados. En lo que respecta a  experiencia  los miembros del grupo trabajaron con anterioridad en grupos solidarios por lo que saben que se necesita responsabilidad, unión y cumplimiento en los pagos para contar con la confianza de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The Trojes group is represented by Victor and made up of 13 members who are engaged in commercial activities such as selling ice cream, flowers, fresh vegetables and handicrafts, although the majority of the members work in public transportation, due to the great demand for this service in the city and the surrounding areas. The purpose of this loan is to improve their equipment, because the areas around the city do not have good roads, and it's necessary to have a reliable vehicle in order to secure passengers. The members in sales need financing to stock their businesses and to purchase materials for their finished products. Regarding experience, the group members have worked in other solidarity groups, and therefore know that they must be responsible and work together, and make their payments in order to earn the trust of our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Paraíso” están representados por la señora Melby y conformados por 12 miembros dedicados en su mayoría al comercio D. diferentes productos como cosméticos, comida, zapatos, ropa y abarrotes algunos D. los miembros se dedican a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, al servicio D. peluquería y al transporte público pero todos ellos cuentan con una fuente D. ingresos. Dentro del mercado existe mucha competencia en la cual los socios deben competir por ganar clientes y poder generar un ingreso diario para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la mejora D. sus herramientas D. trabajo, compra D. insumos y materiales para poder prestar un servicio D. mayor calidad y un producto más competitivo para el mercado. En lo que respecta a la experiencia una mayoría D. los socios ya trabajo con grupos solidarios en nuestra institución por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y cuentan con la responsabilidad para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Paraíso" are represented by Señora Melby, and are composed of 12 members who for the most part work in the sale of different products such as cosmetics, shoes, clothing, food, and other groceries. Other members work in the manufacture of wooden furniture, haircutting, and in public transportation, but all of them currently rely upon a steady source of income. Within the market there is much competition in which the members must compete in order to gain customers and generate a daily income to sustain their families. This loan is designated to be put toward the improvement of the members' tools of work, and toward the purchase of goods and materials for their businesses, so that they will be able to offer higher quality services and more competitive products in the market. With respect to their experience, the majority of the members have already worked with affiliated communal banking groups, and have proven themselves to know the morality of work, and the responsibility they must exert to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es:
Banco Comunal "San Nicolás" esta compuesto por doce socias entre ellas existe un varón el cual se dedica a la cerrajería, las socias que integran el banco comunal San Nicolás ingresaron a su 5do ciclo cumpliendo con todas las obligaciones pactadas con el contrato que firmaron con Agrocapital, Muchas de las socias trabajan con artesanías entre ellas están el tejido de mantas, el macramé, venta de víveres a crédito y al contado, algunas de las socias cuentan con puestos fijos en diferentes ferias que se realizan en el Alto pero la mas importante y donde la mayoría se concentra es la feria 16 de julio participando con la venta  de producto que ellas mismas elaboran o también revendiendo productos obtenidos a bajos precios. Ellas necesitan el crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y surtir sus mercaderías, la competencia que tienen por el sector donde trabajan es accesible para una buena venta por que la zona mencionada esta alejada del centro de la ciudad, por lo que las señoras o vecinas prefieren hacer su mercado en la misma zona y como cuentan con ferias diarias es mucho mas factible el movimiento de sus producto y obtener mayores ingresos.
Este grupo ingresa a su quinto ciclo, cumpliendo con responsabilidad y puntualidad en su pagos  por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda su confianza.
texts.en:
The “San Nicolás” community bank is comprised of twelve members. Among them there is one man, a locksmith. The San Nicolás community bank members entered their fifth loan cycle. They have met all of the obligations agreed upon in the contract they signed with Agrocapital. Many of the members work as crafts people. Some of them weave blankets, make macrame, and sell supplies on credit and for cash. Some of the members have fixed stalls in different fairs in El Alto. The most important, and where most of them assemble, is the 16th of July fair. They sell products they make themselves or resell products at low prices. They need a loan to augment their working capital and stock their merchandise. The competition that they have in the sector where they work is open for a good sale because they are far from the center of the city. The women and neighbors prefer to do their marketing in the same zone. Because they rely on daily fairs, it is easier to move their products and get better income. This group is in its fifth loan cycle. The Agrocapital foundation trusts them because they make their payments responsibly and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yanapassiñani Group

texts.es:
La directiva del Banco Comunal YANAPASIÑANI  esta conformada por la señora Elena, Hilda Rosa y Víctor este Banco tiene doce componentes que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. Kollpani D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Las socias en su mayoría se dedican a actividades comerciales como la venta D. verduras, quesos, venta D. ropa, pequeñas tiendas D. abarrotes y punto D. llamadas, algunas se dedican al tejido D. chompas D. lana y  macramé, el grupo esta conformado por un 80%  D. mujeres. Ellas necesitan el crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y surtir sus mercaderías así como la compra D. insumos y materiales para un producto D. calida más competitivo. La competencia que tienen por el sector donD. trabajan es accesible para una buena venta por que la zona mencionada esta alejada del centro D. la ciudad, por lo que los ingresos son mayores para el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias que realizan tejidos en lana o macramé tienen un mercado diferente ya que realizan su trabajo a pedido teniendo bastante demanda.
Este grupo ingresa a su quinto ciclo, cumpliendo con responsabilidad  y cumpliendo con sus obligaciones puntualmente por lo que cuentan con experiencia suficiente con los grupos solidarios, es por esta razón que la Fundación Agrocapital le brinda la confianza para un nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
The directive of Village Bank YANAPASIÑANI is maD. up of Mrs. Elena, Hilda Rosa, and Victor. The Bank has twelve components and the majority lie in the Kollipani area in the city of El Alto. The partners mostly engage in work such as retail sales, like the sale of vegetables, cheeses, clothing, small grocery stores and calling centers, some work weaving wool and macramé sweaters. The group is comprised of 80% women. They need loans in order to raise their work capital, to stock up merchandise and purchase more supplies and materials to produce a more quality and competitive product. The competition they have in the area where they work is accesible to good sales because it is removed from the city center, so most of the revenue goes to support the livelihood of their families. The partners that knit or macramé wool and fabrics have a different market since they do work based on requests and sufficient demand. The group is entering their fifth cycle, fulfilling all obligations responsibly and in a timely manner. They have sufficient experience within the group, and for this reason the Foundation Agrocapital has confidence in financing them yet again.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: Acuario Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo "ACUARIO RSR"  esta representado por la señora Luzmila y por su mesa directiva conformada por la señora Bernarda y Wilma. Este Banco tiene doce componentes que en su mayoría radican en la Zona D. Villa Caluyo D. la ciudad D. El Alto; las socias a pesar D. su nivel D. vida gozan D. sus pequeños puestos D. venta D. diferentes productos como  verduras, quesos, venta D. ropa, pequeñas tiendas D. abarrotes, elaboración D. chompas tejidas a mano y a la costura del frazadas. El grupo esta conformado por pura mujeres que luchan día a día por un ingreso diario que es el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para surtir más sus puestos D. trabajo y tener un producto D. mayor calidad y poder acceder a un mercado más competitivo. Las socias cuentan con experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios ya que van cursando un ciclo mas juntas demostrando tener responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
Luzmila represents the Acuario RSR group. Bernarda and Wilma form the executive board. This bank has twelve members. Most of them are in the Villa Caluyo zone in the city of El Alto. The members, in spite of their level in life, enjoy their small stands where they sell different products like vegetables, cheese, and clothes. Some have grocery stores, some make hand maD. sweaters, and some sew blankets. The group is formed by women who fight day to day for the daily income to support their families. The loan is to buy materials and supplies to stock their work places, to have better quality products, and to be able to enter a more competitive market. The members have experience working with supportive groups. Now that they are entering another loan cycle together, they demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead in order to offer their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cosmos Rsr Group

texts.es: Banco Comunal “Cosmos RSR” esta representado por la señora Margoth y conformado por 12 socios en su mayoría mujeres, el grupo ingresa a su primer ciclo pero anteriormente ya trabajaron con la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. grupos solidarios. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como  la papa, el chuño, hortalizas y otros productos naturales que son traídos D. terrenos D. los socios en el campo, otras D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como tiendas D. abarrotes, ropa, sombreros, comida y al transporte público. El destino del financiamiento es la compra D. llantas en el caso D. los transportistas y a la compra D. insumos y materiales en el caso D. las socias comerciantes. La competencia en el mercado central del la ciudad es bastante alta pero las socias tienen experiencia en ventas y saben como salir adelante ya que D. eso depenD. el sustento D. su familia.
texts.en:
Village Bank “Cosmos RSR” is represented by Mrs. Margoth and is comprised of 12 members who are mainly women, the group is entering its' first cycle but previously worked with Foundation Agrocapital and therefore already know the moD. of solidarity groups. The majority if the members work in the sale of products such as potato, el chuño (dried potato), vegetables and other natural products that are brought by partners from the countrysiD.. Other partners have grocery stores, sell clothing, hats, food and offer public transportation. The funding will be used to purchase tires for transport carriers, and in the case of retail sales members it will be used to purchase supplies and other materials . The competition in the central market of the city is quite high, but the members have sales experience and know how to come out ahead because the livelihood of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: Tomas Benjamin

texts.es: El señor  TOMAS BENJAMIN M. T. y su esposa Lourdes Mamani, tienen un pequeño hijo a quien educan con su trabajo. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la ciudad de El Alto  en la zona Ballivián 2da sección. El señor  tomas es chofer propietario trabaja todos los días para pagar la colegiatura de sus hijos y su manutencion, el crédito que solicita lo invertira en la compra de dos puertas para su casa,  patrimonio que logro fue gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio, su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en la ciudad del El Alto, ella también colabora en los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Tomas Benjamin M. T. and his wife, Lourdes Mamani, have a small son whose school fees they pay with his work. They live in a house in the [Bolivian] city of El Alto. Tomas is a cab driver who works every day to pay his childrens' school fees and other expenses. The loan will be used to buy two doors for his house, his largest asset, built after much effort and sacrifice. His wife operates a business selling used clothing in El Alto and she, too, shares in paying the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two doors for house.

loans.name: Pura Vida Uno Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado "Pura Vida" esta representada por la señora Delfina Suleide   y conformada por quince miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de productos cometidos, pan, comida, artesanías y una mayoría se dedican al transporte público en vehículos o motocicletas. La competencia dentro del ambiente de trabajo de los socios es bastante duro por lo que ellos deben salir a trabajar diariamente para obtener un ingreso para el sustento de sus familias es por esta razón que desean financiar un nuevo crédito con nuestra institución para poder obtener productos con mayor demanda y así mejor sus ingresos los socios dedicados al trasporte dispondrán de los fondos para la reparación de sus vehículos que son su fuente de ingresos diario. Una mayoría de las socias de este grupo ya participaron en grupos solidarios anteriores por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo de nuestra Institución sabiendo que se necesita responsabilidad y cumplimiento para gozar de la confianza que les brida la Fundición Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group known as Pura Vida is represented by Sra. Delfina Suleide and includes fifteen members who sell products that they make at home such as bread, meals, crafts or, like the majority, provide public transportation services by car or motorcycle. The competition that the members face is so ferocious that they must work hard every day to bring home enough money to support their families. They're applying for a new loan from our institution so that they can get the products most in demand and thereby improve their incomes. The members that provide public transportation services will use the funds to repair their respective vehicles, the source of their daily incomes. A majority of the members of this group were members of community banks before so they know how our institution works and understand that they need to be responsible and fulfill the terms of the loan in order to enjoy the trust that Fundacion Agrocapital places in them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Frans Tamayo Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Frans Tamayo esta representado por la señora Martha  y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales en su mayoría a la venta D. comida, refrescos y a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, entre los varones se dedican al servicio D. moto taxis. A pesar D. ser un grupo relativamente nuevo conocen como trabajar con grupos solidarios y cuentan con la experiencia crediticia en otras instituciones similares a al Fundación Agrocapital. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para poder tener un producto D. calida para ofrecer a sus clientes así como para la compra D. repuestos para los socios que trabajan como matotaxistas ya que necesitan tener un vehículo en buen estado para realizar su trabajo y poder llevar a casa los ingresos generados durante el día. La competencia en el rubro comercial es alto pero cada uno D. los socios tiene una familia que mantener ya que D. ellos depenD. su bien estar, es por esta razón que saben como cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad a sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The Frans Tamayo group is represented by Sra. Martha and includes 12 members who operate various busineses, most of which entail sales of food, cold drinks and clothing items or, among the men, moto-taxi services. Despite being a relatively new group, they know how community banks work and they have experience with institutions like Fundacion Agrocapital. The loan will be used to buy supplies and materials necessary for the members' various businesses. For example, spare parts for the members that operate moto-taxi services since they have to keep their vehicles in good order to operate their business and generate an income for their families from day to day. The competition in their lines of work is high but each one of the members has a family to support and that's why they understand how important it is to be responsible and honest in dealing with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Hilda Esperanza P. es una mujer que ha trabajado desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de cacahuate en las diferente ruta que corren en la capital. Con las ganancias logro poner una pulpería pequeña que ha venido aumentando su inventario desde hace dos años, ella tiene 35 años y reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino con tres hijos. Sus planes  es crear mejoras en la edificación de su vivienda brindando mayor seguridad y protección a su familia. El préstamo que solicitad en Afodenic tendrán como fines un incremento en su inventario y alcanzar un porcentaje mayor en las utilidades con la compra de productos como: granos básicos, vegetales y frutas, abarrotes y otros productos. Los cuales  generaran las ganancias esperadas para seguir invirtiendo y formando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Dona Hilda Esperanza P. started working as a young girl, selling peanuts on the sides of the streets of the capital.
