With her earnings, she managed to set up a small general store that she's been slowly building up over the last two years. She is 35 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with [her?] three children. Her plan is to make improvements to her house that will make her family safer. The loan that she's soliciting from Afodenic will be used to build her inventory and get a better discount for the products that she buys, e.g., basic grains, vegetables, fruits, groceries and other products. In turn, she expects to increase her earnings so that she can continue investing and building a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "San Francisco" esta representado por la señora Irene,  es un grupo nuevo que cuenta con 12 integrantes  las mayorías de las socias tienen experiencia porque han trabajado en anteriores grupo y se han integrado nuevas socias,  de manera que son personas con ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante. En general las socias se dedican a actividades comerciales de venta de empanadas, ropa, cosméticos y a prestar servicios de empleadas y chóferes. el destino del crédito es para empezar nuevos negocios y hacer crecer los que ya tienen obteniendo un capital para la compra de mercaderías e insumos así como herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The San Francisco community bank is represented by Sra. Irene. It's a new group that includes 12 members, most of whom have experience with community banking because they've been members of other groups before. There are new members, as well, and all of them want to work and get ahead. The members operate various businesses selling products such as empanadas, clothing, and cosmetics or providing services such as cleaning or public transportation. The loan will be used to start new businesses and to grow those that have already received capital, money that has been used to buy merchandise and supplies, work tools, for example, that help them to increase their incomes and, in turn, improve the lives of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: William Fernando

texts.es: Don William Fernando Martínez Cortes, casado y tiene dos hijos, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino se desempeña como conductor en una empresa privada desde hace dos años, su esposa trabaja como costurera por cuenta propia en su domicilio. Unos de los proyectos para veneficio de su hogar es la culminación de su vivienda; colocando ladrillos en la sala y realizar unas divisiones en los cuartos, brindándoles comodidad a su esposa e hijos. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha realizado cambios en su hogar y espera seguir haciendo las mejora para tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. William Fernando Martínez Cortes, married with two children, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He has served as a driver in a private business for twelve years, and his wife is self-employed and works as a seamstress at home. Some of the projects that will benefit and complete their home are laying bricks in the living room and making divisions for the rooms, providing comfort for his wife and children. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he has made many changes to their house and he expects to continue making improvements in order to have a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to construct divisions and to lay bricks in his home.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: La señora Sandra Isabel S., se desempeña de docente desde hace veinte años, en un colegio público, también vende frijoles, hielo y helados en su casa para que le generen otros ingresos. Tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, con un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia la primaria, su esposo trabaja como ebanista por cuenta propia, con este crédito es su octavo ciclo y va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su casa en la terminación de un cuarto, da las gracias afodenic por los beneficios que ha otorgado a su familia y los Nicaragüenses. Sus planes a futuro es poner una pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra Isabel S. has been working as a teacher in a public secondary school for the last 20 years. She also sells frijoles, ice and ice cream from her house to earn some extra income. She is 47 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with her 9-year-old son who is in primary school. Her husband works as an independent cabinetmaker. This will be her eighth loan and she is going to invest it in the purchase of construction materials in order to make some improvements to her house by finishing off a room. She is thankful to AFODENIC for the benefits they have made possible for her family and the Nicaraguan people. Her plans for the future are to open a grocery store.

Link to Previous Loan

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Darlin Celeste

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Darlin Celeste S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de carne en su propio establecimiento situado en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la carne y para ello espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio de venta de carne en su localidad.
texts.en:
At the Chinandega Central Market, Darlin Celeste S. sells meat in her own establishment, situated in the Central market of the city Chinandega. Now she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan with which to buy meat. She hopes and trusts that this loan will be granted, and help her keep her business selling meat in her local area afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts and under skirts

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Cáceres, tiene 29 años de edad, habitante de Barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada, su esposo se desempeña como mecánico y le ayuda con los gasto, tiene cuatro hijos.
Doña Maria inicio su pequeño negocio de variedad desde hace cinco años con fondos propios y de cantidades pequeñas. Con muchos esfuerzos a logrado mantenerse en el mercado ya que requiere de mayores cantidades de productos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar productos como: ropa para damas y caballeros, cosméticos, perfumes entre otros generándole un porcentaje mayor de utilidades. Con esto espera obtener captación de clientes nuevos y fortalecer su inventario para poder ahorrar y mejorar su casa ya que es uno de sus ahnelos el podeer vivir en una casa digna con mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cáceres, 29, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married, and her husband works as a mechanic. He helps her with the expenses. They have four children. Five years ago, with her own funds and small quantities, Maria started her small convenience store . With great effort she has been able to stay in the market. She now needs larger quantities of products. Thanks to a loan with Afodenic she will be able to buy products like clothing for men and women, cosmetics, perfume, and others that will generate a larger percentage of profits. With this she hopes to gain new customers and strengthen her inventory to be able to save and improve her house. One of her goals is to be able to live in a decent house with better conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for women and men and cosmetics

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa H. se dedica a su ardua tarea de venta de ropa el cual atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en su localidad siendo este su negocio que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia.

Actualmente ella requiere de la compra de la ropa para continuar en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa Hernandez works very hard in her clothing sales business. She works every day in her community starting very early in the morning because this business allows her to support her family. At the moment she needs to purchase clothing to continue her business so she has turned to CEPRODEL to request a loan so her she can get ahead with her business which really needs this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
José Eduardo Z. R. es un  joven señor de 21 años de edad, soltero y vive  actualmente solo con su madre, su padrastro y sus dos hermanos.

La comunidad en la cual vive José Eduardo se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 
Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Como parte de las respuestas a esa situación, desde hace dos años se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce, hecho que motivó a José Eduardo  a iniciar en la producción de leche para luego venderla a esta planta. 

Asegura que su familia  se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
El queso de la región donde vive José Eduardo es famoso en todo Costa Rica. Es un queso fresco que se le conoce tradicionalmente como “queso tipo Turrialba”. A los “ticos” (como se les conoce a los habitantes de Costa Rica) les gusta mucho consumir este producto; se le encontrará en las mesas acompañando cualquier tipo de comida.  Por esta razón, el mercado para dicho producto es realmente bueno.

José Eduardo desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera y poder iniciar con su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante esto es una de las cosas que lo motiva a esforzarse y trabajar con mucho esmero. 

José Eduardo es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
José Eduardo Z. R. is a young gentleman of 21 years of age, single and currently lives with his mother, stepfather and two brothers. The community where he lives is called El Sauce de Santa Teresita of Turrialba, Cartago Province. It is a small rural community of about two thousand inhabitants. They are engaged in milk production and coffee planting. It has an irregular topography and is kept as a moist tropical forest. The community has very picturesque landscapes that combine the beautiful tropical forest gaps with coffee plantations and dairy farms. El sauce is located about an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the nearest trading center. However, several times a year the road becomes impassable due to the rains that hit the area. This is undoubtedly one of the main challenges for the community. When there were no activities many people chose to leave to look for work in Turrialba or at banana plantations located in the Atlantic zone of Costa Rica. Currently the prices of coffee and milk have improved, so the neighbors look how to invest in projects in the same area and in this way avoid migration. As part of the response to this situation, a cheese processing plant was established since two years ago. It is owned by the Milk Producers' Association of El Sauce, which motivated José Eduardo to start in milk production and sell it to this plant. His family has been in this activity for long time, so he has experienced all the care it demands, in addition to the instruction given by their family members over time. The cheese from the region where José Eduardo lives is famous throughout Costa Rica. It is a fresh cheese that is traditionally known as "cheese type Turrialba”. For the "Ticos" (as the people of Costa Rica are known), they love to consume this product, you'll find in the tables accompanying any kind of food. For this reason, the market for this product is really good. José Eduardo wants to obtain a micro loan of ¢ 500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy a cow and be able to start his business and be a successful micro-business owner and help his family to keep going, this is one of the things that motivates him to strive and work very hard. José Eduardo is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, one of 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and he hopes to continue to grow personally and financially. He also stays that with this type of organizations and facilitators of credit he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es: La Señora. Rosa Rodríguez tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijos, casada su esposo le ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Tiene como planes iniciales la culminación de su vivienda. Doña Rosa de profesión secretaria ejecutiva laborando en una empresa privada con siete años de experiencia. Las dificultades que ha encontrado para terminar la construcción es que los materiales han aumentado de precios y el salario muy bajo. Gracias a los financiamientos de préstamos en Afodenic ha logrado construir parte de su vivienda y el fin de este préstamo es continuar las mejoras y construcción de su casa comprando los materiales necesarios como: cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos y reglones para poner las ventanas y puertas.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa R. is 37 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of her city. She has two children and is married. Her husband helps her with the household expenses. Her initial plan is to finish her house. Ms. Rosa has seven years of experience working as an executive secretary in a private business. She has encountered difficulties in finishing the construction of her house because the price of materials has increased and salaries are very low. Thanks to financing from AFONDENIC loans, she has succeeded in building part of her house and this current loan is destined for the purchase of materials necessary to continue the construction of her house such as cement, iron, zinc, nails and materials to put in the windows and doors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Amada Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Amanda L. se dedica desde hace 17 años a su negocio de venta de mariscos de todo tipo siendo comercializados en su establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora Amanda hoy en día requiere de la compra de los mariscos para comercializarlos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así continuar en su negocio logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Amanda L. has dedicated herself to her seafood selling business for the past 17 years. She sells all kinds of seafood from her stall at the central market in the city of Chinandega. It is important to emphasize that right now Ms. Amanda needs to buy seafood for resale, and so she has turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan to be able to continue her business and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Marlene Ines

texts.es: Muy contenta se encuentra la señora Marlene T. porque gracias a sus esfuerzos en su negocio de venta de golosinas ha logrado salir adelante beneficiando a su familia. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente comerciante en su localidad pero tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las golosinas y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.
texts.en:
Marlene T. is very happy because, thanks to her efforts in her business of selling sweets, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. In her area she is know to be an excellent businesswoman. But, she needs to invest in her business. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy sweets. This way she can get ahead in her business, which needs immediate investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets

loans.name: Judith Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Judith M. tiene 33 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos ambos estudiantes. Los planes para su familia es tener estabilidad económica y social. Reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua. Doña Judith tiene su pequeño negocio de variedad en el cual vende ropas y repostería, inicio vendiendo ropa en pocas cantidades y al pasar del tiempo inicio con las venta de repostería desde hace siete años tiene su negocio, las dificultades que ha encontrado son la falta de ingreso para invertir y la disminución en las ventas. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic brindara mayores cantidades de producto y variedad en ellos con la compra de productos como: zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos, entre otros los cuales le generan mayores utilidades y brindarle mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Judith M., 33, is married with two kids, both students. Her plans for her family are to have economic and social stability. She lives in the Memorial Sandina neighborhood in the city of Managua. Mrs. Judith has her own variety store where she sells clothes and baked goods. She started selling clothes in small quantities and as time went by she began selling baked goods. She's had her business for seven years, and the difficulties she's encountered are the lack of income to invest and a drop in sales. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic she'll be able to get larger quantities of products and a greater variety, such as: shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, etc., which will offer her a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, perfumes, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Candida D. se dedica a la venta de especies en su propio tramo en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario vende sus productos a sus clientes que le visitan.

Ella es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener y para ello es que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las especies para preparar los alimentos y de esta manera mejorar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Candida Davila sells spices in her own stand at the central market in the city of Chinandega where she works, daily, selling products to clients who visit her. She is a single mother with two children to support. For this reason she has turned to CEPRODEL to obtain a loan for the purchase of spices to prepare food and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Spices

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina J. se dedica muy arduamente a atender su negocio de venta de ollas y peroles metálicos ubicándose a la intemperie en una esquina de la ciudad de Chinandega exponiéndose al sol y a la lluvia.

A pesar de todo esto ella ha sido una excelente madre habiendo mantenido a sus tres pequeños hijos que necesitan de su apoyo. Hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los productos y así ofertarlos en su localidad en el mercado central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Señora Luz Marina Jarquin works arduously running her business selling metal pots and pans on a street corner in the city of Chinandega. She works outside and is exposed to sun and rain. On top of all of this she has been an excellent mother, raising three small children who need her support. She will use the loan from Ceprodel to purchase merchandise to sell in the downtown market of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase metal pots and pans.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Señora. Maria B. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el barrio hialeah en la ciudad de Managua,  casada  su esposo es pensionado. Tiene una pulpería la cual le genera los ingresos, las dificultares que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento para el incremento del volumen de su venta. Su negocio lo tiene desde hace quince años iniciándolo con dinero propio y el apoyo de su esposo. Gracias a la oportunidad que le ha brindado los prestamos en Afodenic le a permitido poco a poco obtener mayores cantidades de productos con este préstamo va invertir en su negocio en la compra de: productos lácteos, productos de cosméticos y perfumería, también mayores cantidades de granos básicos, abarrotes e ingresar verduras y aumentar sus utilidades brindando mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria B. is 60 years old, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, and is married. Her husband is retired. She has a store which generates income but she has had difficulties because she lacks financing to increase the volume of sales. She started this business 15 years ago, initially financing with her own money and the support of her husband. Thanks to the opportunity that AFODENIC loans have provided her, she has been slowly purchasing larger quantities of products to sell. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of milk products, cosmetics and perfumes, and larger quantities of basic grains, groceries and vegetables to increase her revenues and improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, milk products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Basilia R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de artesanías de madera ofrecidas en su localidad el cual la posee muy surtida gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en su negocio.

Actualmente, el negocio requiere de una inversión por medio de la compra de los productos artesanos y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo por medio de dichas compras.
texts.en:
In Chinandega city, Ana Basilia R. sells hand-crafted wooden items from her store which she keeps well-stocked thanks to her many business efforts. Currently, the business requires an investment in additional wooden artisan works, and to do this she has sought the support of Ceprodel, requesting a loan to purchase these products so she can advance her business. Her store really needs Ceprodel's support, which can be provided with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of artisan works

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario A. P. es un señor de 57 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y un ahijado  en una comunidad llamada, El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que azotan la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. 

Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en la Zona Atlántica de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado, por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona y de esta forma evitar migrar.

Desde hace varios meses que Don Mario  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, el vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. El dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

Actualmente don Mario está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto el espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
Don Mario es socio de la Asociación de Productores del Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su quinto préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mario Aray P. is a 57 year-old man. He lives with his wife and godson in a community called El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the province of Cartago. It is a small, rural community with approximately two thousand residents. Its inhabitants work in milk production and planting coffee. It has an irregular landscape and much of the land is kept as a tropical rain forest. The community has picturesque landscapes that combine the rain forest with two beautiful lagoons, coffee plantations and creameries. El Sauce is located approximately an hour and a half by bus to Turrialba, the closest commercial center. Nevertheless, a few times a year the route becomes impassable because of the rains that hit the zone. This is without doubt one of the main challenges for the community. When there weren't any activities many people chose to leave and look for work in Turrialba in the banana farms located in the Atlantic coast of Costa Rica. Currently the price of milk and coffee have improved, therefore the residents are looking for how to invest in local projects and avoid migrating. For the past few months don Mario has worked on fattening up chickens and laying hens for the production of meat and eggs. He sells his products to the community residents who are very satisfied. He says that having the support and the help of his wife helps him continue with the project. Even more he says that the project interests him since he has seen his business grow bit by bit and demand is getting stronger. Currently don Mario is asking for a micro-credit of ¢500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy more chickens and hens, concentrate, and products for treating sicknesses, in addition to expanding and reinforcing his premises. With this he hopes to grow his business even more and improve his quality of life. He business is going well, but he hasn't been able to grow because of underfunding. With the loan that he is asking for he hopes to increase sales and thereby improve the economic condition of his family. Don Mario is a member of the Sauce Production Association, one of 100 organizational members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his fifth loan and with him EDESA hopes to continue to grow on a personal and economic level, along with actively participating in the credit organization in its community.

Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and goods

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Simona es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio 25 de Febrero en la ciudad de Managua, con cuatros hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfúmenes que inicio hace veintidós años, con dinero propio ya que vendía ambulante, ropa, zapatos, luego compro un vehiculo para movilizarse con la ventas, también comenzó ha hacer prestamos para incrementar su inventario. En Afodenic es su octavo ciclo y con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construccion
Sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que es muy sencilla de tabla y de zinc y necesita terminar de cerrarla para mejor seguridad de su famila.
texts.en:
Simona is a very hard working woman. She is 42, and she lives in the 25 de Febrero neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has four children. Her business is selling clothes, shoes, and perfume. She started her business twenty two years ago with her own money. She sold clothes and shoes door to door. Then she bought a vehicle to get around with her sales. She also started to get loans to increase her inventory. This is her eight loan cycle with Afodenic. With this loan she will buy construction materials. Her plans are to improve the conditions of her house. It is very simple; it is made of wooden planks and zinc sheeting. She needs to enclose it to make it more secure for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to enclose her house

loans.name: Edgar Vicente

texts.es: Edgar Vicente Téllez A. tiene la edad de 32 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Edgar tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de pollos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, Edgar dio inicio a este medio de vida por iniciativa propia y con el tiempo y dedicación a este negocio decide mantenerlo. Los propósitos de Edgar son de ofrecerles a sus clientes la mejor calidad de pollos, y a la mismo tiempo disfruta de conversar y atender a sus clientes. El financiamiento solicitado por Edgar es para la compra de mas pollos, concentrado, vacuna y vitaminas ya que ha demostrado la responsabilidad en todos sus pagos. El sueño de Edgar es incrementar cada día su producción y que su calidad de vida mejore, ya que siempre ha luchado para que su familia obtenga el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Edgar Vicente Téllez A. is single and 32 years old. He has two children who are in school. He sells chickens for a living. He has been working in this field for 3 years, which he started through his own initiative and with time and dedication he has decided to stick with it. Edgar's goals are to offer his customers the highest quality chickens, and at the same time to enjoy conversing with and serving his customers. The loan he is requesting is to purchase more chickens, feed, vaccines and vitamins. He has always been responsible with his payments. Edgar's dream is to increase his production every day, so that his quality of life improves, as he has always had to fight to feed his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maritza Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Q. se dedica a laborar en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario se esfuerza en su negocio de venta de alimentos elaborados por ella misma y ofrecidos a las personas que a diario visitan el Mercado.

Hoy en día ella tiene la necesidad de adquirir la materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y refrescos y por esto es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio ya que es una excelente cocinera.
texts.en:
Martza Q. works in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, where each day she sells homemade food to the people who visit the market. She now needs to purchase ingredients for making meals and drinks, and for this she has come to Ceprodel for support to obtain a loan. She wants her business to succeed and she is an excellent cook.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food

loans.name: Nidia Andrea

texts.es: La señora Nidia Andrea S. tiene 50 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad, que cursa la secundaria. Su negocio es una librería que administra desde hace cinco años, la cual inicio con ahorros y luego con prestamos para reforzar el inventario. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de cuadernos, libros, bolsos, útiles para escolares entre otros. Con esto espera mejorar las ventas y captar clientes, da las gracias a la institución por los logros obtenidos. Sus planes a futuro es poder dar los estudios a su hija para que sea una profesional, a si como hacer más grande el local de la librería.
texts.en:
Nidia Andrea S. is 50 years old. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of the city of Managua. She has one daughter who is 18 years old and in high school. Her business is a bookstore that she has been running for five years. She started it with savings and then obtained loans to increase her inventory. This is her fourth loan with Afrodenic, which she will use to purchase notebooks, books, bags, and school supplies, among other things. With this purchase she hopes to improve her sales and gain customers. She thanks the institution for the success she has experienced so far. Her future plans are to pay for her daughter's education, so she can have a profession, and to expand her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, books, bags to offer to customers

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta V. G. tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Rosa tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Rosa es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que comenzó con capital propio con muy pocos productos, sus principales clientes eran los alumnos y con el tiempo las personas comenzaron a pedirles otros productos. Los propósitos de Rosa son de mantener su negocio ya que a su avanzada edad es el único trabajo al que puede dedicarse. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo e invertir en la compra de productos como granos básicos, pollo, carne queso, gaseosas, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Sus sueños son que su pequeña pulpería logre convertirse en una distribuidora que ayude a suplir la necesidad de sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa Enriqueta V. G. is 66 years old and single. She has 4 children, who all work independently. Rosa has a small shop. She has run this business for more than 8 years, which she began with her own savings and very few products. Her primary customers were students and over time people began to request additional products. Rosa's goals are to keep her business running, as at her advanced age, it is the only work she can do. This loan is for capital investment to purchase products such as basic grains, chicken, meat, cheese, soft drinks, candy and juices. Her dreams are for her small shop to become a distributor that will help meet her neighbors' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Belinda C. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace 5 años siendo este su ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en edad escolar y por ende debe de mantener sus estudios.

Con mucha necesidad ha llegado a Ceprodel debido a que requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y una vez que los tenga ofertarlos para mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Belinda C. runs her small shop which she has had for 5 years. The income from her store is what she uses to support her family of two children. One of them is school-aged and she needs to pay for his studies. She has come to Ceprodel with great need and has requested a loan for the purchase of products to stock her shop, which she will then sell to improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: María Yadira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el Mercado Central, la señora María P. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa especialmente ropa interior ofrecida a la intemperie en una localidad del mercado.

Hoy en día la señora P. requiere de una inversión pronta para su negocio por lo que  ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de la ropa interior y de esta manera salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in the Central Market, Mrs. María P. tends her business of selling clothes. She sells underwear in the open air in the area of the market. P. needs an investment soon for her business. That is why she has gone to Ceprodel to ask for a timely loan to buy underwear. This is the manner in which she will get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Willian Enrique

texts.es: El señor William Enrique es un hombre trabajador que ha logrado sobresalir a delante con su negocio desde hace mas de ocho año tiene dos molinos en su casa de habitación el cual día a día trabaja, el compro los molinos con ahorros y parte de prestamos. Tiene 39 años de edad, reside en Lomas de Guadalupe en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,11 y 16 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Con este crédito quiere invertir en una pequeña pulpería que tiene en la compra de carnes, cereales, dulces y productos lácteos. Sus planes es poder seguir incrementando sus ventas y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
William Enrique is a very hard working man. He has been able to get ahead in his business. For more than eight years he has had two mills in his house. He works with them day to day. He bought the mills with savings and part of loans. He is 39, and he lives in Lomas de Guadalupe in the city of Managua. He and his wife have three children, 6, 11, and 16. The children are in school. With this loan he wants to invest in a small mini market that he has. He will buy meat, cereal, sweets, and dairy products. His plans are to be able to keep increasing his sales and to help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and cereal

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco S. vive en unión libre con la señora Adriana Mejia, por el momento no tienen hijos ya que desean irle proporcionando ciertas comodidades al hogar antes de que lleguen los hijos, y la familia crezca. 
El trabaja en una empresa como obrero en el área de producción desde hace 4 años; le gusta luchar por sus objetivos, demostrando ser una persona responsable. 
Su esposa no esta trabajando por el momento solo se queda a apoyarlo en el hogar. 
Juntos como una familia joven pero muy unida esta solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas, para mayor seguridad del hogar y desean pintar la casa también.
texts.en:
Francisco S. lives with his common-law wife Adriana Mejia. They do not have children yet as they would like to have certain comforts in their home prior to having children and the family growing. Francisco has been working for a company as a production worker for four years. He likes to fight to reach his goals, and he has shown himself to be responsible. His wife is not currently working and helps take care of the home. Together, as a young but very united family, they are requesting this loan to secure their doors and windows, for greater security in their home, and they also would like to paint their house as well.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Security and house painting

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Doña Josefa Antonia García, reside en un barrio de la capital Laureles Norte, tiene 55 años de edad, con cinco hijos mayores que habitan independiente, su esposo es jubilado y recibe su pensión. Este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic el cual ha invertido en hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado y no quiere mojarse en este invierno, ella es ama de casa y su esposo e hijos ayudan con los gastos para la alimentación como para dar el abono en la institución y poder seguir adelante con sus proyecciones.
texts.en:
Josefa Antonia García lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital. She is 55 years old and has five adult children who live independently. Her husband is retired and receives a pension. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic, which she has invested in home improvements. With this loan she is going to purchase construction materials to replace the roof, as it is in poor condition and she doesn't want to get wet this winter. She is a homemaker and her husband and children help with the expenses for meals as well as the deposit with the bank and to be able to move forward with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair the roof of her home with is in poor conditions

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El señor Israel C. vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, son una familia unida y muy responsable. 
El es propietario de un taller de carpintería fina, que tiene establecido desde hace 5 años; acaba de obtener un local para su taller un poco mas grande, pero le esta haciendo falta algunos detalles interiores, ya que le quiere dar otro acabado.
Este es el motivo por el cual esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Israel C. lives with his wife and their three children. They are a very close and responsible family. He is the owner of a fine carpentry workshop, which he has owned for 5 years. He just obtained a new location for his shop that is a little bit larger, but it lacks certain interior details. He would like to give the space a different finish, and is therefore requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of work location (home)

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Silvia Esperanza Torres tiene la edad de 35 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Silvia tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Silvia es la elaboración de elotes asados y cocidos, guirilas y refrescos. Hace más de 10 años que Doña Silvia se dedica a este tipo de negocio, y dio inicio por cuenta propia con pocos productos, vendiendo sandias y tajaditas de plátano, con el paso del tiempo a Doña Silvia le gusto este oficio y decidió vender elotes y guirila ya que le ayudaba a sufragar los gastos de su casa. Los propósitos de Doña  Silvia son de incrementar cada día la producción de sus productos para que su negocio siga creciendo. El financiamiento de Silvia es destinado para capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de elotes, maíz, leña entre otros. Los deseos de Silvia son de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia para que no le falte nada y además proporcionarle a sus hijos la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Silvia Esperanza Torres is 35 years old and married. She has 4 children who are all in school. Her business is preparing roasted and boiled corn, corn tortillas, and drinks. She has been running her business for over 10 years. She started on her own with few products, selling watermelons and plantain chips. As time passed, Silvia liked what she was doing and decided to sell corn and corn tortillas, which helped cover her home expenses. Silvia's goals are tin increase her production each day so that her business continues to grow. The loan she is requesting is for capital investment in her work, and to purchase corn on the cob, cornmeal, and firewood, among other things. Silvias dreams are to improve the quality of life for her family so that they do not lack anything and to help her children as necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital investment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Urania tiene 48 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, su esposo compra y vende autos, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de los semáforos el Riguerro 4 c abajo, ella tiene un taxi que desde hace cinco años lo trabaja, el cual compro con ayuda de su esposo y luego lo inscribieron en una cooperativa para trabajarlo de taxi. Este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado con las mejoras para su vivienda, con este préstamo va  a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto. Sus planes a es poder comprar otro vehiculo y cambiar el que tiene para dar un mejor servicio al publico.
texts.en:
Urania is 48 years old, married, and has two children, ages 8 and 10. Her husband buys and sells cars. They live in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, 4 blocks below the traffic lights at el Riguerro. She has had a taxi service for five years. She purchased the vehicle with help from her husband and they joined a cooperative to provide taxi services. This is her fifth loan with Afodenic which she has used to make home improvements. With this loan she is going to pruchase construction materials to add on a room. Her plans are to be able to purchase another vehicle and replace the one she has to provide better service to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to add on a room

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen V. tiene 48 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos son independientes. La actividad económica de Doña Carmen es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que esta es la mejor manera de buscar a los clientes. Por lo que inicio este negocio porque tenía proporcionarles a sus hijos estabilidad en sus estudios, Doña Carmen no poseía muchos productos cuando comenzó. El propósito de para su negocio es crecer poco a poco y establecerse en determinado lugar. El financiamiento es para suministrar su negocio ya que necesita expandirse en otras líneas debido a la demanda de parte de sus clientes. Por lo que gustaría establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un medio de supervivencia para el futuro.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen V. is a 48 year old single mother. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are grown. Carmen has been selling clothing for more than 5 years. She is a street vendor as this is the best way to seek out customers. She began this business because she had to fund her children’s education; Carmen didn’t have many products when she began. Her goal is to grow her business little by little and establish herself in a fixed locale. The financing for her business is to expand into other lines based on her customer’s demands. She would like to open a clothing store in her home so that her children have a way to earn a living in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora. Simona tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda económicamente. Con esfuerzo su esposo y doña Simona han ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco, pero faltan otros detalles que son necesarios para la seguridad de la familia.Se desempeña como domestica desde hace 4 años brindando su servicio, es un trabajo honesto y el cual ella adquiere un bien económico para su familia. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograr aumentar un cuarto de su casa, comprar materiales como: cemento, ladrillos, hierro, zinc, reglones, entre otros para comenzar a hacer las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Simona is 39 years old, lives in the Enrique Bermúdez neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two children ages 14 and 16, her husband also works. With effort Simona and her husband have little by little built a home, but they are missing some details needed for their family’s security. She has worked as a domestic employee for 4 years providing her service, which is an honest job and with which she earns a good income for her family. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she can add a room to her home, buying materials such as: cement, bricks, steel, zinc and more to begin making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to finish a room added to her home

loans.name: Mirna Apariza

texts.es: Mirna Apariza Gómez M. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Mirna tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Doña Mirna se dedica a la actividad económica de Doña Mirna es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante por lo que inicio por cuenta propia ya que anteriormente trabajaba como maestra y su salario no cubría todos los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada. Es por eso que le propósito de Mirna es comprar lo suficiente para abastecer la demanda. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta Managua o Chinandega ya que es aquí donde es favorable la compra de ropa usada. Los sueños de Mirna son de establecer una tienda de ropa usada con un excelente inventario.
texts.en:
Mirna Apariza Gómez M. is 58 years old and married. Mirna has 4 children and they all work. Mirna has been selling used clothing for more than 3 years. She is a street vendor, and began her business on her own after working as a teacher and her salary didn’t cover all her household expenses so she decided to sell used clothing. Mirna plans on buying sufficient inventory to meet her demand. She is seeking financing for working capital to be able to travel to Managua or Chanindega where the prices for used clothing are more favorable. Mirna dreams of opening a used clothing store with an extensive inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia O. se dedica ala venta de ropa, cosmético, perfumenes desde hace ocho años. Tiene 35 años de edad, reside en el barrio Anexo Riguero en la capital de Managua, tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 7,14 y 16 años de edad, los cuales estudian, su esposo es cadete de taxi. Su negocio lo inicio con dinero propio, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra productos de cosmético, ropa y productos de consumo diario para la pulpería, y poder vender mas. Sus planes es poder aumentar su inventario, para crecer y así ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
For the past eight years Karla Patricia O. has made a living selling clothing, cosmetics, and perfume. She is 35 years old, and lives in the Anexo Riguero neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She has four children, ages 3, 7, 14, and 16, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver. She started her business with her own money, and wants to use this loan to invest in the purchase of cosmetic products, clothing, and products for daily consumption so that she can sell more at her small store. Her plan is to increase her inventory so that her business will grow and thus help her school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and products for daily consumption to increase her inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia S. es una señora que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos, uno de ellos se sentía mal y lo llevo al lugar donde ella tiene las atenciones necesarias que se le dan ala familia. Pero con el medicamento que le están dando no ha tenido mejoría y quiere llevarlo a un particular. La señora desesperada acude a nosotros en pedir un préstamo a menor plazo para llevarlo con un pediatra uno de los mejores doctores de la ciudad para que revise a su hijo y le de los medicamentos que le quiten ese malestar
texts.en:
Julia S. is a woman who worries about the well-being of her children. One of them was feeling badly, and she took him to the place where he could get the necessary attention. But with the medication they are giving him, he has not improved and she wants to take him to a specialty clinic. She is desperate and is turning to us to ask for a short-term loan so she can take him to a better pediatrician in the city so he/she can take care of her son and give him the proper medication to cure him of his illness.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a specialist doctor for her son.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena Q. C. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Martha tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la elaboración de comida. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Martha inicio este negocio por su Mama ya que anteriormente ella se hacia cargo y por no dejar inactivo el negocio le dijo a su hija Martha que continuara con el negocio. Los propósitos de Martha para su negocio son de mejorar la calidad de su comida para obtener más clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo comprar granos básicos para la elaboración de gallo pinto, tortas rellenas, enchiladas, maduro, queso y huevo cosido. El sueño de Martha es convertir su pequeño negocio en un restaurante para que sus hijos tengan un porvenir para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena Q. C. is 36 and single. Doña Martha has three children, all of whom are in school. She makes a living by preparing food. She has done this for more than 30 years. Martha started her business because of her mother, who previously owned the business, and to keep it from becoming inactive, she told Martha to continue it. Martha's goal for her business is to improve the quality of her food to obtain more customers. The financing will go towards working capital such as purchasing basic grains to make gallo pinto (a dish with rice and beans), cakes, enchiladas, cheese, and eggs. Martha's dream is to convert her small business into a restaurant so her children will have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Primitiva Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Primitiva del Carmen E. tiene 52 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Primitiva tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña primitiva es una Señora muy trabajadora y luchadora y además le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que este le ha dado lo necesario para sacar adelante a su familia. Los propósitos de Primitiva  son de mejorar la condición su negocio y ampliar el lugar y así proporcionarle mas progreso. El financiamiento es utilizado para la compra de cerdos ya que tiene que recorrer la comunidad en busca de los mejores cerdos y encontrarlos a buen precio y así ofrecerles a sus clientes nacatamales, frito y carne del cerdo. El sueño de Primitiva es mantener la ayuda con Fundación León 2000 por que es por medio de ella que las organizaciones amigas ha obtenido la ayuda necesaria para sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Primitiva del Carmen E. is 52 and married. She has 4 children, all of whom work. She makes a living by butchering pigs. She has done this for more than 12 years. She is very hard-working and likes her job, which has given her what she needs to take care of her family. Her goals are to improve her business and to expand her location so she can make more progress with her work. She will use the financing to purchase more pigs since she has to travel throughout the community to find the best pigs at a good price so she can offer her customers tamales and pork. Her dream is to keep Fundación León 2000's support because through them, their partner organizations have obtained the necessary help to keep their businesses going.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José A. Márquez no aparece en la foto ya que el se encontraba trabajando.
Su señora Yazmín Robledo Garza tiene un negocio llamado “Miscelánea Yazmín”  con este negocio ya tiene 5 años. Aunque es pequeño ella vende de todo por el momento la situación en su negocio es por que no ha podido invertirle por que la situación de la ciudad se puso un poco difícil y su esposo que le ayuda con los gastos. Ellos quieren capital para comprar mercancía para que la gente vea más diversidad y se vayan contentos con el producto que el cliente necesite.
Esta familia esta formada por cinco personas la señora, el señor y sus tres hijos por lo que están trabajando para darles mejor educación.
texts.en:
Juan Jose A. M. does not appear in the photo because he was working. His wife Yazmin Robledo Garza has a business called “Miscellaneous Yasmin”, she’s had this business for five years. Even though the business is small she sells lots of variety of products, at this moment because of the bad economic situation in the city, she hasn’t been able to invest much in it, it’s a difficult situation for her and her husband who helps with the expenses. They want some capital to purchase merchandise to give clients more variety and make them happy when they find the products they need. This family is formed by five people, wife, husband and three children for whom they are working to provide a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda Suárez Martínez tiene la edad de 73 años, su estado civil soltera. Doña Imelda tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Imelda es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Imelda inicio por cuenta propia, además lo mas efectivo para ella es la venta de casa en casa y además en su casa de habitación tiene ciertas prendas para que sus clientes lleguen a su vivienda y este ha sido una de las actividades que mas le gusta. Los propósitos de Imelda son de mantener a sus clientes y proporcionarle lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento que solicita Imelda es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que viajar a León o Managua y así obtener la compra de la ropa favorable. El sueño de Imelda es de establecer un lugar que represente las condiciones necesarias para presentar sus productos.
texts.en:
Imelda Suárez Martínez is 73 years of age and her civil state is single. Doña Imelda has four children and they are all working. Imelda's economic activity is the sales of used clothing. Since three years ago she has been dedicated to this business. Doña Imelda began working on her own. The most effective thing for her has been making sales from house to house, as well as having a room in her house for certain articles of clothing so that her clients can come to her home, and this has been the activity that she likes best. Imelda proposes to keep her clients and provide them with what they request. The financing that Imelda requests is for working capital since she has to travel to León or Managua and in this way obtain the favored clothing. Imelda's dream is to establish a space with the necessary conditions for displaying her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aenahon

texts.ru: Энахон активная клиентка Микроинвест. За время сотрудничества она значительно расширила свой бизнес и займы, которые она получала, использовала целенаправленно. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей, когда Энахон ездит за товаром. Сейчас торговое место Энахон расположено в центральном торговом центре города. Недавно этот торговый центр отремонтировали и с предпринимателей арендующих торговые точки собирали определенные вклады для этого. Это немного уменьшило капитал бизнеса Энахон, и поэтому она решила подать заявку на займ и расширить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Aenahon is an active client of MicroInvest. During this collaboration, she significantly expanded her business and used her loans purposefully. Her older daughter helps with the business when Aenahon leaves to get her product. Currently, Aenahon’s store is located at the city central shopping center. This shopping center was recently remodeled, and funds for remodeling were collected from all businesses leasing space there. This slightly decreased Aenahon’s business capital. This is why she decided to request a loan and expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand goods assortment

loans.name: Sunatjon

texts.ru: Сунатжон раньше работал в местном заводе строительных материалов. Одновременно со своей работой открыл маленькую торговую точку и стал продавать там строительные материалы. Постепенно полностью переключился на занятие предпринимательством и сейчас успешно им занимается. В МикроИнвест кредитуется уже 2 года. Недавно он подал заявку на получение нового займа и собирается приобрести оптовую партию цемента и алебастра.
texts.en:
Sunatjon used to work at a local construction material plant. At that time, along with work, he opened a small retail store and started selling construction materials there. Gradually, he focused on his business full-time and is now successful at it. Sunatjon has been collaborating with MicroInvest for 2 years. He recently requested a new loan and plans to purchase additional inventory of cement and alabaster wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of alabaster and cement

loans.name: Nizomchon

texts.ru: Год назад Низомчон получил свой первый займ в МикроИнвест. Он занимается закупкой и хранением сухофруктов. Когда цена увеличивается он продает и извлекает прибыль для содержания семьи. В этом году вместе со своими друзьями Низомчон решил развернуть новый вид бизнеса – они решили открыть профессиональную студию, спектром услуг которой, является оказание услуг по обслуживанию свадеб и различных торжеств, запись и монтаж свадеб на кассеты и DVD диски, создание фонограмм для местных исполнителей и тд. Собственный капитал был вложен в аппаратуру для студии. Подсчитав расходы друзья обнаружили что необходимо приобрести 2 компьютера и монтажный пульт. Поэтому решили подать заявку на займ в МикроИнвест.
texts.en:
Nizomchon received his first loan at MicroInvest one year ago. He is involved in buying and storage of dried fruits. When prices go up, he sells and makes a profit to support his family. This year, together with his friends, Nizomchon decided to start a new type of business. They decided to open a professional studio that will provide wedding and other event services, recording and montage of weddings to cassettes and DVD disks, sound recording for local artists, etc. Own capital was invested into equipment for the studio. However, once all the expenses were calculated, Nizomchon and his friends discovered that they needed to purchase 2 computers and a montage remote control. This is why they decided to request a loan at MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 computers

loans.name: Hayothon

texts.ru: Хаётхон работает в местной частной сауне. Это очень известное место в городе и в течении года постоянно многолюдно. Жители города приходят сюда мыться, здесь же есть парикмахерская, где можно подстричься. Кроме общего зала можно заказать номер и тут же предлагаются прохладительные напитки. Сама Хаётхон находится на столе заказов, где она принимает заказы, распределяет по номерам и кроме этого она содержит маленький магазинчик, где все желающие могут купить гигиенические товары, полотенца, мыло, шампуни и тп. Хаётхон получает займ в МикроИнвест для этой цели. Она подала заявку на новый займ и собирается приобрести товар для своего магазина.
texts.en:
Hayothon works at a local spa. It is a well-known place in the city that attracts many people all year round. Local citizens come here to wash and also to get haircuts at the on-site hair salon. Besides a common area, the spa also offers private suites that come with refreshing drinks. Hayothon works at the booking table where she accepts reservations and assigns private suites. Besides this, she also runs a small store that sells personal hygiene products, towels, soap, shampoo, etc. Hayothon wants to obtain a loan at MicroInvest for this purpose. She requested a new loan and plans to purchase goods for her store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of goods for a store

loans.name: Inoyathon

texts.ru: Иноятхон занимается куплей продажей промышленных товаров в местном центральном универмаге. Она занимается предпринимательством уже несколько лет и этим содержит свою семью. Иноятхон 40 лет, она воспитывает 3 детей. В МикроИнвест свой первый получила для покупки мебели для дома. Погасила займ своевременно. Условия кредитования здесь понравились, и она решила получить новый займ. Она собирается приобрести для своего младшего сына комплект спутниковых антенн, телевизор и подставку для него.
texts.en:
Inoyathon is involved in buying and selling of industrial products at the local central supermarket. She has been in this business for several years and has been able to support her family. Inoyathon is 40 years old and has 3 children. She received her first loan at MicroInvest for a purchase of furniture for her home. She repaid that loan in a timely manner. Because she liked the lending terms here, Inoyathon decided to obtain another loan. She plans to purchase a satellite antenna, a television and a television stand for her youngest son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a satellite antenna, a television and a television stand

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes V. is a fish vendor. She has been selling fish since 1999. Her husband is a fisherman. All of their own catch is intended for family consumption. Lourdes earns money from fish that she sells at the market. She buys fish from fisherman and earns 40% mark-up value when sold.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials and fish to sell. The loan will definitely help her sell more fish. Hence, more income for the family.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to help them start and own businesses. CEVI gives more than just loans. Training and insurance coverage is provided as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and fish to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura C. is engaged in fish selling. She is 42 years old and has five children. She started her business in 2000. Her husband, Virgilo C., is a fisherman. They work very hard to support their family. Aside from fish, she also sells pigs. She raises pigs at the back of the house. Laura hopes that some day she will be able to make her business grow and send all her children to college. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fish to sell. Some of the loan will also be used to buy pig feed and piglets. The loan will help Laura grow her fish business and piggery as well.

CEVI aims to help small businesses grow. CEVI gives not just credit assistance. Training and insurance coverage are provided as well.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell as well as pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Katuma B Rukudo Jolly Group

texts.en:
Jolly R. is 36 years old and married with three children. She also cares for two dependents. All the children are attending school.

Jolly has been selling used clothes for over ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to increase her stock. She is an active woman whose dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of used clothing.

loans.name: Rose Ndagire‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 5 member group. She is a 31 year old single mother of four children aged between 4 and 16 years. All her children go to school. She resides and rents a three-roomed house where she is staying with six people. Rose takes care of additional family members (Parents). There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Rose runs a bar selling local gin in Nakulabye. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Rose buys clothing from suppliers who get them from villages and doesn’t incur extra transport costs.

Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity and school fees. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenges are defaulters and rental charges. Rose has been with MCDT for over four years and is servicing her eighth loan, working this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerricans of local gin and aspires to owning a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more jerricans of local gin

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita D. T. owns a small shop. She sells spare parts. Her husband, Anito D. T., is an engine mechanic. They work very hard to support their family. Aside from having a shop, she sells coconut wine. It's a natural wine and is very popular in Bohol. Teresita is 50 years old and has 2 children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a toolkit for his business. The loan will really help her and her whole family increase their income.

CEVI provides not just loans to all their clients, they also give training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy toolkit and spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Katuma B Keitesi Irene Group

texts.en:
K. Irene is 31 years of age, married with five children and looking after two dependants who are all in school. She has owned the banana plantations for over 16 years. It has been generating income for her from selling the bananas, for example, she sells 50 or more bunches of bananas daily.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana plantations. She is a hard working woman whose dream is to obtain a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for banana plantations.

loans.name: Nulu Nakakande‘S Group

texts.en:
Nulu is the leader of the five members of the group. She is 48 years old and married with three children aged between 23 and 30. They are all married. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Nulu doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Nulu runs a hotel in Wankulukuku, one of the city suburbs. She sells meals to an average of 30 people a day, and works seven days a week. Nulu’s major monthly expenses include rent for the business, electricity and medication. She doesn’t incur extra transport cost to and from shopping as she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for the last six years and sells to all categories of people. Her main challenges are increasing prices of meat and competition. Prior to this business Nulu sold sugar cane.

Nulu has been with MCDT (Micro Credit for Development and Transformation) for over five years and is requesting her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to pay rent for her business premises and also to buy more food for her restaurant. Nulu is aspiring to own two eating joints in town.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restauarnt and to pay rent

loans.name: Katuma B Asimwe Annet Group

texts.en: A. Annet is 30 years old. She is married and has three children; two of them are studying. She has been buying and selling produce for over three years. She will use this loan to purchase beans, cassava flour, bananas, and millet. She is an active, hard-working woman whose dream is to work hard and prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase beans, cassava flour, bananas and millet.

loans.name: Katete E Namatovu Jiras Group

texts.en:
N. Jiras is a 40-year-old single woman. She has four children and also takes care of three additional dependents. Five of the children go to school.

She has been operating her business of tailoring for over fifteen years. She will use this loan to purchase material for tailoring (bitengi, Gomes’s and other clothing). She is a hard-working woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material for tailoring

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
N. Leonard is the leader of Bwagonga Eco Bakyara Tukwatanise in Ibanda. She is a friendly and hard-working 40-year-old widow with 6 children aged 5-18 years. Leonard also cares for 2 orphans. All the children are in school from S.6 – P.1.

Leonard is a farmer who has been selling agricultural produce for 4 years. Mostly she sells matooke, which is used for making a local dish once boiled. In doing her business, she is faced with a challenge of debts: some of her customers come and load trucks of produce but make only partial payments, which sometimes affects her business and money flow. She hopes to expand her business as well as attain the best education for her children and all those that she cares for.

loans.use: Buying more produce (matoke) for sale.

loans.name: Phiona Assimire ‘S Group

texts.en:
Phiona is the leader of a group with 5 members. She is 28 years old and married with three children aged between 1 1/2 and 9 years. Two of her children go to school, and the other one is still young. She owns a five-room house where she lives with eight people. Phiona doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her house has no electricity but there is piped water. The family gets three meals a day.

Phiona resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Phiona sells second-hand clothes in Namungoona Market (one of the city's suburbs). She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and works six days a week. Phiona’s major monthly expenses include rent for the business, school fees, and medication. She incurs extra transport costs traveling to and from Kampala to shop. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Phiona’s main challenges are the increasing prices of goods and competition. Phiona has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mates the whole time. She wants to use this loan partly to pay school fees for her children and partly to buy more clothes for resale. Phiona aspires to own a container full of second-hand clothes. .

loans.use: To buy more clothes and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Darsia Yenneyra

texts.es: Darsia Yenneyra  M. H.  vive en Cojutepeque departamento Cuscatlán, Darsia está casada y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad llamada Damaris, Darsia vive en casa de su suegra junto a su esposo e hija;  Alexander el esposo de Darsia es empleado y ayuda económicamente a su familia, Darsia también trabaja, ya que tras el nacimiento de su hija los gastos han incrementado;  esto hizo que Darsia tuviera la idea de trabajar y fue  así como se lanzo a alquilar un pequeño local y poner su sala de belleza, Darsia solita un crédito para compra de productos de belleza para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Darsia Yenneyra M. H. lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán. She is married and has a 4-year-old daughter named Damaris. Darsia lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her husband and daughter; her husband Alexander is employed and helps the family financially. Darsia also works, since after their daughter’s birth the family's expenses have increased. It was for this reason that she decided to rent a small commercial space and set up a beauty salon. Darsia is requesting a loan so she can purchase beauty products that she can offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for her beauty salon

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Anorkhol

texts.en:
Anorkhol has built a profitable business selling kid’s clothing at the busy central market in Shahrituz. She has done well by concentrating on a product that she is interested in and where there is not a lot of competition. Anorkhol has been in business for 15 years. She is looking forward to developing her business and making it successful.

Anorkhol is married and has 4 children. She is doing all the best to ensure they have the best future. Anorkhol has requested a loan of $1100 USD to purchase additional inventory for the summer season. Previous loans from IMON International have been a great help to Anorkhol.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
