These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Tursun

texts.en:
Tursun is a hard working business owner from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She has a business of selling fabrics for sewing of the national dresses. Tursun has been running her business already for 30 years and gained much experience. Tursun is married. She and her husband have 4 children. Tursun’s business has become the main source of income for her family. Her son (pictured) also engaged to her business.  Tursun has requested a loan of $ 1200 USD to add to her working capital. Her business is growing. Financial assistance will help her to continue operating successfully and support her family.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of fabrics for expanding business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward M. is a married Tanzanian micro-businessman. He runs a business raising poultry in the Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. He has constructed four poultry cages where he keeps two egg-laying chickens and two broilers. He collects ten trays of eggs per day, which he sells wholesale by order. He manages to meet his family's daily needs including paying school fees and capitalization. He plans to expand his business by constructing more poultry cages and buying more chicks. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 (Tanzanian shillings) to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Katete E Namusoke Teddy Group

texts.en:
N. Teddy is 22 years old and married with two children, both of them going to school, and two dependents, one of them going to school.

N. Teddy is using the loan to purchase chemical for hair relaxing, hair oil, hair spray, hair treatment, etc. for her salon business. She dreams of prospering in her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemical for hair relaxing, hair oil, hair spray, hair treatment, etc. for her salon business

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: Rosa Haydee M. Cojutepeque departamento Cuscatlán, Rosa es una mujer casada y madre de un hijo llamado Arquimides, Rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo, hijo, padre y hermana; en la casa de Rosa se encuentra el negocio que ha logrado sacar adelante, es una tortillería y venta de productos de bellezas como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas corporales entre otros, Rosa solicita este crédito ya que su venta de productos empieza y no tiene la capacidad económica de adquirir suficiente mercadería, es por ello que este crédito lo utilizara para comprar productos y comercializarlos ayudándola a estabilizar este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Haydee M. Cojutepeque is married and has one son, who is named Arquimides. Rosa lives in her own home with her husband, son, father, and sister. This is where she has her business, which she has been able to progress. She makes and sells tortillas and also sells beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes, creams, etc. Rosa is requesting this loan since she is starting to sell these products and she doesn't have enough economic capacity to acquire enough merchandise. This is why she will use the credit to purchase products and sell them to help stabilize her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Antonia C. is 51 years old and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with seven children: two are married and five are still studying. Her husband is a farmer who lends a hand in farming, specifically in corn production which is their primary activity.

Antonia has been a member of Paglaum MPC since April 2009. Now she is applying for a loan of Php 5,000 to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides. She plans to buy a carabao (a domesticated subspecies of the water buffalo) to toil the land and to build a simple concrete house and be able to send their children to school and that they finish with a degree.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the corn

loans.name: Lwebukona B Prossy Bagambana Group

texts.en:
Prossy B. is aged 50 and married with eight children, all studying. She has been operating her retail business for over ten years.

She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as plates, sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets etc. She is an active woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as plates, sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets etc.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда скоро погасив очередной кредит хочет получить следующий займ. На полученые деньги она хочет съездить за товаром летнего ассортимента.В основном хочет привести детские футболки и мужские сорочки и майки.За все годы кредитования у Мавджуды увеличился оборотный капитал и следовательно торговля.За всю свою деятельность Мавджуда ни разу не нарушила условия Фонда.
texts.en:
Soon after she repaid her last loan, Mavjuda decided to request a new one. She wants to use this loan to obtain summer goods assortment. She wants to primarily bring in children’s t-shirts and men’s tunics and tank tops. Over the years of borrowing, Mavjuda’s working capital and sales have increased. Mavjuda has never violated any of the fund’s terms.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain summer goods assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
B. Jane is a determined and friendly married lady with two children aged 12 and 13 years. She also helps to care for two orphans. She is the chairperson of Turibamwe group in Ibanda.

For 10 years she has been running a grocery store and a lodge, both businesses being in Kitongore trading center. Jane says that the secret to her business success for all these years is the commitment she has, hence being able to make monthly profits of 300,000 shillings, up from just 40,000 a few years ago.

With the grocery shop, Jane intends to grow it big and turn it into a wholesale shop in future and, for the lodge, to ensure that her customers get the best services ever found in Ibanda.

Jane plans to continue having healthy and educated children. She needs a loan to be able to buy more goods for her shop. This money helps her to avoid shortages in her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her general store

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо женщина- кредитор с 2003 года.Она продаёт мужскую одежду, брюки и рубашки. Скоро погасив свой предыдущий займ она хочет получить повторно.Нуринисо довольна условиями Фонда и рада работать с нами.У неё всегда стабильная торговля и пунктуальное погашение кредитов.Нуринисо в числе положительных клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Nuriniso has been a borrower since 2004. She sells men’s clothing, trousers and shirts. After a timely repayment of her last loan, Nuriniso wants to obtain another loan. She is satisfied with the terms of the fund and is glad to be working with us. Her sales have always been stable, and loan repayments have been timely. Nuriniso is in the ranks of MicroInvest’s positive clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Men's clothing

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos M. is a married man who has run a poultry business for the last seven years. He keeps both broilers (roosters for meat) and layers (hens for eggs). He also has a dairy cow and runs a vegetable and fruit garden. His plans for his business involve constructing more poultry cages so he can raise more chicks. He supports his family through the income from this business. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian Shillings to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more poultry chicks

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena T. is a bona fide resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old with four children: three of them are studying in primary grade. Her husband is a farmer.

According to Elena, her corn production project is still growing. She requests a PHP 14,900 loan to defray operating expenses for her corn production such as fertilizers, medicines and labor expenses. She hopes that her business will expand and earn more savings for their children’s education.

Elena is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that Kiva is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the corn

loans.name: Lwebukona B Atwine Bwesise Group

texts.en: Atwine B. is a lady of 30 years. She is married with four children, three of them schooling and she is looking after one dependent. She has been in retail business for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase stock such as sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets, plates, saucepans, etc. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to work hard and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock that is sugar, salt, soap, coffee, basins, cups, sweets, plates, saucepans, etc.

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru: Отуной женщина, которая торгует обувью для мужчин, женщин и детей. Она имеет стаж в этом бизнесе более 7 лет.Хочет получить повторно кредит и поехать за товаром в Истаравшан.У Отуной осталось много на сезонного ассортимента обуви , зимних тапочек.Поэтому ей необходимо пополнить товар летним ассортиментом обуви.Отуной благодарит инвесторов за понимание и финансирование.
texts.en:
Otunoy is a woman who sells men's, women's and children's shoes. She has more than seven years of experience in this business. She wants to take out another loan and go to Istaravshan for merchandise. Otunoy still has many of not seasonal winter shoes. This is why she needs to get new merchandise with summer assortment of shoes. Otunoy is very thankful to the lenders for their understanding and support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer assortment of shoes

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Mrs. Aurelia P. is presently living in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and they own a little parcel of land. He is the one who cultivates vegetables.

Last November 2008 Aurelia became a member of Paglaum MPC and was able to acquire additional capital for a "sari-sari" (variety) store. She is now applying for a loan amounting to Php 7,000 for additional stock. Her customers are neighbors, friends and relatives. She is coping well with the challenges of her business because it requires hard work and patience. Her aspiration is to have a big store and a baby someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Lwebukona B Kobusigye Aruho Group

texts.en: K. Aruho is a married lady of 25 years, she has four children of which two are schooling. She is a farmer with fifteen years experience. She is using the loan to purchase bean seeds for planting and fertilizer for her banana plantation. Her dream is to work hard, sell the produce and use the money to set up another business which will be income generating.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds for planting and fertilizer for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosela L. is 38 years old, married, and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has four children: two are in primary grade. Her husband is a salesman in a mini-mart.

Determination and hard work are what Mrs. L. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in February 2005 having faith in its true service and assistance to the needy people.

Abject poverty is inevitable to them. It urges Mrs. L. to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. She obtained a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store.

The couple’s aspiration is to have a concrete store, a house and a refrigerator someday and be able to send their children to school and have them obtain a degree and be able to provide a good quality life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Women Of Vision Group

texts.en: The group members will use their loans to expand their businesses by increasing and diversifying their merchandise. One member will improve the premises by adding an ablution block (indoor toilets) to make the business area more friendly to customers.

loans.use: To buy additional items, diversify stock, and improving business premises

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат- женщина торгующая женской и детской одеждой. Она берёт кредит для увеличения своего бизнеса. По бизнесу ей помогает её муж, который торгует в отделе женской одежды. Следующий займ хочет использовать для закупа летнего ассортимента. Мамлакат благодарит всех инвесторов Микроинвест за сотрудничество и своевременное финансирование.
texts.en:
Mamlakat is a woman who sells women's and children's clothing. She takes out loans to increase her business. Her husband helps her with the business by selling in the women's department. She wants to use her next loan to buy a summer assortment of clothes. Mamlakat is thanking all the MicroInvest lenders for partnership and timely financing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer assortment of clothing

loans.name: Mwituberia Group

texts.en:
Fredrick is a single, 42-year-old man who runs a hotel and bookshop in a suburb of Nairobi. He is now borrowing his second loan from KADET, having fully serviced a first loan of US $125. Fredrick used the first loan to diversify the stock of his business and it has been successful. He has gained experience in small business management and KADET is certain he will use the new loan wisely.

David, a 45-year-old father of 6 who is married to Mary. The family runs a school and also has constructed some low-cost housing for rent. He wishes to renovate the premises where his school business is housed. David's first loan was for US $250, and he is now on his second loan of US $250.

Jackson is 48 years old. He is married to Rose and they have two children. He runs a livestock (dairy cow) enterprise. He used his first loan of US $315 to buy livestock feed for his dairy cows. He has applied for a second loan of US $500, which he will use to construct an improved livestock shed (zero-grazing unit).

loans.use: Improvement of the livestock shelter for the livestock enterprise, renovation of a school, and to buy more books for a bookshop.

loans.name: Despina

texts.en:
Despina L. runs a business raising poultry in Kitunda, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Kitunda is the main producer of eggs in Dar es Salaam.

Despina is married and has three school-aged children. She keeps both broilers and layers in her poultry cages. She collects fifteen trays of eggs per day which are sold in wholesale orders. She also manages to meet her family's daily needs with the income from her business.

he needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 (Tanzanian shillings) to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To buy more poultry chicks

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Хобилова Дилафруз- женщина которая уже восьмой год занимается торговлей лечебных медикаментов в городе Костакозе. Она хочет использовать займ для закупа противовоспалительных антибиотиков. За пять лет кредитования Дилафруз заметно увеличила свой бизнес, за что и благодарит за  финансирование KIVA.
texts.en:
For the past eight years, Mrs. Dilafruz H. has been selling medications in Kostakoz town. She has been our client for five years, which helped her expand her business considerably. This time Dilafruz would like to use her loan for the procurement of anti-inflammatory antibiotics. She is grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of medications

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha A., 54 years of age, is a widow and a resident of P4 Gala, Ozamiz City. She had two poster children, one is in high school and the other one is in elementary grade. She is currently enjoying the pension from her late husband who was an employee of the BIR (Bureau of Internal Revenue).

As the sole bread-winner of her children, she engaged in cassava, banana and corn production on her 2 hectares (approximately 5 acres) of farm land and 3 hectares (approximately 7.5 acres) of tenanted land.

As a regular member and 3rd time loaner of Paglaum MPC, she is applying for a loan of Php 32,000 to purchase 12 sacks of fertilizers and to finance the cultivation and production of the said project.

She is planning to extend her land cultivation in order to earn additional income and be able to send her two poster children to college. She also enjoys the benefits, insurance and savings of Paglaum Cooperative.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for cassava, banana and corn production

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert D. is a married small businessman who lives in Kitunda, a selected site for poultry keepers in Dar es Salaam. He runs a business raising poultry, both layers and broilers, in Kitunda . He purchases the poultry chicks from the inter-chicks company and from other chick incubator companies. He collects eight trays of eggs daily and sells wholesale. He uses his business income to meet his daily family needs and capitalization for his business. He needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 (Tanzanian shillings) to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
T. Félicienne est née le 03 juin 1971 à  KARI MAMA dans le Département de l’Atacora au Nord du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée à KOLA Joachin chauffeur de profession. Félicienne est mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons, tous scolarisés et à la charge de leur père. Félicienne et sa famille vit au quartier LOM-NAVA à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Félicienne vend des tubercules d'igname et de l'oignon devant son domicile. Félicienne a eu déjà trois crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Félicienne rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour développer d'avantage son activité et la diversifier à la vente de haricot, Félicienne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Félicienne was born on June 3, 1971 in MAMA, in Atacora County in northern Benin. She is married to KOLA Joachin, a chauffeur by profession, and is the mother of four children (2 girls and 2 boys), all in school and supported by their father. Félicienne and her family live in the LOM-NAVA district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells yam tubers and onions in front of her home. She has already had three loans from ALIDÉ to develop her business. Félicienne has repaid her loans. To improve her business and to diversify it through the sale of beans, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 50-kg sacks of yam tubers, a 50-kg sack of onions, and 50-kg sack of beans

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё жительница Костакоза и бизнесмен ка, которая торгует детской одеждой на рынке этого города.Мухаё каждый свой кредит использует на расширение своего бизнеса.За товаром ездит поочерёдно в Бишкек и Истаравшан.Следующий кредит хочет использовать на завоз летнего товара детской одежды.За годы сотрудничества в Фондом у Мухаё улучшилось семейное положение благодаря развитию её бизнеса
texts.en:
Muchayo resides in Kostakoz. She makes a living by selling children's clothing at the local market. Muhayo uses each of her loans to expand her business. She buys goods in Bishkek and Istaravshan. She would like to use the next loan for the purchase of summer children’s clothing. Mohayo’s family situation has improved throughout the years of her cooperation with the microfinance bank thanks to the expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's clothing (summer season)

loans.name: Wanzela

texts.en: Wanzela S. is a married woman with two school-age children. She runs a grocery store in Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She sells a wide variety of soft drinks. She fills her family's daily needs with the income from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more goods.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура кредитор Фонда с 2005 года. Она торгует на рынке Костакоза детской одеждой.За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан раз в месяц. Следующий кредит хочет потратить на завоз летней детской одежды. Хочет привести одежду для новорождённых детей.Как говорит сама Манзура идёт большой запрос данного ассортимента товара.Потому что рождаемость населения большая.За хорошее сотрудничество с Микроинвест Манзуре нельзя отказать в её запрашиваемом займе. Манзура благодарна за инвестирование KIVA.
texts.en:
Manzura has been a microfinance client since 2005. She sells children’s clothing at the market of Kostakoz. Once a month she travels to Istaravshan to purchase the goods. Manzura would like to use her next loan for the purchase of children’s clothing for the summer season, and particularly baby clothes. According to Manzura, they are in demand due to the high population growth. Manzura cannot be refused another loan because she has been a very good client. She is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's clothing retail

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик мужчина , который торгует мужской обувью на рынке Костакоза. Во время мониторинга чаще всего торгует его отец, Абдумалик всегда в отъезде за товаром. Но на сей раз я смогла застать его на месте торговли. Это пунктуальный и честный человек который пятый год работает с Фондом. Следующий кредит хочет использовать на завоз летней обуви.
texts.en:
Abdumalik sells men's shoes at the market of Kostakoz. He has been a microfinance client for five years, and he has been noted for his honesty and punctuality in loan repayment. He would like to use the new loan for the purchase men's shoes for the summer season. Since Abdumalik is often away purchasing goods, during the monitoring I only saw his father at the market stall.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: men's shoes

loans.name: Moynatou

texts.fr:
A. Moynatou est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Moynatou est mariée à AFFOTON Kabirou, chauffeur de profession. Moynatou est mère de quatre(04) enfants dont trois garçons et une fille. Les deux aînés sont majeurs; seuls les deux derniers enfants, à savoir Toundé et Kèfil sont encore à la charge des parents. Toundé et Kèfil sont respectivement en classe de terminale et de première année du lycée. Moynatou assure avec son mari les charges de la famille. Moynatou vend de l'alcool médical en détail et en gros. C'est à la PHARMAQUIK une entreprise de fabrication des médicaments génériques au Bénin que Moynatou s'approvisionne en alcool. Moynatou a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur. Aujourd'hui Moynatou  sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi Moynatou va pourvoir augmenter son revenu pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Moynatou was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to AFFOTON Kabirou, a chauffeur by profession. She is the mother of four children (3 boys and a girl). The two oldest are of age; only the last two children, namely Toundé and Kèfil, are still supported by their parents. Toundé and Kèfil are respectively in the last year and the first year of high school. Moynatou and her husband ensure that family expenses are met.

Moynatou sells medical alcohol retail and wholesale. There, at the PHARMAQUIK (an enterprise that makes generic medicines in Benin), she acquires her supplies of alcohol. She has already had three ALIDÉ loans, which she repaid and which she used to bring her business along to a higher level. Today, she's requesting a fourth loan to bolster her working capital and to satisfy her customers better. Thus, she's going to be able to increase her revenues to do better in meeting family needs.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two drums of alcohol

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios E. is forty-one years old and married with two children. She owns a variety store located at Siari, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She started her business with minimal capital and caters to her neighbors and other people from different villages. She is now on her third loan cycle. This loan is intended for additional capital for her existing sari-sari store.

She believes that "a family helping each other, progress together". She aims to be successful in this endeavor so that she will be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her variety store

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr:
Eulalie H. est née le 12/02/1958 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Eulalie est mariée à BOKO Machoudi soudeur de profession. Eulalie est mère de six (06) enfants tous scolarisés. Deux seulement de ces six enfants à savoir, Soulé, âgé de quatorze (14) ans et Bilikissou, âgée de onze (11) ans sont tous deux en première année du lycée et à la charge de leur père. Eulalie vend les bois de chauffage depuis près de dix (10) ans. C'est grâce au revenu de cette activité que Eulalie vient en aide à son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Eulalie a pu développer son activité avec les deux crédits qu'elle a eu de ALIDé et qu'elle a bien remboursé. Eulalie sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour constituer un important stock de bois de chauffage pendant la saison pluvieuse où la demande est forte et que le bois de chauffage coûte cher. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Eulalie H. was born on February 12, 1958 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to BOKO Machoudi, a welder by profession, and is the mother of six children, all in school. Only two of these six, namely Soulé, age 14, and Bilikissou, age 11, are in school, both in year one of middle school and supported by their father.

Eulalie has been selling firewood for almost ten years. Thanks to the revenues from this business, she is assisting her husband with family expenses. She was able develop her business with the two loans that she got from ALIDÉ and has repaid them. She's requesting a third ALIDÉ loan to build up a sizable stock of firewood during the rainy season when demand is strong and firewood costs a lot.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two truck-loads of firewood

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
L’Association Victoire est  crée en 2008 et regroupe trois femmes dynamiques du quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elles mènent des activités génératrices de revenus différentes mais ont mis en commun leur force financière. La première vend des produits pharmaceutiques, la seconde fait la restauration et la troisième vend des produits cosmétiques.  Leur objectif premier est travailler pour dégager un minimum de revenu afin de contribuer modestement aux dépenses de leur famille.
A la création de l’association, ses femmes avaient pris un crédit pour débuter leur activité et avaient bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit que les femmes de l’association Victoire sollicitent leur permettra de s’approvisionner avec deux cartons de produits pharmaceutiques, trois sacs de maïs et quatre cartons de produits cosmétiques.
Ainsi avec le revenu de ces ventes, elles pourront aider leur mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Association Victoire was created in 2008 and brings together three dynamic women of the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. They do different work to earn an income but have pooled their financial might. The first woman sells pharmaceuticals, the second one is in the restaurant business, and the third sells cosmetics. Their first objective is to work to earn a minimal income, so as to help modestly with family expenses. When the association was created, the women had taken out a loan to start working, and it was repaid. This second loan the association members are requesting will enable them to stock up with two boxes of pharmaceuticals, three sacks of corn, and four boxes of cosmetics. Thus, with the revenues from these sales, the women will be able to help their husbands to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, corn, and pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
H. Félicienne est née à Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Félicienne est mariée à AVOCEVOU Jacob. Félicienne est mère de deux enfants. Félicienne n'est jamais allée à l'école. Félicienne fut élevée par sa grande sœur. Félicienne aidait sa grande-sœur dans la vente de poteries et les plantes médicinales traditionnelles. Après son mariage, Félicienne s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité de vente de poteries. C'est grâce au crédit de ALIDé que Félicienne a pu amener son activité au stade où elle est aujourd'hui. Félicienne sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Félicienne was born in Abomey, in Zou County. She is married to AVOCEVOU Jacob and is the mother of two. She never went to school. Félicienne was raised by her older sister and used to help her to sell pottery and traditional medicinal plants. After getting married, Félicienne got started on her own in the same business selling pottery. Thanks to the loan from ALIDÉ, she was able to bring her business to the level at which it is today. She's requesting a third loan from ALIDÉ to increase her level of business in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truck-load of pottery

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr: VERONIQUE B. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE ET MERE DE QUATRE ENFANTS.ELLE EST NEE LE 9 JUILLET 1971 ET HABITE AU QUARTIER MBOUR 1 DE THIES .APRES LES TRAVAUX MENAGERS ELLE FAIT DU PETIT COMMERCE DE POISSONS SECHES POUR SUBVENIR AUX BESOINS DE SES ENFANTS.AVEC CE PRET ELLE VEUT RENFORCER SES STOCKS AVANT L'HIVERNAGE.
texts.en:
Véronique B. is a married woman and the mother of four children. She was born on July 9, 1971 and lives in the MBOUR 1 district of THIES. After doing the housework, she does a bit of commerce in dried fish in order to provide for her children. With this loan, she wants to bolster her inventory before the off-season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell dried fish

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr: CHEIKH TIDIANE S. EST NE A THIES LE 30 SEPTEMBRE 1975.IL EST MARIE ET PERE D'UN ENFANT.IL EST MARCHAND AMBULANT ET EST SPECIALISE DANS LA VENTE D'HABITS. SA CIBLE EST CONSTITUEE DE JEUNES DE MOINS DE TRENTE ANS .AVEC CE PRET IL ENVISAGE D'AUGMENTER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT DANS LE BUT DE DIVERSIFIER SES MARCHANDISES.
texts.en:
Cheikh Tidiane S. was born in THIES on September 30, 1975. He is married and the father of one child. He is an itinerant merchant and specializes in selling clothing. He targets young people under the age of 30. With this loan, he envisions increasing his working capital with the goal of diversifying his merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his working capital

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: FANTA K. EST UNE JEUNE FEMME NEE EN 1986 A BAMBEY ET HABITE AUX PARCELLES ASSAINIES DE THIES .SON ACTIVITE A DEMARRE EN 2006 AVEC UN CAPITAL DE 75000 FCFA TIRE DE SON EPARGNE.ELLE VEND DES CHAUSSURES ;des sacs et des tissus;avec ce pret elle envisage de confectionner des draps pour les revendre.
texts.en:
Fanta K. is a young woman who was born in 1986 in BAMBEY. She lives in the PARCELLES ASSAINIES of THIES. Her business started off in 2006 with 75,000 francs CFA in capital drawn from her savings. She sells shoes, bags, and cloth. With this loan, she envisions making bed sheets and selling them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small-scale commerce

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en: Felipa T. is a resident of Alicomohan, Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental, in the Southern Philippines. She is married to Adelfo T. and blessed with six children. With her current family's situation, Felipa knows that they need to work hard to survive. Buying and selling lemons is one of their main sources of income. Once they purchase the lemons, they deliver it on consignment to their established customers. With her first loan with HSPFI, Felipa wants to expand the business by using the loan as additional business capital. Her simple desire is to see all her children finish their studies up to college level.

loans.use: To purchase lemons to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda S. is a married woman with four children and lives in Alicomohan, Kitagpang, Sugbongcogon Mis.Or., in the Southern Philippines. The family owns a small variety store and are also suppliers of coconut shell. In order to cope with their daily expenses, they had to find additional revenue sources as well as double their efforts to double their income. They found a way to expand and improve their small business through accessing a micro-finance loan from HSPFI, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for the variety store.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: SAMBA D. EST MECANICIEN DE PROFESSION.IL EST NE EN 1973 A THIES ET HABITE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY AVEC SA FEMME ET SES DEUX ENFANTS.ACTUELLEMENT IL EST JOURNALIER AUX INDUSTRIES CHIMIQUES DU SENEGAL .AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT ACHETER DES LEGUMES A MBORO PRES DE SON LIEU DE TRAVAIL POUR LES DONNER A SA MERE QUI EST VENDEUSE AU MARCHE.CELA LUI PERMETTRA DE DIVERSIFIER SES REVENUS.
texts.en:
Samba D. is a trained mechanic. He was born in 1973 in Thies and lives in the Cite Lamy district with his wife and his two children. Presently, he is a day laborer in the chemical industries of Senegal. With this loan, he wants to buy vegetables in Mboro, near where he works, to give to his mother who is a petty trader at the market. That will permit him to diversify his income sources.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling vegetables

loans.name: Nhuan's Group

texts.en:
Nhuần Thị Nguyễn, the group leader for this loan, was born in 1948. She sells rice in the market. She lives with her husband in her son’s house and she has 2 granddaughters and a grandson. Her husband, son, and daughter-in-law have salaries: they are engravers. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy rice to sell.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Ngào Thị Nguyễn was born in 1967. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy scrap-iron to resell.

Đãi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1953. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

Nhôi Thị Hoàng was born in 1963. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to breed pigs and poultry.

Thường Thị Nguyễn was born in 1978. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence K. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is thirty-five years old and married with three children who are all in school. She has a retail grocery shop at Gayaza stage near the taxi park. She is requesting a loan to purchase more commodities like sugar, salt, soap, tea leaves and fruits (avocados, mangoes, oranges and sweet bananas, etc.) to fulfill customer expectations and increase her store inventory.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to sell.

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Duyến Thị Đỗ (no:010103110030) was born in 1968. She is a dressmaker and is the group leader. She lives with her husband and two children (one going to school). Her husband is a metal foundry worker. They have a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to buy cloth and some chickens to raise.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Tư Thị Nguyễn (no: 010103110035) was born in 1974. She sells soft noodles at home. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to buy chairs, a table and eating bowls.

Chuyền Thị Nguyễn (no: 010103110031) was born in 1968. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to breed pigs and poultry.

Hường Thị Đỗ (no: 010103110032) was born in 1975. She is an engraver. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to buy a mowing-machine.

Khoa Thị Nguyễn (no: 010103110033) was born in 1959. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to buy rice to resell.

Quỳnh Ngọc Hoàng (no: 010103110034) was born in 1979. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy cloth and some chickens to raise

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin M. runs a health clinic called Mau Summit, located at the junction of El-Doret and Kericho. He provides reproductive health services, post-abortion care, curative health and primary care services. On average, he sees 70-80 clients, most of whom are farmers. The largest challenge he faces is collecting medical fees that are due to him. 

With his loan, he hopes to purchase lab equipment to improve the clinic’s facilities. He would also like to purchase more medicine to dispense to patients directly from his clinic, as the closest pharmacy is far away. 

Benjamin M. is a member of K-MET’s health network, which gives him access to training and counseling from K-MET’s larger network of providers and doctors.

(Note: In the video, Benjamin says he is asking for 100,000 Kenyan shillings. But since this is his first loan, K-MET has a policy that he can only apply for a maximum of 90,000 Kenyan shillings, or about USD 1,200.)

loans.use: Lab Equipment

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty N. is the chairperson of the Kikooza Development Association in Mityana. She is a hard-working lady. She is married with four children and cares for three other relatives as well. Betty has a produce-selling business, growing matooke (green cooking bananas) and other food crops like cassava (Uganda's main staple food), sweet potatoes, maize (corn), beans and so on, and selling at the market for cash. In seasons when she does not have a large enough harvest, Betty buys from other farmers so as to keep her clients supplied. This is her sixth loan with the group from Pearl Microfinance (a field partner of Kiva). These loans, which provide money to buy the produce she needs, have increased her profitability and the level at which she is able to save. Betty needs a new loan to be able to buy more produce for her business and also to pay school fees for her children. (Also pictured above is Fred, the credit officer of the group.)

loans.use: Buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Тиллоев Аскар житель района Рудаки. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом  по маршруту Рудаки-Душанбе. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 10 лет. Жена работает на рынке . Торгует автозапчастями. Таким образом они вместе работают и обеспечивают семью. Но автомашина Аскара требует ремонта, для чего он и запрашивает кредит. Он сможет произвести капремонт и обеспечить себя работой без перебоев.
texts.en:
Askar T. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He works as a taxi driver on the Rudaki-Dushanbe route. He has been in this business for ten years now. His wife works on the market and sells auto parts. This way they work together and provide for the family. Askar's car needs a repair for which he needs a loan. He will make the repairs and continue working without interruptions.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thơm Thị Nguyễn (no: 010117090068) was born in 1966. She has two children with one going to school. Her husband is a painter. She makes steamed rolled rice pancakes to sell every morning. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She is a prestige person and the group leader. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (approximately $335) to buy rice to make cake.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Hòa Thị Hoàng (no: 010117090069) was born in 1965. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to breed pigs.

Xuyến Thị Đỗ (no: 010117090070) was born in 1987. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (approximately $310) to breed pigs.

Mai Thị Nguyễn (no: 010117090099) was born in 1959. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $235) to breed pigs and fish.

Khanh Thị Hồng P. (no:010117090098) was born in 1984. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $235) to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy rice to make cake

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Умурзоков Одил житель района РУдаки. Возраст 37 лет,женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает в сфере торговли . Торгует на рынке в Гиссаре . Имеет торговую лавку , где продает автозапчасти. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 8 лет. Дело доход дает , но его хватает только на жизнь. Сейчас он планирует увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита.
texts.en:
Odil U. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 37 years old, is married and has four children. He works in the sales sphere. He trades at the market in Gissar. He has a shop where he sells auto parts. He has been in this business for 8 years. The business provides an income, but it is only enough to live on. Right now he plans to increase his product turnover by getting a loan. .

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is forty years old and married with four children, two of whom are working and two who are still in school. She operates a beauty salon in her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary supplies such as combs for styling, hair chemicals for relaxing, braids for plaiting, hair treatments and weaves for hair weaving. Margaret's dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Abduqahor

texts.ru: Умаров Абдукахор житель района Рудаки. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Работает сварщиком  на дому. Производит печки , ворота и другие изделия. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить металлолом и дополнительные инструменты. Таким образом он сможет работать и обеспечивать семью.
texts.en:
U. Abduqahor lives in the Rudaki region. He is 49 years old, is married and has three children. He works as a welder at home. He makes ovens, gates and other wares. He plans to get a loan in order to purchase scrap metal and additional tools. This way he will be able to work and to provide for his family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scrap metal and necessary tools

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Ашуров Дильшод житель района Рудаки.Холост. Живет с родителями. Отец работает на стройке , мать бухгалтером на базе геологов. Сам студент, заканчивает юридический факультет. Параллельно работает в магазине , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
A. Dilshod is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is a bachelor and lives with his parents. His father works at a construction site, his mother works as an accountant at a geological base. Dilshod himself is a student and is finishing law school. In parallel he works in a store where he sells food products. He has been in this business for around a year. He plans to get a loan in order to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.ru:
Рустамова Махаббат  1955 года рождения , замужем имеет  4 детей. Живет она в селе где нет работы. Основной источник дохода это выращивание сельской хозяйственной  культуры и  Переводы с России. Ее старший сын присылает ей немного денег, но теперь из-за кризиса он последние 2 месяца не присылал денег.  
Она продала быка и  планировала купить дойную корову, по ее словам содержать корову. Но корова стоит дороже и для этого она обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест. Узнала об условиях кредита. После получения кредита купила корову. Теперь у нее есть несколько дойных коров.  Она благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahabbat R. was born in 1955. She is married with 4 children and lives in a rural area where there are no jobs. Her main sources of income are agriculture and the remittances that her elder son sends from Russia. However, due to the economic crisis, for the past two months he has not sent any money. Mahabbat sold a bull and was planning to buy a dairy cow but then she realized that keeping a cow would be even more expensive. Therefore she came to Microinvest to inquire about the conditions of the loan. Having received the loan, she bought a cow. Now she already owns several dairy cows. Muhabbat is grateful to Kiva for all its support.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more cows

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Отажонов Равшан 1987 года рождения, женат но детей нет. Учиться на экономиста.  Дома разводит скот. Хотел уехать в Россию на заработки, но мать не хотел оставлять одну отца нету, также  он единственный сын.  В бизнесе поддерживает  дядя.  В свободное время выращивает овощи и продает. Мать учительница , живет на заработки, но и этого не хватает. После женитьбы  Отачон решил сам зарабатывать,  тем более дядя помогает выводит скот на рынок. Дядя рекомендовал обратиться в Микроинвест и на кредит купил несколько голов скота.
texts.en:
Ravshan Otazhonov was born in 1987. He is married with no children. He is studying to be an economist. At home he tends to the cattle. He wanted to get a job in Russia but he did not want to leave his mother alone since he is an only son and they do not have a father. In his free time, Ravshan cultivates and sells vegetables. His mother is a teacher but her salary is not enough for making ends meet. After marriage, Ravshan decided to make his own living, especially because his uncle helps him bring the cattle to the market. It is Ravshan's uncle who recommended him to get a Microinvest loan and buy more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina K. is a very hardworking businesswoman. She is fifty years old and married with six children, all of them working. She has a poultry business of her own, raising over 250 chickens. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and chicken feed to expand her business to fulfill customer demands. Her dream is to maximize her poultry business.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone K. Asang is a 60-year-old nurse who runs the Kirenget Nehemah Clinic in Molo, about 24 kms outside of Nakuru. There, he provides curative care, family planning, PAK services and a dental clinic. This will be his fifth year in private practice. He used to work for the government Ministry of Health.

On average, Johnstone sees 80-90 clients a month, depending on what services are needed. All of his clients are farmers and he says most struggle to pay even the lowest bills. He says another challenge is gaining the trust of his patients, who often are more used to traditional medicine. He is asking for 50,000 KES to purchase some instruments.

Johnstone's favorite parts of the practice are the curative and dental elements.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas B. is married with two children and has received an education through Junior High School.  Since 1994 he has worked as a trader, selling hardware items such as tape measures and hammers at Zion Church in Cape Coast.  While Thomas works as a trader, his wife is employed as a hairdresser.  Thomas uses his income to pay for school fees, utilities and food. He will use the loan to purchase additional hardware in bulk for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Thomas plans to build a house and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase hardware in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро Шерматова  1985 года рождения ,замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет.  До сих пор сидела дома. Время от  времени помогала маме на рынке торговать детской одеждой. Сейчас когда дети подросли мать сдала часть товара Зухро и помогла ей вести бизнес. В начале было страшно , муж не разрешал, но потом со временем муж разрешил и она сама научилась торговать. По совету матери обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест узнав об условии кредитовании , на полученный кредит  приобрела товар детской одежды.
texts.en:
Zuhro S. was born in 1985. She does not have a university degree. She is married with 2 children and up to now, she has been a stay-at-home mom. From time to time she was helping her mother sell children's clothing at the market. Now, when the children are no longer little, her mother helped her start her business, also by sharing goods. In the beginning, Zuhro found it quite scary to sell at the market; her husband did not approve of this occupation either. However, with time he changed his mind and she also learned how to sell. It is Zuhro's mother who advised her to apply for a Microinvest loan. Zukhro used the loan for the puchase of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the variety of goods

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас Шуайбова 1975 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Мукаддас  дома разводит скот. Скот отправляет в горы на пастбище и пасется вместе с соседями и их скотом до вечера. Муж работает фермером  на ферме выращивает различные сельскими хозяйственными культурами. Осенью они продают огурцы и помидоры. В начале весны фрукты. Она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой , покупки скота. Она благодарна КИВА что поддержали и не отказали ей.
texts.en:
Mukaddas S. was born in 1975 and is married with three children. She tends to the cattle and sends it to the pastures along with her neighbors' cattle. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates a variety of fruit and vegetables. In the fall Mukaddas and her husband sell cucumbers and tomatoes. In the spring they sell fruit. She turned to Microinvest for helping her buy more cattle. She is grateful to Kiva for its support and she is happy that she has not been rejected.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica E. M. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is forty-two years old and married with three children, all of whom are enrolled in boarding schools. She has a medical clinic in her house. In order to provide her customers with all of the medicines they need, Monica will use the loan to buy a greater variety of medicines. Her dream is to further develop her clinical business.

loans.use: To buy more medicines.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Ахрор энергичный мужчина, занимающийся продажей видеокассет и DVD дисков. Он торгует на рынке города Худжанда.У него стабильная реализация.Каждый свой займ он берёт для увеличения своего бизнеса, или обновления аппаратуры. Ахрор утверждает, что ему удобно в кредит осуществлять свои планы по расширению своей торговой точки. Он рад продолжать сотрудничать с Микроинвест и продолжать своё дело.
texts.en:
Ahror is an energetic man, involved in sales of video cassettes and DVD disks. He sells at a market in the city of Khujand. His business is stable. He used each one of his previous loans either to expand his business or to update his equipment. Ahror affirms that it is convenient for him to use financing in order to make his business growth plans come to fruition. He is glad to continue the collaboration with MicroInvest and to continue his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fathullo

texts.ru: Саидов Фатхулло житель района Рудаки. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает водителем камаза в частной фирме. Живет с родителями  , семья большая. Поэтому он так же  занимается торговлей детской одежды. На рынке торгует его жена. Товар привозит Фатхулло сам из города Душанбе. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Fathullo S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 28 years old, is married and has two children. He works as a dump truck (KAMAZ) driver at a private firm. He lives with his parents, the family is large. This is why he also sells children’s clothing. His wife trades at the market. Fathullo brings the products himself from the city of Dushanbe. He plans to get credit in order to increase turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru:
Осим кредитор в Микроинвест с 2006 года.Он занимается продажей мужской обувью.Его место деятельности рынок Паншанбе города Худжанда.Все свои займы он использует целенаправлено на расширение своего бизнеса.Со дня начала своей кедитной истории у Осим увеличился товарооборот и ассортимент мужской обуви.Следующий кредит вместе с накопившимся капиталом Осим хочет съездить в Бишкек за летним товаром.
Осим благодарен всем инвесторам за финансирование и понимание.
texts.en:
Osim has been taking out loans at MicroInvest since 2006. He sells men's shoes. His vendor location is in Panshabe market in Khujand. He uses all his loans purposefully to expand his business. From the first day of his credit history Osim's commodity circulation has increased as well as the assortment of men's shoes. Osim wants to use the next loan and his saved capital to travel to Bishkek for summer merchandise. Osim is thankful to all the lenders for their support and understanding.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benedicto's Group

texts.en:
S. Benedicto is the chairperson of the Magoma Nezikokolima group in Mityana. He is a hard-working married man who wants the best for his people, his group members, and all those that he cares for.

Benedicto is a farmer as well as a tailor, making school uniforms and growing foodstuffs both for sale and home consumption. For 30 years he has been dealing in the same businesses. He has 3 school-going children of his own plus caring for 2 orphans.

Benedicto has been in his lending group for 1 year and his goal, together with that of his fellow group members, is to develop themselves and in fact he says right now, he is seeing a change since money is available. Most of his group members were in a Government organization called NAADS ‘National Agricultural Advisory Services’ getting hybrid seeds and farming advice, but what was lacking was money. Now that he has the knowledge and money, he believes nothing will hinder his road to prosperity.

Benedicto needs another loan to help him buy more school uniform materials since the term is soon beginning.

loans.use: Buying cloth for making uniforms

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Since 2004, Christina S. has worked as a hairdresser selling creams, pomades and weave-ons at Zion Church in Cape Coast. She is married with 1 child and received an education through Senior High School. While Christina is employed as a hairdresser, her husband works as a petty trader.  She is responsible for paying school fees, utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase more and a greater variety of hair products for re-sale and also to improve her services. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more and a greater variety of hair products for re-sale

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Раджабова Фируза проживает в районе РУдаки. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Работает врачом в местной амбулатории. Кроме того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот в торговле лекарствами, планирует получить кредит. Поэтому и обратилась к нам за кредитом. Имеет частную аптеку, которая работает для населения кишлака. Это дает возможность жителям своевременно оказать первую помощь себе и своим близким.
texts.en:
R. Firuza lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has six children. She works as a doctor at the local clinic. In addition, in order to increase turnover in medicine sales she plans to get a loan. This is why she has turned to us for a loan. She has a private pharmacy which works for the village residents. This allows residents to provide timely first aid to themselves and to those close to them.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer I. is married with 4 children and has received an education through Senior High School. Since 1999, he has worked selling electrical appliances at Zion Church in Cape Coast.  His wife also works as a petty trader in the same area.  Ebenezer uses his income to pay for his family’s utilities, rent and food. Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more electrical appliances for re-sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ebenezer plans to finish building the house he has started.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical appliances for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
X. Nguyễn Thị (205950774) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1995, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. X. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 12th loan taken out from TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Thịnh Trần Thị owns and operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Thịnh is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn.  She is married and has four adult children. Thịnh has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.
In 2002, Thịnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Thịnh has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Thịnh is now requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund.  Thịnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.
No. 237021186.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Lý Nguyễn Thị (203960098) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lý owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the onL. means for generating revenue, raising pigs to sell is the main source of income for the business. Lý has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximateL. 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1995, Lý joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lý has successfulL. repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Lý is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve general living conditions for her famiL..

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
Tuyêt Ngô Thị (642970686) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Tuyêt owns & operates a business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, raising pigs to sell is the main source of income for the business. Tuyêt has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Tuyêt joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Tuyêt plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand it.

In 2007, Huyền joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vịnh owns and operates a service-based business, primarily providing rice processing to local community members. Vịnh has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, Vịnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Vịnh is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 11th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Erick José

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Erick N. se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio de pulpería el cual ha establecido en su propia casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes con mucho entusiasmo ya que es una persona muy alegra, dinámica y con un gran espíritu de superación en el negocio.

Atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir a lo inmediato los productos para la pulpería tales como los comestibles, granos básicos y otros productos. Para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con dicho crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio que hoy mas que nunca requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Erick N.’s small business is his mini market, which is in his own home in the city of Masaya. He takes care of his customers with a lot enthusiasm. He is a happy, dynamic person with a great spirit for improving his business. He needs products for his mini market like food, basic grains, and others. He needs these products immediately. That is way he is asking Ceprodel for a loan. This way he can get ahead in his business. He needs their support now more than ever.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his mini market

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (627981323) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has an infant child.

T. owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Otilia María

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, la señora Otilia R. con mucho entusiasmo se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de ropa teniendo su propio establecimiento el cual ha logrado mejorar brindándole mejores condiciones para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes en el mercado.

Es de importancia destacar que ella es la única persona que lleva el sustento a su hogar y hoy en día requiere de la inversión en la compra de la ropa para ofertarla en su negocio. Por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dicha ropa y de esta manera ofertarla a sus clientes y percibir sus utilidades para el sustento del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia R. enthusiastically sells clothes in the Masaya department. She has her own store, which she has been able to improve. The improved conditions allow her to give better attention to her customers in the market. It is important to note that she is the only person who supports her household. She currently needs to buy clothes to sell in her business. That is why she is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy clothes to offer her customers. She will use the profits to pay household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of cloth and dye and other necessary items to make our products

loans.name: Akwata Empola Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is now 26 and her youngest is just 17. The 17-year-old is still in a private secondary school in the area. Mariam also cares for her late sister's four children.

Mariam has a boutique where she mainly sells dresses and dressmaking materials. She has owned the shop since 1997 and recently branched out into providing other goods like mattresses, suitcases, bed sheets, and decorative home items.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 2 million USH. With this money she will buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other needed stock. She says that her loans help her to have the variety of items that her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other stock

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Mme A. Amavi est commerçante de bijoux. Elle a 35 ans, mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur. Malgré les efforts qu'il fournit, les champs ne donnent pas de rendements suffisants. La femme seule prend en charge les enfants et leur scolarisation. Elle demande un crédit pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Elle est rigoureuse et honnête dans la gestion de ses activités .Les bénéfices serviront à améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mme A. Amavi sells costume jewelry. She is 35 and the mother of 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. Despite his best efforts, his fields don't produce enough. Only his wife is responsible for the children and their schooling. She is requesting a loan to replenish her stock of merchandise. She is rigorously honest in managing her business. The profits will be used to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase of seafood to re-sell in Mali

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Khamidov

texts.en:
Khamidov S. is a 35-year-old butcher who keeps his own store. He started his business in 2001 and since that time he has been able to accumulate income to purchase his own store. Meat selling is a very profitable business because meat it is in very high demand among Azerbaijani people.

S. is married and has two children. His dream is attached to both his children. He dreams of providing them with better education and for this purpose he is already making some savings.

But to both keep his family and make savings is not easy and so he decided to expand his business. For this purpose he applied for a $1500 loan to increase the amount of meat he sells in a day.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to increase his sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enlarging the area she cultivates and buying fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail O. is married with one child and has received an education through junior high school.

Since 2004 she has worked as a trader selling weave-ons and wigs at Zion Church in Cape Coast. While Abigail works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver. Abigail uses her income to pay for school fees, rent, utilities and food.

She will use the loan to purchase additional hair products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abigail plans to give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair products to sell

loans.name: Polad

texts.en:
Polad D. is a 29-year-old, very energetic young trader who sells different kinds of repair products. He started this business when he was 20 and since that time the range of his clients has increased. Many customers come to Polad because he can always advise the best products to use.

Polad is not married yet and lives with his parents. He is the only breadwinner for his parents.

Polad would like to increase the number of items he sells and with the income he will gain he will be able to get married. For this purpose he has applied for a loan. Lets do our best to help this ambitious guy.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Née en Mars 1981 à Gapé Hlihagbé, Mme A. Abra a abandonné les classes très tôt et s’est lancée dans le commerce de préparation de l’huile rouge ou huile de palme communément appelé « Amidjè ». Mère de deux (02) enfants, elle se débrouille seule pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Vu son effort et le dynamisme, Mme A. Abra demande un crédit pour renforcer son commerce afin d’améliorer sa situation socio-économique.
texts.en:
Born in March 1981 in Gapé Hlihagbé, Mrs. A. Abra left school at a young age and began the business of preparing red oil or palm oil, commonly called « Amidjè ». Mother of two children, she manages to support her family alone. In view of her effort and her dynamism, Mrs. A. Abra is requesting a loan to bolster her business so as to improve her socio-economic situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam R. is a 24-year-old trader who rents a store where he sells spare-parts for cars. He has run this business for the last five years. He chose this business because it is a very profitable business and people always come to Rustam in order to purchase quality spare-parts and accessories for their cars.

Rustam is not married and lives with his parents. He dreams of saving some money from his income to build his own store. To approach his dream, he applied for $1200 to purchase more car accessories and spare-parts.

loans.use: To purchase more car accessories and spare-parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy basic supplies for sewing, knitting, embroidery, and dyeing cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell generic medicines

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan Z. is a 38-year-old woman who is married and has two sons.

Reyhan sells furnishings and women’s perfumes. These items are very popular among young ladies who are going to marry.

Reyhan started her business more that ten years ago when her husband passed away and she stood alone without any source of income. Now she is the owner of her own store and brings up her two sons who are high school students.

Reyhan applied for a $1500 loan to increase the number of the items she sells. Your generosity could help this brave and hardworking woman!

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Tabempa Group

texts.en:
This is Patrick B., Sampa K. and Sallay L.. They named their group Tabempa. This is the fourth loan this group is asking for from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have made a lot of impact in the lives of these people. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 800,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses.

Patrick B. (middle) is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is age thirty-eight and married with five children. Two of his children are in secondary schools, one in primary school and two are still not of school age.

Patrick has four years of experience in business. He sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), and he is also now an Okada driver (motorcycle driver). Motorcycles are widely used as a means of transportation all over Sierra Leone. He managed to get a second-hand motorcycle out of the loans he received from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, he will add some money to it to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Power Of God Group

texts.en:
This is Kerelie B. and Fatmata T.. They are entrepreneurs who sell food in the Magburaka town market. They named their group Power of God. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a big impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. With the proceeds they earned as the result of previous loans, they were able to run their homes. 

Kerelie B. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Sanda village, which is about 45 miles from Magburaka town. She is age 55, approximately. She is married with eight children. All of her children are now adults except for two who are still in school. Kerelie has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. She sells market food. She will use this loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her food business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Guérisseurs 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous avons déjà soldé notre prêt. Nous voudrions qu’on nous le renouvelle pour continuer à exercer notre activité en  achetant des produits (plantes médicinales)qui permettront de préparer des recettes à base des médicaments utilisables lesquels seront mis à la disposition de la population locale à des prix accessibles.
