Grâce à cette pharmacopée, nous avons pu alléger la souffrance de populations face aux besoins familiaux à savoir la préoccupation des mères pour leurs enfants dans le cadre de la santé et la malnutrition.
texts.en:
We have already settled our loan. We would like it to be renewed in order to continue to do our work by buying merchandise (medicinal plants), which will allow us to employ recipes for making usable medicines, which will be made available to the local people at accessible prices. Thanks to these pharmacological raw materials, we've been able to alleviate the people's suffering in addressing family needs, that is, the concern that mothers have for their children regarding health and malnutrition.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pharmacopeia

loans.name: Hold Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Esther B., Zainab B., Isatu G., and Kadiatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka. They called their group Hold Sorbeh. This group has received several loans from SMT/Kiva. These loans have made massive contributions towards the well-being and development of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 3,600,000 to further strengthen their businesses. 
Esther B. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age forty and married to a businessman. The two of them have four children. Two of her children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Esther has been a businesswoman since childhood. She sells dried fish. She will invest the entire loan in her dried fish business. A basket full of dried fish usually costs SLL 500,000.

loans.use: Invest in her dried fish business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a crusher for palm nuts

loans.name: Foindu Group

texts.en:
This is Mye John B., Abibatu C., and Mariama S.. They are local businesspeople in Magburaka town. They named their group Foindu, after the village of the group leader. They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had a tremendous impact on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to look after themselves and their families. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further expand their businesses. 

Abibatu C. (left) sells firewood, cold water, and local produce. Mye John B. (middle) sells building materials like sand, stones, and sticks. And Mariama S. (right) sells ink, soda, powder, and white cottons. 

Mye John B. is the leader of the group. He was born in Magburaka, which is in the Tonkolili district of northern Sierra Leone. He is 38 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have five children who are in primary and secondary school. Mye John has more than ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: Invest in his retail business

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq S. is a 35-year-old tailor. He is married and has three children and is very proud to be the father of such a big family.

Mushviq started his business seven years ago. He is a very popular tailor among local people. His working day starts at 7:00 in the morning and finishes late at night. His customers know that he is very responsible and always finishes an order on time.

Now Mushviq would like to expand his business and purchase modern tailoring tools. For this purpose he has applied for a $1200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase modern tailoring tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow pineapples

loans.name: Good Faith Group

texts.en:
This is Hawa O. B., Isatu C. B., Mohamed K. and Dora S.. They named their group Good Faith. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made meaningful contributions towards the development and wellbeing of these entrepreneurs. Previous loans enabled them to expand their businesses, made better sales and increased profit. Consequently, their standards of living have improved. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Hawa O. B. (second from left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have two children together, both of whom are still in primary schools. Hawa, together with her husband, sells rice, soda, cements, etc. wholesale. She has had over ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise agouti

loans.name: Gara United Group

texts.en:
This is Mohamed T. and Aminata J.. They named their group Gara United. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town. Mohamed sells “gara lapper” materials – white cotton cloth, inks, soda, powder, etc. “Gara lapper” is the term used for locally dyed cloth. Aminata sells market food. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs have received from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have had a lot of meaningful impacts on the lives of these borrowers. Previous loans have enabled their businesses to grow and have improved their standard of living. 

Mohamed T. (left) is the leader. He was born in Magburaka. He is 36, married to a businesswoman, and the couple has two children. One child is in primary school and the other is still quite young. Mohamed has more than fifteen years of experience in business. With this loan, he will buy a bale of white cotton and inks.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock livestock feed and build a pen

loans.name: Gpf Pointe Sarrène 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous remercions Kiva de nous avoir fait confiance en nous finançant. Cela nous a permis de réaliser notre activité qui est celle de la transformation de produits halieutiques. Après avoir soldé notre premier prêt, nous venons solliciter un 2e prêt qui va permettre de continuer notre activité principale de transformation et commercialisation de produits halieutiques, mais aussi diversifier les activités en faisant du maraichage en saison des pluies pour rembourser notre prêt dans les délais quand on sait que durant la saison des pluies, il nous est très difficile de vendre les produits à cause des problèmes de séchage et de conservation.
texts.en:
We thank Kiva for putting faith in us and financing us. This allowed us to realize our business, which is the processing of fish products. After having settled our first loan, we have come to ask for a second loan which will allow us to continue our principal business of processing and marketing fish products, and also to diversify our activities through market gardening during the rainy season. This will help us repay our loan during these times, since we know that during the rainy season, it is very difficult for us to sell our products due to difficulties in drying and preserving the fish.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish products and fresh fish for processing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To secure a regular supply of palm nuts

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Mme Ayaovi K. est née en 1969 à Gapé Hlihagbé. Elle est mariée et à en charge huit (08) enfants. Son activité principale est le décorticage des noix palmistes pour la préparation de l’huile palmiste. En effet, elle achète les noix palmistes chez les bonnes femmes, les décortique et les revend pour la préparation d’huile. Afin d’avoir un stock permanent, elle sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux gérer les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayaovi K. was born in 1969 in Gapé Hlihagbé. She is married and has eight children in her care. Her main business is the shelling of palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil. In fact, she buys palm nuts from good honest women, shells the nuts, and resells them for the preparation of oil. In order to have a permanent stock, she is seeking a loan. The profit from her business will allow her to better manage her household expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell oil from palm nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell traditional soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cultivate taro

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell water

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Since 1986, Kate M. has worked as a trader selling material and clothing at Anafo near Cape Coast. She is married with 1 child and her husband works as a refrigerator repairman.  Kate is responsible for paying her family’s water bill and her child’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional material and clothing to support her business.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional material and clothing to support her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Los Obreros Group

texts.es: El banco comunal denominado "Los Obrero" esta representado por el señor Demetrioa y conformada por 12 personas las cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como  a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, a la venta D. comida, empanadas, carne, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, frutas y verduras. Cada uno D. los miembros sabe que existe gran competencia en el mercado pero también sabe que debe esforzarse en su puesto D. venta ya que representa el ingreso diario y el sustento D. su familia es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento para poder obtener mayor mercadería a un precio mas bajo así como la compra D. insumos para brindar un producto acabado que pueda competir en el mercado. Este grupo es relativamente nuevo por lo que no tiene mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero están concientes que se requiere D. un mayor esfuerzo para cumplir con su grupo y con la Institución y poder mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Los Obreros" is represented by Demetrio and is maD. up of 12 persons who work in different activities, such as making wood furniture, the sale of food, empanadas, meat, groceries in neighborhood stores, fruits and vegetables. Each one of the members knows that there is a lot of competition in the market but they also know that they must work hard at their sales since this means daily income and support for their families. They need financing in order to be able to get more merchandise at lower prices as well as buy supplies so they can offer a product which can compete in the marketplace. This group is relatively new and does not have much experience with support groups, but they are aware that it requires a greater effort to fulfill their obligations with the group and the loan institution in order to improve their families´ standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Since 1990 Josephine E. has worked as a hairdresser selling creams, sprays and artificial nails at Zion Church in Cape Coast. She is married with 3 children and has received an education through the University level. While Josephine works as a hairdresser, her husband is employed as a trader. She is responsible for paying school fees, rent and utilities. Her loan will be used to purchase more quantities and varieties of hairdressing materials for resale and also improve her services at the beauty salon Z. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to finish building the home she has started.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Jesus Divino Group

texts.es: El grupo "Jesús Divino" es un grupo nuevo que esta integrado D. dieciséis  personas,  D. las cuales 4 son hombres y 12 mujeres todos ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades, los hombres son transportista,  algunas D. las mujeres tienen sus propias ventas D. abarrotes en sus domicilios y otras se dedican a la venta D. empanadas en los colegios, venta D. ropa, etc. siempre con el compromiso D. seguir creciendo. El ámbito comercial es bastante competitivo y se requiere D. capital para seguir en la lucha por salir adelante es ahí donD. los fondos otorgado por nuestra institución coadyuvan al mejoramiento D. fuentes D. ingreso mejorando sus herramientas D. trabajo y con la compra D. mercadería D. mejor calidad para poder  obtener un mejor ingreso diario. Los socios no tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios pero saben como manejar los fondos otorgados y hacer crecer más sus negocios para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y poder cumplir con las obligaciones que cada uno D. los socios tiene.
texts.en:
The group "Jesús Divino" is a new group maD. up of 16 persons, 4 men and 12 women, who work in different activities. The men are in transportation, some of the women sell groceries out of their own homes and others sell empanadas at schools, sell clothing, etc., always with the commitment to keep growing. The market is quite competitive and requires capital to stay in the struggle to get ahead. This is where the funds granted by Fundación Agrocapital helps improve their sources of income, by improving their working tools and with the purchase of better-quality merchandise to they can obtain a daily income. The members do not have much experience in support groups but they know how to manage their loans and to make their businesses grow so that they can proviD. their families with a better standard of living and meet the obligations each of them have with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia A. is married and has 2 children. She has received an education through Senior High School. Since 2003, Anastasia has been a trader selling second hand clothes in Cape Coast. She also sews traditional clothing for ladies. While Anastasia is employed as a trader, her husband works as a land surveyor. Anastasia uses her income to pay for rent, utilities and food. She will use the loan to purchase more clothes to sell and sewing materials to enhance her sewing work. With the new profits from her expanded business, Anastasia plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell and sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty F. is single and has two children. She has received an education through senior high school.

Betty works as a trader selling provisions, footwear and bags in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2000. Betty uses her income to pay for school fees, food and utilities.

Betty will use the loan to purchase provisions, footwear and bags in bulk for reselling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Betty plans to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase provisions, footwear and bags in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise and sell agoutis

loans.name: Maltra

texts.en:
Since 1992, Maltra G. has worked as a seamstress, sewing and selling fabric in Cape Coast.

Maltra is single with three children and has received an education through senior high school. She is responsible for paying rent, school fees and utility bills.

Maltra's loan will be used to purchase more material for sewing and selling and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more material for sewing and selling

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo "Primavera" esta representado por el señor José Raúl y conformado por 12 personas que van cursando juntos ya su tercer ciclo, el presidente se dedica a la distribución de refrescos en botellas de plástico al interior del departamento, el resto de los socios venden artículos de ferretería en tiendas o se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tienda de barrio y productos en general como huevos, refrescos y celulares. Por la misma actividad a la que se dedican requieren de capital para la obtención de productos al por mayor y así poder abaratar sus costos y competir en el mercado con mercaderías de buena calidad. Los socios cuentan con la experiencia de haber trabajado anteriormente con nuestra entidad teniendo grandes expectativas de seguir creciendo junto a nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The "Primavera" group is represented by José Raúl and is made up of 12 persons who are in their third loan cycle. The president of the group distributes bottled soft drinks within the province, the rest of the members sell hardware in stores or sell groceries in neighborhood stores or sell goods in general such as eggs, soft drinks, and cell phones. Because of their activities, they require capital so they can buy their products wholesale and in this way be able to lower their costs and compete in the marketplace with good quality merchandise. The members have prior experience working with Fundación Agrocapital and have high expectations to continue growing with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Since 2008, Alice D. has worked as a trader selling silver plates, bowls and saucepans in Cape Coast. She is married with four children and has received an education through senior high school. Her husband is now retired. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees and also her family’s utility bills. Her loan will be used to purchase goods at  wholesale prices which she will then resell. She hopes to use the profits to expand her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware at wholesale prices for retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell palm oil

loans.name: Las Colorinas Group

texts.es: El Baco Comunal " Las Colorinas" esta conformado por un grupo D. socias que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupos solidarios ya que cumplieron con responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus anteriores financiamientos. el grupo se encuentra dirigido por la señora Susana y conformado por 13 miembros en su mayoría mujeres dedicados a actividades comerciales como la venta D. relojes, abarrotes, material escolar, ropa, lácteos y alguno D. los varones al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del rubro comercial existe gran demanda y oferta D. productos por lo que los socios deben esforzarse el doble para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a sus hogares, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento ya que coadyuvara al crecimiento D. sus pequeños negocios para que estos con mayor mercadería y con herramientas en buen estado generaran mayor ingreso pudiendo así brindar una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. El grupo esta conformado D. manera sólida puesto que ya cuenta con la suficiente experiencia en grupos solidarios y con la capacidad para el buen manejo D. los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The "Las Colorinas" communal bank is make up of a group of members who have experience with support groups and have been responsible and punctual in complying with their previous loans. The group is managed by Susana and maD. up of 13 members, most of them women, who work in different commercial activities such as the sale of watches, groceries, school supplies, clothing, dairy products and some of the men work in passenger transportation. Within the marketplace there is a stiff competition and the members have to work doubly hard to earn money for their households. For this reason they need financing to help their small businesses grow, so that with more merchandise and with good working tools they can generate greater income and proviD. a better standard of living for their families. The group is solid and has enough experience in support groups to manage the loans they receive.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Gaia Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Gaia" esta conformado por  un grupo D. socias que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupos solidarios ya que cumplieron con responsabilidad y puntualidad con sus anteriores financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital. Los 12 miembros del grupo eligieron como su representante a la señora Lotty quien al igual que el resto del grupo se dedica a la comercialización D. productos como venta D. barrotes en tiendas D. barrios, venta D. comida, ropa, zapatos y el resto D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a actividades como a la elaboración D. muebles D. madera, al servicio D. transporte público y a cortes D. cabello en peluquerías. Dentro del rubro comercial existe gran demanda y oferta D. productos por lo que los socios deben esforzarse el doble para poder llevar el pan D. cada día a sus hogares, es por esta razón que requieren del financiamiento ya que coadyuvara al crecimiento D. sus pequeños negocios para que estos con mayor mercadería y con herramientas en buen estado generaran mayor ingreso pudiendo así brindar una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Gaia" communal bank is maD. up of a group of members who have prior experience working in support groups and have complied responsibly and on time with previous loans in institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. The 12 members of the group have chosen Lotty as their representative. Lotty and most of the group sell products such as groceries in neighborhood stores, food, clothing and shoes and the rest of the group work at different activities such as making wood furniture, public transportation and cutting hair in beauty shops. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace and the members have to try doubly hard to earn money for their households. For this reason they need financing which will help them grow their small businesses so that with more merchandise and working tools in good condition they can generate more income, thus providing a better standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is divorced. She has one daughter who is 14. Galina offers medical diagnostic services. She started this business four years ago. She offers computer diagnostics of various diseases as well as treatment and preventative medicine. She has helped many people improve their health. Galina would like to receive a loan of 9,390 UAH to purchase medicine and maintain her equipment. Galina likes her business and wants to develop it further.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and maintain equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer, programs and books

loans.name: Fatima Gloria

texts.es: La señora Fátima C. tiene 39 años de edad y su esposo es el señor José Rojas de 46 años de edad. . Junto a sus dos hijos, viven en la Avenida Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la zona Obispo Bosque, en la populosa de tacagua. Ellos tienen una tienda de barrio hace más de cinco años. Don José es transportista asalariado. La señora Fátima es quien principalmente se ocupa de la tienda por lo que ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano en la mañana para traer el pan y además debe alistar a sus hijos para que vayan al colegio. Dos veces a la semana ella va a realizar compras para surtir la tienda. Ahora ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar bolsas de arroz, azúcar y refrescos para aumentar la tienda. Ella y su esposo trabajan con mucha dedicación para poder criar y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fátima C. is 39; her husband, José Rojas is 46. They live with their two children in the Avenida Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz, Obispo Bosque zone, in the populous area of Tacagua. They have had a neighborhood store for more than five years. José is a driver. Fátima is the one who mainly takes care of the store. In order to do this, she has to get up very early in the morning to bring the bread to the store and get her children ready for school. She makes purchases to stock the store two times a week. She is now asking for a loan to be able to buy bags of rice, sugar, and soft drinks to augment her store. She and her husband work with such dedication to be able to take care of their children and see them become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy noodles, rice, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Juanito Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro es esposo de la señora Marcela Añamuri quien es una cliente antigua. En esta oportunidad el señor Genaro es titular del crédito por que su esposa tuvo que dejar su actividad de venta de frutas. Ellos tienen una pequeña hija a quien crían con mucho cariño y dedicación. Don Genaro es chofer propietario, tiene una Vagoneta y esta trabajando en el sindicato “Litoral”, como taxi de ruta fija.
Ellos trabajan con mucha responsabilidad y esmero. Uno de sus principales sueños es poder comprar su casa y ver crecer a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Genaro is the husband of Marcela Añamuri who is a former client. On this occasion Genaro is taking the loan out in his name because his wife had to give up selling fruit. They have a small daughter whom they are raising with much care and dedication. Genaro is a driver: he has a Vagoneta and works as part of the syndicate “Litoral” as a fixed-route taxi. They work very responsibly and with much care. One of their main dreams is to be able to buy their house and to see their little daughter grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a battery and spark plugs for the vehicle

loans.name: Amigos En Fe Group

texts.es:
el grupo Amigos en FE son unas personas muy unidas las cuales se tienen mucho aprecio entre ellas mismas, las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
CARLOS SAMUEL V. P. el tiene en su casa de habitacion un molino para moler Maíz, y tambien venta de variedades como ser: Ropa de vestir, ropa interior, cosmeticos, sandalias de hule y otras. actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace un año, el se levanta a las 4:30 A.M a moler maíz y a las 7:30 A.M esta terminando de la molida, pero en el resto del dia se dedica a vender de manera ambulante con el negocio de variedades.- 
el Sr. V.,  es padre soltero y esta criando 2 hijos ya que el se separo de su esposa y es él 
quien mira por ellos, es un hombre que lo admiran los vecinos donde el recide por su responsabilidad como padre.
TERESA DE JESUS S. C. ella tiene 15 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad ya que su madre tenia este tipo de negocio y ella era la encargada del mismo, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería C. PAVON ubicado en su casa de habitación; Doña Teresa, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que depende a un 100% de ella, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, Educación de sus hijos, y cubre los gastos finacieros que ella adquiere para su negocio.
ANGELA DEL ROSARIO S. S. ella se dedica a la producción y venta de tortillas de maíz, negocio que inicio por que la situación economica para su hogar no era muy favorable, ella vive en union libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica hacer trabajos de estructuras metalicas, es madre
de 2 hijos, que dependen de ellos, y con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella colabora a su esposo a cubrir ciertos gastos del hogar, como ser alimentación y el estudio de su hija mayor.
texts.en:
The group “Amigos en FE” is made up of a handful of people who are united by their great mutual respect for each other. Their activities are as follows:

Carlos Samuel V. P. has a mill in his house to grind corn. He also sells various items such as clothes, underwear, cosmetics, rubber sandals and other things. He has been doing this work for almost a year. He gets up at 4:30am to grind corn which he finishes at 7:30am, but for the rest of the day he works as a peddler selling his various items.

Mr. V. is a single father and is bringing up 2 children now that he has separated from his wife and it is up to him to look out for them. He is a man much admired by his neighbours for his parenting skills.

Teresa de Jesus S. C. has 15 years’ experience because her mother had the same type of business which she was in charge of. Her business operates under the name of C. Pavon grocery store and is located in her house. Doña Teresa is a single mother and has 3 children who are 100% dependent upon her. With the income generated by her business she pays for their food, her children’s education and any costs arising from the business.

Angela del Rosario S. S. makes and sells corn tortillas, a business that came about because her financial situation at home was not very favourable. She lives with her partner who makes metal structures. She is mother to 2 children who are dependent upon her and with the income generated by her business she works with her husband to cover certain household expenses such as food and her eldest daughter’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Sum Sandals, BEBE sandals, young men's sandals, rice, sugar, lard, corn flour, toilet paper, salsa, bleach, coffee, fire wood, corn and lime.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr.C. , el se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulperia tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el esta casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno esta casado y el otro estudia. el desea surtir mas su negocio para poder incrementar su clientela asi permitiendole generar mayores ganancias y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, su negocio ha crecido un poco ya que los productos que el vende son de primera necesidad y para este credito que esta solicitando espera poder hacer crecer su negocio en un 30% ya que invertira su credito en la compra de mercaderia. su meta es tener un mercadito grande en el cual pueda vender de todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Mr. C. is a businessman who has been running a grocery store for more than 2 years. He is married, has 2 children, one of whom is married and the other is studying. He wants to expand his business so that he can increase his number of customers which will allow him to earn a better income and improve the living conditions for his family. His business has grown a little since the products that he sells are basic necessities and, by way of this loan that he is asking for, he hopes to be able to grow his business by 30% by using the money to buy merchandise. His aim is to have a big market from which he can sell all manner of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoo, creams, lotions and spare parts for the repair of a mill

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Luisa es casada  tiene 67 años, cinco hijos todos son mayores y están casados.
Luisa trabajaba en el  mercado de surquillo vendiendo ropa interior,  era ambulante, lo municipales  le prohibieron las ventas, ella tuvo que dejar de vender y se fue a su casa, allí tuvo la idea de poner un bazar y vender  la  mercadería que tenia. 
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles para la compra de cosas para su bazar
Desde que está  en Finca, aprendió a no endeudarse, a ser precavida, le gusta pertenecer al Bancomunal por los prestamos que dan, y por que tiene amigas las cuales comparten momentos de camaradería. 
El sueño de Luisa es viajar a ver a sus hijas que están en Italia.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Mujeres Independientes (Independent Women) Community Bank. Luisa is married, is 67 years old and has five children, all of whom are older and are married. Luisa used to work in the Surquillo (a district in Lima) market selling underwear on foot. However, the municipality prohibited her sales. She had to give up selling and return home where she had the idea to start a store and sell the merchandise she had from there. Luisa needs a loan of 1,800 soles in order to purchase items for her store. Since joining FINCA, she has learned to avoid debt, be cautious, and she enjoys belonging to her community bank due to the loans it gives and because she has friends who share moments of comradery. Luisa's dream is to travel to see her daughters who are in Italy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luisa needs a loan of 1,800 soles in order to purchase items for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Rosa es conviviente tiene 56 años, seis hijos de 37, 35, 32,30 y el ultimo de 11 años que está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Rosa trabajaba en su taller de estampados en gamarra, y descuidaba a su hijo menor, tuvo que dejar el trabajo para pasar más tiempo con su hijo, y dejar a su hijo mayor a cargo del negocio.      Es cuando decide poner en su casa una bodega y ponerse a vender,   compro una exhibidora, una vitrina para su bodega.  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para la compra de  mercadería para su bodega para el día de la madre, va compra arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche al por mayor.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió cómo funciona  el Bancomunal, ella es titular de la chequera aprendió a desenvolverse, era muy tímida.
El sueño de Rosa es agrandar más su negocio, con más mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Mujeres Independientes (Independent Women) Community Bank. Rosa lives with her partner, is 56 years old, and has six children who are 37, 35, 32, 30 and the youngest is 11 who is studying in public school. Rosa was working in her stamping workshop in Gamarra and was neglecting her youngest son. She had to leave her job to spend more time with her child and left her eldest son in charge of the business. This is when she decided to start a shop in her home and begin to sell. She purchased a glass case for her shop. Rosa needs a loan of 3,400 soles in order to purchase merchandise for her shop for mother's day. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk at wholesale. Since joining FINCA, she has learned how a community bank works. She is the treasurer. She learned how to cope as she was very timid. Rosa's dream is to grow her business more with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 3,400 soles in order to purchase merchandise for her shop for mother's day. She's going to buy rice, sugar, oil, and milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Azalia Graciela

texts.es: La Sra.Z. tiene una pulpería desde hace un año operando bajo el nombre de Pulpería y Variedades  "AZALIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos dependen al 100% de ellos, tres de sus hijos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad.  La Sra Azalia es una mujer muy emprendedora con deseos de superacion y quiere dar todo lo mejor para sus hijos para que ellos se preparen y sean personas de bien en su vida, su negocio le genera los recursos finanacieros para cumplir con las obligaciones en el hogar, ella nos comento que esta muy feliz porque todo le va saliendo bien y que espera que con este credito ella pueda mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Z. has a owned a grocery store for a year, operating under the name Pulpería y Variedades "AZALIA" (Azalia Grocery and Varieties). Her business is located in her home. She is married and a mother to four children, all of whom are 100% dependent on her. Three of her children are in the city's public high school or elementary school. Azalia is an entrepreneurial woman with desires to get ahead and she wants to give the best to her children so that they are prepared and may have good lives. Her business generates the financial resources to pay the bills at home. She has commented that she is very happy because everything is going well and she hopes that, with this loan, she may improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, coffee and refreshments.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Martina es casada tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 11 y 3 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Martina estudio cosmetología, trabajo por mucho tiempo en una peluquería donde aprendió sobre el negocio,  con los ahorros juntados decidió abrir una peluquería que lleva por nombre “Martica” 
Martina necesita  un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de sillones y líquidos para la peluquería.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió  a invertir, ha podido implementar su peluquería, aprendió a ser solidaria.
El sueño de Martina es  terminar su casa
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the "Mujeres Independientes" (Independent Women) Community Bank. She is married, is 35 years old and has two children who are 11 and three years old and who are in public school. Martina studied cosmetology. She worked for a long time in a salon where she learned about the business. With her savings, she decided to open a salon that carries the name "Martica." Martina needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of chairs and liquids for the salon. Since joining FINCA, she has learned how to invest. She has been able to start her salon and learned to be supportive. Martina's dream is to finish her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Martina needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of chairs and liquids for the salon.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita R. es cliente antigua desde el año 2001, demostrando siempre puntualidad y responsabilidad en su pagos, a la fecha se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia de credito individual, ella se dedica a repartir sombreros y mantas de vicuña, animal tipico de la codillera de los Andes. Ella vive con sus hijos, dos menores que estudian y otros dos mayores que son casados, todos ellos pero independientes. aunque el último de sus hijos quedó viudo y ella se dedica a cuidar al bebé que tuvo.La Sra. Benita R. vive en casa propia y es muy conocida por los vecinos. Su actividad la realiza con sus vecinos y toda persona que le hace el pedido, su cobro es a plazos.
texts.en:
Benita R. has been a customer since the year 2001, always demonstrating punctuality and responsibility in her payments. On the date when she found herself in her fourth round of individual credit, she decided to sell vicuña hats and blankets. Vicuña is a typical animal from the Andes mountain range. She lives with her children, two younger ones who study and the other two older ones who are married and are independent. Although, the last of her children is a widow and she is dedicated to take caring of his baby. Benita R. lives in her own home and is well known by her neighbors. She does business with her neighbors and anyone else who places an order at collection time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hats for cholitas (indigenous women)

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes.
Roxana es casada tiene 41 años, tres hijos de 24, 15 y 10 años, los menores están estudiando en la escuela estatal  
 Estudio cosmetología, y trabajo en una peluquería, decidió  estudiar repostería, y se especializo en buffet, al tiempo tuvo que dejar la peluquería por que el buffet le demandaba más tiempo y le rendía más económicamente, actualmente solo se dedica al servicio de buffet.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de menajes de cocina y telas para  hacer manteles.
Desde que está en Finca  aprendió la responsabilidad y ahorrar para llegar a cumplir su sueño. 
El sueño de Roxana es tener su local de buffet, donde atienda al público, y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the bank "Bancocomunal Mujeres Independientes". Roxana is married, 41 years old, and has three children aged 24, 15, and 10. The youngest children study in public school. She studied cosmetology and worked in a salon. She decided to study pastrymaking, specializing in buffets. The time came when she had to leave the salon because the buffet was demanding more time and was producing better financially. Now she only dedicates herself to servicing the buffet. Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles for the purchase of kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she learned to be responsible and to save to achieve her dream. Roxana's dream is to have her own local buffet, where she services the public, and also to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roxana needs a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase kitchenware and fabric to make tablecloths.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda  es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Independientes
Nilda es conviviente tiene 45 años cuatro hijos de 25 y 19 años  que están estudiando  instituto superior y trabajando.
Nilda empezó vendiendo comida en mesa redonda ambulante, la municipalidad la saco y tuvo que cambiar de negocio, puso una bodega en su casa y al mismo tiempo se puso a reciclar plásticos, papeles y a venderlos.
Nilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa y arroz y varios   abarrotes para su bodega.
Desde que está en Finca, su autoestima ha crecido ha podido lograr muchas cosas como persona y sobre todo como mujer.
El sueño de Nilda es comprarse un carro y tener  otra  bodega más.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the Mujeres Independientes community bank. Nilda, 45, is in a common law marriage and has four children ranging from 25 to 19. The children are studying at institutions of higher learning and working. Nilda started selling meals as a street vendor in Mesa Redonda. The local government stopped her, and she had to change businesses. She set up a small grocery store in her house, and at the same time she started to recycle plastics and paper and sell them. Nilda needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy beer, soft drinks, rice, and various other groceries for her store. Since she has been with Finca, her self esteem has grown. She has been able to achieve many things as a person, and above all, as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, soft drinks, rice, and various other groceries for her store

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El Sr.G. cuenta con un centro de molinos operando bajo el nombre de MOLINO  "MONTE CRISTO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el es casado y padre de 3 hijos, todos dependen de el,  todos ellos estudian en la secundaria y primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad.  El Sr.EUSEBIO tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 17 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, su preferible clientela estan muy satisfechos con su esmerada y fina atencion brindadas por su persona y su esposa ya que juntos atienden este negocio, el cual les genera recursos finanacieros para suplir los gastos dentro del hogar y el mantenimiento de su negocio, pero como casi siempre es necesario buscar apoyo financiero esta solicitando un credito para poder arreglar unos de los motores que tiene en mal estado.
texts.en:
Mr. G. has a center for mills named Molino Monte Cristo. His business is located in his house. He is married and has three dependent children. The children all attend the city’s public schools in elementary and high school. Eusebio has a lot of experience managing this type of business. He has worked in this area for seventeen years. His better customers are very satisfied with his attention to detail and the polite attention he and his wife offer. Eusebio and his wife tend the business together. This generates enough income to cover the household expenses and run the business. However, he almost always needs to look for financial support. He is asking for a loan to be able to repair some of the motors he has that are in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for the mill

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en el distrito de Acosvinchos en donde vende abarrotes, este negocio esta administrado por su prima. Además Rosa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde también brinda servicio de fotocopias, los días sábados y domingos viaja a la feria de Acosvinchos en donde compra cereales.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo y cereales.
Rosa sueña con techar el tercer piso de su casa, surtir con mas productos sus negocios y comprar un carro para alquilar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas community bank. Rosa, 36, is in a common law marriage and has four children. Rosa has a store in the Acosvinchos district where she sells groceries. Her cousin runs the business. Rosa also has a grocery store in her house in the city of Ayacucho. She also offers photocopy services in the store. On Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the Acosvinchos fair to buy cereal. Rosa needs a loan for 2,100 PEN to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cereal. Rosa dreams of putting a roof on the third floor of her house, stocking her business with more products, and buying a car to rent to others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cereal

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Eugenia tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. cereales, abarrotes en general, sus productos son adquiridos en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales, arroz, azúcar.
Eugenia espera seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Virgen D. Cocharcas Communal Bank. She is 60 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a stand in the Mariscal Cáceres market where she sells cereals and general groceries. She purchases her products in the city’s wholesale food market. Eugenia needs a loan of 900 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of cereals, rice, and sugar. Eugenia hopes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cereals, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Iris Wuvaldina

texts.es: La Sra. B. tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "EDUARDO" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales ya solo depende uno,  el otro ya se hizo su vida y esta casado, su esposo se dedica al Transporte el realiza fletes dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Doña Iris nos comento muy alegre que su negocio le ha sido de gran bendición, ya que con los ingresos que le ha generado el mismo ella ha ido invirtiendo mas en su negocio y cumpliendo con los compromisos adquiridos. ella necesita el credito porque necesita capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio y comprar granos basicos ya que estos se estan escaseando y encareciendo en esta epoca y los vendedores lo ponen a un precio alto que es dificil comprarlo.
texts.en:
For the past 10 years Iris has had a small grocery store, which is called the “EDUARDO” grocery store. Her business is located in her home. Iris is married and has 2 sons; one of her sons still lives with her, while the other is married and no longer lives at home. Iris’s husband works in transport and provides a charter service both inside and outside the city. Iris tells us very happily that her business has been a great blessing, since with the income it has generated she has invested more in her business and fulfilled her financial obligations. She is requesting a loan because she needs working capital so she can re-supply her business and purchase basic grains. Basic grains are currently scarce and becoming more expensive, since the vendors are putting a high price on them and making them difficult to purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, churros, cookies, candies, coffee, bread, rice, beans, lard, oil, tortillas, toilet paper, soap, and sugar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Nancy es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Nancy vende golosinas, canchas (bocaditos) con juguetes que ella misma prepara con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, los juguetes los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima sus ventas son al por mayor a las tiendas. Además Nancy junto a su esposo tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes y arroz.
Nancy sueña con tener una tienda mayorista de pasamanería y golosinas, que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas Communal Bank. Nancy is 39 years old, married and has four children. She sells sweets and snacks which she prepares with the help of her husband and children. She also sells toys which she gets in the city of Lima and sells wholesale to the stores. And what's more, Nancy together with her spouse has a mototaxi with which they provide transportation to the public. Nancy needs a loan of 1,500 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of toys and rice. Nancy dreams of having a wholesale store for general merchandise and sweets, and that her children will become professional people.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys and rice.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Victoria es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Victoria vive en el distrito de Acosvinchos, Victoria junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de tejas de manera artesanal, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de peones, las tejas los comercializa en el mismo lugar.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y pago de peones.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y ayudar a sus hijos hasta que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas Communal Bank. Victoria is 44 years of age, married and has four children. She lives in the Acosvinchos district. She and her husband work at producing handcrafted weavings, with which she has the help of laborers. The finished weavings are sold in the same place they are produced. Victoria needs a loan of 1,200 Sols which will be invested in buying firewood and paying her workers. Victoria's dreams are to have a grocery store in her house and to help her children until they have finished their education.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and pay the laborers.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1118, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y 5 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Con el fin D. contribuir con los ingresos económicos D. su hogar le nace la idea D. aperturar un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas preparadas y poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su restaurant y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, verduras diversas,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Dora, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Dora belongs to the "Invincible Women" Community Bank. She lives at 1118 Jorge Chávez, Tatapoto District, San Martin Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is married, is 55 years old, and has five children, all of them independent. With the goal of contributing to the household income she got the idea of opening a small business selling prepared foods and little by little has gained experience in this type of work, making herself very well known and liked by her clients. Currently she is continuing with the same business, attending to her clients who come daily to her restaurant. She herself takes care of them with her rich flavors and the friendliness of her character. She wants to invest this loan of 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar by the sack, various vegetables, eggs, and live chickens in crates. She will also buy some new kitchen utensils to replace what she currently has and proviD. better service and attention to her clients. Dora feels very confident and hopes to continue to move ahead and assure herself of a tranquil life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her realize her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her prepared foods

loans.name: Alegres De Corazon Group

texts.es: La. Sra. Celia Mery Q. C. atiende en su pensión hace quince años, solicita el credito por la necesidad que tiene de hacer estudiar a su hija que esta en la universidad, como es viuda la señora no cuenta con ningún apoyo de sus familiares y necesita del programa para que su hija continue estudiando y termine la carrera que escogio.                                                                                                                                                                           La Sra. Rosmery C. G. tiene tres hijitos menores, le abandono su esposo en el tercer hijo y tiene la necesidad de un credito para continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios escolares.   Su actividad es la de venta de papa en un mercado de la zona de El Tejar, ella compra al por mayor para luego vender al raleo (por menor).                                                                                                                La Sra. Delina S. B. tiene una tienda de comestibles quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para apoyar a sus hijos que estan estudiando en colegio y tiene la necesidad de un credito  para mejorar su condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Celia Mery Q. C. has been running her pension for fifteen years and requests a loan which she needs to allow her daughter to study at the university. Since she is a widow, she cannot count on any help from family members and needs the assistance of the program so that her daughter can continue to study and complete the career she has chosen. Mrs. Rosmery C. G. has three minor children, has been abandoned by her husband with whom she had the third son, and has need of a loan to continue helping her children with their studies. Her work is the sale of potatoes in the market of the zone known as El Tejar. She buys at wholesale and then sells at retail. Mrs. Delina S. B. has a grocer's shop. She wants to increase her working capital to be able to help her children who are studying in high school. She needs a loan to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory at wholesale (rice, noodles, sugar, oil, etc.); to continue childrens' education

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Francisca es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Francisca vive en el distrito de Acosvinchos en donde tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Francisca se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuy, también siembra cereales como maíz que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y golosinas.
Los sueños de Francisca son que su hija culmine sus estudios y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the “Virgen de Cocharcas” Communal Bank. Francisca is married, 42 years old, and has 2 children. Francisca lives in the Acosvinchos district where she has a stO. in which she sells groceries, candy, beverages every day. In addition Francisca raises beef cattle, guinea pig and also grows grains such as corn that she sells in Ayacucho city. Francisca needs a loan for 600 soles which will be used to buy rice, sugar, and candy. Francisca dreams that her daughter finishes school and to stock mO. products in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and candy.

loans.name: Hanit Nohelia

texts.es:
Noelia es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Noelia es soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Noelia estudia computación, además vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Noelia necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de labiales, colonias.
Los sueños de Noelia son tener un negocio estable, tener una empresa de mototaxis y que su hijos tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Noelia is a member of the “Virgen de Cocharcas” Communal Bank. Noelia is single, 21 years old and has 1 son. Noelia studies information technology. In addition she sells cosmetics via catalog to friends and family, the majority of her sales are on credit. Computación needs a loan for 450 soles to invest in buying lipsticks and cologne. Noelia dreams of having a stable business, having a motortaxi business and that her children have a good education. .

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lipsticks and colognes.

loans.name: Ruth María

texts.es:
La señora Ruth María S. G. tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 3 hijos.
Ruth se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas (en su bodega y por medio de un triciclo). Cuando inicio su negocio solo vendía gaseosas, luego empezó a surtir su tienda permitiendo así ahorrar para poner otro negocio que es la venta de desayuno, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para surtir su bodega (galletas. Golosinas, gaseosas, útiles escolares).
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, podrá invertir en la compra de golosinas y gaseosas.
Ruth tiene como sueño poner una tienda comercial amplia y grnade donde pueda ofertar más productos.
texts.en:
Ruth María S. G. is 46 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed high school and has 3 children. Ruth sells candy and soda pop (in her store and on a tricycle). When she began her business she only sold soda pop, then she began to stock her store enabling her to save to open another business which is selling breakfast, a business she runs from her home. With the first loan for 300 soles that she received from her Communal Bank “Romanas Luchadoras II,” she invested in buying items to stock her store (cookies, candy, soda pop, school supplies). With this loan for 1000 soles she will buy candy and soda pop. Ruth has a dream of opening a large store where she can offer more products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and soda pop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La Sra.H. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulpería, tiene 10 años de tenerla, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "YESSENIA" su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. ella es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales ya solo depende uno de su matrimonio el otro ya no vive con ellos, su esposo se dedica a la caficultura y tiene una pequeña finca de café ya que el lugar donde vive es apto para ese cultivo. Doña Lucia  ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos con la educacion y su esposo con los gastos del hogar. ella en este momento necesita el credito para la compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Lucia H. sells basic goods that people use daily. She has a small grocery store, which she has had for 10 years and operates under the name “Yessenia”. The business is located in her house. She is married and is the mother of 2 children, of which only one still depends on herself and her husband; the other no longer lives with them. Her husband is a coffee farmer and he has a small coffee farm, since the place where they live is good for growing this crop. Lucia has been able to support her children through their education and has been able to help her husband with the household expenses. At this moment she needs the loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, coffee, shortening, beans, rice, sugar, cooking oil, chips and snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, toilet paper, soups, soaps

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florencia Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Florencia Sonia C. se individualizo con el credito desde hace dos secuencias, ella trabajaba en grupo CLAVELITOS en diez secuencias, ella se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en la Feria de Ovejuyo, posteriormente, cambio de actividad, ahora se dedica a acomodar, a plazos, sombreros y mantas, también trabaja de empleada de limpieza en la semana, en casas particulares. Ella vive con el esposo que es transportista y sus cuatro hijos, los dos mayores trabajan por horas y continuan estudiando por las tardes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Florencia Sonia C. became independent with the credit she has been on for the past two periods. She worked for the Clavelitos group for ten periods. She used to sell vegetables in the Ovejuyo Fair and then shifted to sell hats and shawls. She also works as a cleaning lady in private homes during the week. She lives with her husband who is a transportation driver and her four children, of which the two older ones work on an hourly basis and study in the afternoons.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hats for the party in the Chasquipampa region

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther B. C. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella tiene estudios Superiores Incompletos, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria tiene como negocio principal la venta de productos de belleza y venta de sandalias. Cuando inició, la empresaria vendía productos de belleza (entre amigos) actualmente ha ampliado su negocio inscribiéndose en diversas marcas que distribuyen dichos productos, luego complementó su negocio con la venta de sandalias.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más sandalias en diferentes modelos y talla.
Maria tiene como sueño poner una tienda de venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esther B. C. is 32 years old, lives in Casa Grande district, a province of Ascope, in La Libertad department of Peru. She has some college education and has one child who financially depends on her. Maria's main business is the sale of beauty products and sandals. When she started, the entrepreneur sold beauty products to her friends and has now expanded her business by subscribing to several different brands that distribute such products. Later she added to her business by selling sandals. With her first credit of $100 that she received from her Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, she was able to invest in the purchase of beauty products. With the credit of $100, she would use it to purchase more sandals in different styles and sizes. Maria's dream is to open a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandals

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: el sr. Mario Z. se dedica a la compra/venta de madera, leña y materiales de construccion como ser cemento, arena, piedra, cal, etc. desde hace 10 años,  lo que le ha generado ingresos para apoyar a su familia financieramente y cumplir con los todos los gastos de su hogar, el en estos momentos necesita reparar su vehiculo que es su medio de trabajo, con este pickup el hace todos sus trabajos y es su herramienta numero 1 para realizar su trabajo, por tal razon solicita el credito para poder arreglarlo.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Z. has been buying and selling wood, lumber and construction materials such as cement, sand, rock and lime for the past 10 years. This has been his source of income as he has financially supported his family including all household costs. Currently he needs to repair his vehicle, as this truck is his main tool for getting all of his jobs done, which is why he requests a loan so that he's able to fix it.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of replacement car parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luci

texts.es:
La señora Luci pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo”, vive en el Jr. Libertad Nº 551, Distrito Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 3 hijas mujeres y 02 varones, es profesora en un centro educativo de educación primaria. 

Con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos al sueldo de profesora que recibe, motivada por una amiga decidió iniciar, en sus ratos libres, la venta de productos de belleza pedidos por catalogo de la línea EsiKa, CyZone y Avon, poco a poco fue haciéndose de su propio stock.

Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicado en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, comprará para incrementar su stock de productos: perfumes, colonias, lociones y desodorantes para damas y caballeros; polvos, cremas, maquillajes de rostro, lápiz labiales y esmaltes.

Luci tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Luci belongs to the “Huicungo” communal bank. She lives on Libertad Street, Huicungo District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the San Martín Department. She lives with her common-law husband, she is 44 years old, and has 3 daughters and 2 sons. She is a primary teacher at a school. With the goal of increasing her income in addition to the teacher’s salary she receives, and motivated by a friend, she decided to start selling beauty products in her free time. She sells products from the EsiKa, CyZone, and Avon lines, which are ordered from catalogs. Over time she has been building her own stock. She continues her business from her home, where her main customers are her neighbors and friends. She tells us that things are going well for her because she has permanent clients who make monthly orders. With the loan of 1,100.00 PEN, she will increase her stock by buying: perfumes, colognes, lotions and deodorants for men and women; also powders, creams, foundation, lip sticks, and nail polishes. Luci has a happy personality and charisma for selling to her customers. She comments that the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization provides women with the same opportunities to develop and make progress as men.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cosmetics for her stock

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga M. es cliente antigua, participó en el Grupo solidario D. tres peronsa llamado CONFITAL en 14 secuencias, pero por razones D. traslado D. actividad D. una D. las integrantes, el grupo se disolvió, a la fecha se encuentra en su quinta secuencia individual.La Sra Olga trabaja con Emprender desD. al año 2001, ella tiene una familia integrada por el esposo, quien trabaja D. constructor, y un pequeño hijo en edad escolar, tiene otros hijos que se encuentran casados y viven en otras zonas D. la ciudad, la crianza D. cerdos es su actividad desD. muy joven, ella los cria hasta cierta edad para luego venderlos a los carniceros, segun pedido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga M. D. M. has been a client for a long time. She participated in the three person support group called Confital in 14 periods, but because one of the members changed jobs, the group fell apart and currently is in its fifth individual period. Mrs. Olga has worked with Emprender since 2001. Her family is formed by her husband who works in construction and a young son of school age. She has other children who are married and live in other parts of the city. Since she was very young, she raised pigs until they were old enough to sell to butchers on request.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of balanced food

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marnith, pertenece al Banco Comunal ”Huicungo”, vive en el Jr. Arica  s/n, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 46 años, 06 hijos, dos aun dependen de ella y son quienes también le ayudan en el negocio 

Con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar le nace la idea de aperturar un pequeño negocio de venta de juanes  y anticuchos, acondicionando  en la  vereda  de su casa sus mesitas y sillitas para atender a sus comensales, desde sus inicio las ventas fueron buenas gracias a su buena sazón y amable trato a sus clientes, es así que con su 1er prestamo de S/. 300.00 hace realidad este viejo anhelo por lo que hasta hoy continúa con el mismo negocio. 
Con el préstamo de S/. 3000.00, comprará arroz en sacos, gallinas criollas y huevos en javas, ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los riquísimos juanes (platos típicos de la zona), también hojas de bijao para envolverlos y leña en tercios para cocinarlos, así mismo comprara carne de ganado vacuno para venderlos en kilos, además que le servirá como insumo para la preparación de los anticuchos y así satisfacer el exigente pedido de su clientela. 

Su permanencia a este grupo le ha permitido desarrollar su seguridad e independencia.  
Nos manifiesta su gran agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como persona y como empresaria
texts.en:
Marnith belongs to the “Huicungo” communal bank. She lives on Arica Street, in the Huicungo district, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the department of San Martín. She lives with her common-law husband, she is 46 years old, and has 6 children, two of whom still depend on her and they help her in her business. With the goal of increasing her income, she got the idea to open a small business selling juanes (a traditional dish made with rice, eggs, and chicken wrapped in a banana leaf) and kebabs. She fixed up the sidewalk in front of her house with tables and chairs so she could tend to her customers. From the beginning sales were good because of her good cooking and her friendly treatment of her customers. This is how with her first loan of 300.00 PEN she was able to turn her dream into reality and to this day she continues with the same business. With this loan of 3,000.00 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and also chicken and eggs, which are necessary ingredients for making the delicious juanes (a typical food of the area). She will also buy biajo leaves (similar to banana leaves) for wrapping the juanes and firewood for cooking them. She will also purchase beef to sell by the kilo. The beef will also serve as an ingredient in the kebabs and help to satisfy the demanding orders of her customers. Her participation in this group has allowed her to develop her security and independence. She has expressed to her us her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a person and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beef for making kebabs

loans.name: Nely Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Nely Argentina B. tiene un negocio de venta de cosmeticos, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es viuda y madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya estan casados, con las ventas de cosmeticos ha logrado hacer muchas cosas en su hogar poco a poco. las ventas en estos momentos estan un poco dificiles ya que la situacion economica que se atravieza en la zona es muy dificil, entonces lo que ella quiere es comprar mercadedia al por mayor para que a ella le salga mas barato el producto y asi tener mejores ganancias, pero necesita capital para poder invertir en dicha mercaderia, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder salir adelante. su meta es poder tener una tienda completa con todos los productos que ella quiera vender y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nely Argentina B. has a cosmetics sales business, which she has had for more than 4 years. She is a widow and the mother of two sons, who are both married. Through her cosmetics sales she has been able to achieve many things, bit by bit. Sales are a little difficult at this time because the economic situation in the area is very difficult. Therefore, what she would like is to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices so that the products will be less expensive for her and she can have better profits. However, she needs capital to invest in the merchandise; for this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can get ahead. Her goal is to have a store full of all the products she wants to sell and thereby have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoos, creams, lotions, deodorants, perfumes, and household cleaning products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilú  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Marilú es casad tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 19, 15 y 8 años que están en la universidad
 Y los dos menores estudian en la escuela estatal.
Ella y su esposo  empezaron el  negocio de autopartes en surquillo, des pues se mudaron  a otro distrito y  alquilaron un local  continuando dando el servicio de rebobinados y venta  de autopartes  para carros
Marilú necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles para la compra de una maquina torno y repuestos para carro.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a invertir a no gastar el capital, y a no endeudarse. 
El sueño de Marilú es  surtir más su tienda con mercadería, y tener un stock en mercaderías para carro.
texts.en:
Marilú is a member of the “Los Viñedos” communal bank. She is married and is 44 years old. She has three children who are 19, 15, and 8 years old. The oldest is in university and the younger two are studying in the state school. Marilú and her husband began an auto-parts business in Surquillo. They later moved to a different district and rented a store where they continued providing ignition coil replacement services and selling car parts. Marilú needs a loan of 2,800.00 PEN to buy a lathe and car replacement parts. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to invest and not to spend capital and not to go into debt. Marilú’s dream is to supply her store with more merchandise and to have a stock of merchandise for cars.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marilú needs a loan of 2,800.00 PEN to buy a lathe and car replacement parts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
María  es casada tiene 50 años, 1 hijo de 29 años, que trabaja. 
María  tiene un locutorio, ella empezó vendiendo cerveza y gaseosa, quería poner una bodega pero por su casa habían muchas, lo que por su barrio no había era locutorio, es cuando decide poner un locutorio el cual ella lo administra. 
María  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la  construir su casa para poner un internet.
Desde que María está en Finca aprendió a horrar, a ser solidaria con la gente, ahora tiene más amigas que pueden compartir de inquietudes del negocio.
El sueño de María es terminar su casa y poner un internet.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank of Los Viñedos.She is 50 years old, and is married with a 29 yr old son who works. Maria owns a long-distance call center where she has started selling beer and sodas. Originally she wanted to put in a small grocery store, but there where many in her neighborhood. The thing that was missing was a place to make long-distance calls, which is why she decided to put in the call center that she currently runs. Maria needs a loan of 1200 Sols so that she can expand her house (out of which she operates the business), and add on an internet cafe. Since Maria has been in FINCA, she has learned to save and to be there for people, and now she has more friends who can support her through the worries that come along with owning a business. Maria's dream is to finish construction on her house and put in an internet cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
La señora Dona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, vive en Jr. Tomas Villacorta Nº 241, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años, 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su espíritu alegre y su anhelo de ver profesionales a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico de su familia, desde sus  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dona, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dona belongs to the “Immaculate Virgin” Communal Bank. She lives at No. 241 Tomas Villacorta Street, in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martín, department of San Martín. She is married, 55 years old, and has three children, all of whom are independent.
