Her happy spirit and her desire to see her children become professionals motivated her to start her own business selling groceries and use the income to help with the household income. Since the beginning, she has gained more and more customers. Currently she has regular customers who come daily to her store to make their purchases because they can find all the products that a housewife would need at the store, and Dona is the one who personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she would like to purchase rice, sugar in sacks, packets of noodles, milk, preserved fish in boxes and of a variety of brands, eggs, and personal hygiene articles so she can continue giving her customers better service. Dona feels the strength to continue working and persevering day after day and thanks Kiva partner The Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her have opportunities to develop themselves in an environment for development.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries such as sacks of rice and sugar, eggs, preserved fish, etc.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La señora Otilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas de Oro” del Distrito de Puno, en la  provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 66 años de edad, es Viuda y tiene 6 hijos. Ella no tiene  estudios. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, ella tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite) su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar mas abarrotes, (arroz, leche, aceite.  Le gustaría tener una tienda grande y muy surtida.

La señora Otilia nos refiere que le gustan las reuniones y la facilidad de pago que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia is a member of the communal bank “Palomas de Oro (Doves of Gold)” in the District of Puno, Province of Puno, region of Puno. She is 66 years old, widowed, and has six children. She does not have an education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 4 years. She has a business selling groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil). Her first loan was for 300 PEN.

She currently desires a loan of an additional 700 PEN which will serve her to buy more groceries (rice, milk, oil). She would like to have a larger, better stocked store.

Mrs. Otilia tells us that she enjoys the meetings and the ease of paying that Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, rice, oil, canned goods, eggs

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es: la sra NORMA ELENA C. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa actividad a la cual se dedica hace mas de tres años, es madre de 2 hijos,  con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite cubrir algunos gastos personales y del hogar, de esta forma contribuye a su esposo para sacar adelante su familia y su casa ya que en estos tiempos se necesita que las dos cabezas del hogar trabajen para salir adelante, nos comento que con este credito que esta solicitando es para invertirlo en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias ya que tiene que comprar por fardos la ropa y asi sale mucho mas barata y se obtienen muchas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma Elena C. is in commerce, having a small business selling clothes, which she has done for more than three years. She is the mother of two children. With the income that her business generates she is able to cover some personal and household expenses. In this manner she contributes with her husband to get their family ahead. In these times their home requires that both of them work in order to get ahead.

She tells us that this loan that she is asking for is for investing in her business and to have better income. Now she will buy the clothes in bulk and thereby sell them much cheaper which will bring a lot of income.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothes in bulk

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo cdra. 02, Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, y tiene 02 hijos, los 02 ya independientes.

Teresa, con la edad que tiene es una mujer luchadora y eficiente, es docente cesante de primaria, con el anhelo de tener un ingreso propio y teniendo los  conocimientos en enfermería decidió implementar su botiquín, donde vende sus medicinas básicas, también se dedica a medir la presión y poner inyecciones. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo servicio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es el único botiquín en el barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800.00, desea invertirlo comprando medicinas como: Aspirinas, doloflan, dolocordralan, antigripales como vick vaporub, mentoles y otras medicinas básicas.

Teresa, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the "Las Margaritas II" Village Bank. She lives in the Banda de Shilcayo District of the San Martín Province in the Department of San Martín. She is married and has two dependent children. Teresa remains, at her age, a hard-working and efficient woman. She is a former elementary school teacher with a strong desire to have her own income. Since she is knowledgeable about nursing she decided to start her own mini-pharmacy, where she sells basic medicines, takes blood pressures, and gives injections. Nowadays she's continuing with her service and tells us that it is going very well, since she has the only pharmacy in the neighborhood. Teresa wants to use her loan of 1,800 soles to buy medicines, including aspirin, Doloflan, Dolocordralan, cold medicines like Vicks Vapor Rub, menthol, and other basic medicines. She is a woman at peace who is content with what she's achieved, and she wants to assure herself of a peaceful old age, so she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals, and those of other women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic medicines for her pharmcy

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Legui Nº 763, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años, 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. anticuchos  a fuera D. su casa donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo D. S/ 2,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando planchas D. calaminas, para cambiar el techo del ambiente donD. desarrolla  su negocio y así dar una mejor comonidad y seguridad a sus clientes, con parte del dinero también comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

Josefa,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Josefa belongs to the community bank, “Virgen D. la Inmaculada.” She lives on Jr. Augusto B. Legui Nº 763, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She’s married, 64 years old, and has 3 kids, all of them independent.

The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to move ahead by her own means inspired her to start her own business in the sales of kebabs out of her home. Little by little, she has become well-known amongst her customers, and now she tells us that her business is doing very well.

Today she continues with the same business which is open for business nightly. She has worked in this business for many years, and she is very happy with what she does.

With this loan of S/2,500.00 ($825 USD) , she wants to purchase corrugated steel to renovate the roof of her business and give comfort and security to her customers. With part of the money, she will also buy supplies such as bags of rice, eggs, chicken for her kebabs and cooking utensils to improve her quality of service.

Josefa feels unworried and content with what she does and thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and improve infrastructure of her business

loans.name: Emith

texts.es:
La señora Emith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras” vive en Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1088, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años, 02 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo D. actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donD. cuenta con todo lo que el ama D. casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con alegría y entusiasmo a sus clientes. 

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,700.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Emith, anhela convertir su bodega en un minimarket y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.
texts.en:
Emith is a member of the Mujeres Luchadoras community bank. She lives at Jr. Jorge Chávez Nº 1088, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 55, married, and has 2 independent children. Her enterprising character and the love for her family motivated her to start her own business of selling groceries. Little by little the business was growing, and she was gaining experience in this type of work. She is very well known and liked among her customers. She currently has regular customers who shop at her store every day. The store has everything a housewife needs. Emith personally tends to her customers with happiness and enthusiasm. With a loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk, boxes of preserved fish of various brands, eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best attention. Emith yearns to convert her small store into a mini market. She will make this a reality; when she proposes something she does it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery products (rice, noodles, milk, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en la Carretera Marginal Sur Nº 472, Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Rosmery, lleva ya varios años dedicando al trabajo de manualidades, nos cuenta que desde pequeña le encanta hacer estas cosas y para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implemento su negocio y poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos, y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300.00, desea invertirlo comprando materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: Telas, napas, felpa, rasos, hilos, blondas  para adornar sus acabados y su material mas importante que es el Velur, que le permite realizar sus muñecas como: porta calzones, porta pañales, muñecas con aromas , sus acabados están al escoger del clientes.

Rosmery, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz porque en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a las mujeres a iniciar su negocio y también a quienes quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosmery is a member of the “Las Margaritas II” communal bank, and lives in Banda de Shilcayo, San Martin province, department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 38 years old and has a son that still depends on her. Rosmery has been working in arts and crafts for several years, and she tells us that since she was small she loved doing these things. To start this business, she decided to take out a loan from Manuela Ramos, who helped her with S/. 300.00. She built upon this business and slowly started to get recognized. Currently she is still in the same business and now she has a fixed set of customers who make orders every month. She also offers her products to her friends, family and neighbors; she does very well for herself and she generates her own monthly income. She has a charisma that makes the art sell for itself. With the S/ 1,300.00 loan she wishes to invest in buying material for her arts and crafts such as cloth, imitation leather, plush, satin, string, and silk lace for the finishing touches. The most important material is velour, which allows her to make dolls and accessories such as underwear, diaper carriers, and dolls with aromas. The finishing touches are chosen by the customers. Rosmery is very happy with what she has achieved, and because her business is doing so well. She is very thankful with the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women to start their own business and those who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for arts and crafts

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo cdra. 02, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Viviendo cerca a un lugar donde hay mucho movimiento, Erika decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y anticuchos en la Plazuela de su barrio, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y tiene mucha acogida. 
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, nos cuenta que tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio restaurant en un local bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en la implementación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Erika is a member of the communal bank “Las Margaritas II” and lives in the province of San Martin with her partner. She is the mother of 3 dependent children. Erika decided to sell kebabs and prepared foods in her neighborhood's plaza because the area is so well trafficked. She tells us that she sells a lot each day due to the good flavors she prepares her food with and is well received. She will continue with the same business because she is very happy with her job that she begins at 6:00 p.m each day. She attends her clients herself with her customary charisma. She hopes to invest the loan of 2,000.00 soles in purchasing supplies for the daily preparation of her food like: kilos of rice, sugar, gallons of oil, crates of chickens, and also some utensils so she can better serve her clients. Erika is full of life and is still motivated to get ahead. She tells us that she has many dreams and goals for her life like starting her own restaurant in a place with good air conditioning. She is also grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos para preparar sus comidas (arroz, azúcar, aceite).

loans.name: Diomith

texts.es:
La señora Diomith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 863, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y son su gran orgullo.

Diomith, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchos tropiezos en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de la línea Unique, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Además se desempeña como Directora de su propia red de consultoras en diferentes Distritos y se siente muy capaz y eficiente como mujer, ya que  personalmente incentiva  a su red de consultoras.

Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo mas vitrinas para exhibir  sus productos.

Diomith, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Diomith belongs to the Virgen de la Inmaculada community bank. She lives at Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 863, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 39, married, and has two dependent children who are her great pride. Diomith is a woman who has been able to overcome many bumps in the road of her life. The desire to get ahead has given her good results. The business she runs makes her feel happy for what she has achieved. She started selling cosmetics from the Unique line. Her business is still ongoing. She is also the director of her own network of consultants in different districts. She feels very capable and efficient as a woman. She personally motivates her network of consultants. With a loan for 3,000 PEN she wants to stock beauty products like perfume for women and men, creams, compact powder, lipstick, and nail polish. She would also like to buy more display cases to show her products. Diomith, with her maturity, is an example to follow for many women who start a business. With perseverance they can achieve their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for her stock (perfume, creams, nail polish, etc.)

loans.name: Ellen Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ellen Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, vive en el Jr. Gregorio Delgado Nº 481, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 03 hijos, todos que aun dependen D. ella. 

Por su capacidad y experiencia en el negocio, al que ya viene dedicándose durante muchos años, dado a su perseverancia fue incrementando  poco a poco sus productos haciéndose  muy conocida en el mercado. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio D. venta D. artículos D. oficina, que se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa donD. atienD. a sus clientes fijos que viven en el barrio y amigos conocidos.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará más productos para su stock como archivadores, cuadernos, lápices, borradores lapiceros, plumones, engrapadores, clips, tampones, gomas y lápices colores.

Ellen Rosario tiene un carisma para vender a sus clientes,  comenta que  Movimiento Manuela Ramos como organización ayuda a las mujeres a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ellen Rosario belongs to the Virgen D. la Inmaclada community bank. She lives at Jr. Gregorio Delgado Nº 481, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 46, married, and has three dependent children. Due to her business capacity, her many years of experience, and her perseverance; she was able to, little by little, get more products and make herself well known in the market. She currently has the same business of selling office supplies. The business is located in her own home, where she waits on her regular customers who live in the neighborhood and are well known friends. With the loan of 1,500 PEN she will stock more products like file folders, notebooks, pencils, erasers, ball point pens, felt tip pens, staplers, paperclips, ink pads, rubber bands, and colored pencils. Ellen Rosario has a charisma for selling to customers. She says that the organization Movimiento Manuela Ramos helps women develop and progress with the same opportunity as men.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more office supplies for her stock (ball point pens, file folders, felt tip pens, etc.)

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
La señora Lesly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. Cesar Vallejo Nº 472 Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, y no tiene hijos.

Lesly, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,700.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Lesly, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Lesly, member of the community bank "Las Margaritas II (The Daisies II)," lives at Jr. Cesar Vallejo Nº 472, Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She lives with her common-law husband and has no children.

Lesly is an efficient woman, who seeing the need to generate her own income, decided to implement her own business of grocery sales, which is located in her home. She began little by little and now she has already improved her business with a stock of products. Most of her clients are stay-at-home mothers who find everything they need. Presently she continues with the same business and tells us that it is going very well for her.

With the loan for 1,700 Soles, she will buy rice and sugar in sacks, packs of noodles, boxes of milk and canned fish of various brands, cleaning products for the home, personal hygiene products, packages of cookies of different flavors and brands, and in this way satisfy her clients and offer them better service.

Lesly feels very satisfied with what she has achieved. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her to begin her business, helping her fulfill her dreams and goals, and for helping other women who want to grow economically.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to stock her store (rice, sugar, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Aly

texts.es:
La señora Aly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 112 Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Aly, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio  con el apoyo de su pareja. Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de  refrescos helados de frutas como cebada, aguajina y soya que los vendía al frente de su casa, poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el prestamo de Manuela Ramos implemento su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa y hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad  y es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Aly hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Aly belongs to Banco Comunal "Las Margaritas II". She lives in Jr. San Martín Nº 112 Distrito Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 31 years old, and has 2 sons who depend on her. Aly, being a woman who feels capable of reaching her goals, decided to start her own business with the support of her partner. She tells us that it began with the sale of frozen juice drinks like aguajina (made from aguaje palm fruit), cebada (made from barley), and soya (made from soy), which she sold from the front of her house. Bit by bit she was saving and collecting her own capital, and with the loan from Manuela Ramos, she started her business of selling groceries, located in her same house. Today, she has lots of experience in this type of work, and she is well-known and well-liked by her customers. At present, she has such a dedicated clientele that they come on a daily basis, knowing that they can count on finding all the groceries any housewife could need, and that Aly will personally attend to them with all the caring that she is know for. With the loan of 2,500 PEN, she wants to purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, boxes of canned fish, and a variety of brands of bathroom, household, and personal hygiene products, all so she can continue giving superior attention to her customers. Aly today feels very fulfilled, with more desire to push onward and make a reality of her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her in starting her business, and for helping many other women who want to create their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara abarrotes para incrementar su negocio (arroz y azúcar al por mayor)

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: La Sra Ana Lidia C. se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de variedades, este negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen al 100% de ella, teniendo su negocio en su casa de habitacion no descuida a sus hijos, su esposo en estos momentos le esta ayudando con la atencion de los clientes en su negocio ya que anteriormente laboraba para una fabrica de puros pero lo despidieron y no ha podido conseguir trabajo, el sale de manera ambulante a vender el producto de la tienda a varios lugares cercanos de la ciudad de Danli, con las ganancias que obtienen de las ventas del negocio logran cubrir con una gran parte todos los gastos del hogar, ella necesita mas capital para poder comprar en la frontera con nicaragua mas producto ya que ahi es mas barato y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana Lidia C. has worked for 5 years in the sales of various items. She runs this business from her home. She is married and has four children that depend 100% on her. By having her business in her home, she does not neglect her children. At times, her husband helps attend to customers since his previous job at a cigar factory laid him off and he has since not been able to find work. He goes out to work for the store as a traveling salesman in various locations near the city of Danli. With the earnings from the business’s sales, they are able to cover a large part of the household costs. She needs more capital to be able to buy more products for cheaper prices on the Nicaraguan border and, in this way, have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shirts, shoes, women's wallets, gift bouquets, pants, earrings, and hangers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Ascencia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ascencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en Jr. San Martín Nº 218, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años, 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

El haber pasado por momentos muy duros durante su vida, le motivo a emprender su propio negocio, nos cuenta que se inicio desde abajo  vendiendo kilos de arroz, verduras y frutas en una mesita,  ubicada en su misma casa. Luego con su primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos, implemento su bodega de venta de abarrotes, hoy e día nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, además brinda servicio de Internet (cabinas), y ya tiene clientes conocidos en ambos negocios. A diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con su carisma que la caracteriza.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Maria Ascencia, como mujer se siente muy contenta con lo logrado a lo largo de su vida, y con mayor esfuerzo desea ver a sus hijos profesionales. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado  a superararce.
texts.en:
Maria Ascensia belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas II.” She lives on Jr. San Martín Nº 218, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 43 years old, and has 2 children that still depend on her.

She has had very difficult times in her life. These motivated her to begin her own business. She tells us that she started from scratch by selling kilos of rice, vegetables and fruits from a small table located in her own home. Later, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, she started her grocery shop. Today, she tells us that her business is doing very well. She also offers internet service and booths, and is well-known to her customers in both businesses. They come to her store daily to do their shopping, because she has all the products necessary for the home and personally attends to them with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of S/. 3,000.00 ($1,000 USD), she will invest in buying rice and sugar in sacks, packets of noodles, milk and a variety of brands of fish preserves in cartons, eggs and personal hygiene products to continue giving her customers the best service.

Maria Ascensia feels very content as a woman with what she has achieved during her lifespan and strongly desires to see her children succeed. Thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up her grocery store

loans.name: Fautino

texts.es:
el sr. Fautino P. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, esta actividad es muy buena ya que mucha gente de escasos recuroso comprar este tipo de producto ya que es muy barato y la calidad es buena, el tiene su negocio en el mayoreo de esta ciudad, los domingos sales a vender su ropa a diferentes caserios y localidades cercanas a la ciudad de danli, el tiene muchos años de experiencia en las ventas, el es de origen nicaraguense pero desde la guerra de nicaragua se traslado a vivir a honduras y desde entonces dice que el siempre vivira en Honduras. 
este negocio le genera ingresos para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi poder ofrecerle mas variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fautino P. makes a good living selling second-hand clothing; many low income people buy this type of product because it is very cheap and of good quality. His business is located in Danli’s wholesale market. On Sundays, he goes out and sells his clothing in various villages and towns nearby. He has many years of sales experience.

Fautino is originally from Nicaragua, but ever since the war started there he has lived and has said he will always live in Honduras.

His business generates enough income to cover household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy more bales of clothing so that he can offer his customers greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bales of clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es: La señora Lizeth Margarita Z., tiene 32 años de edad, reside en el  Barrio Los Solises en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 8 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos el cual lleva doce años en las ventas, inicio con ahorro en busca de nuevas alternativas, con este crédito quiere invertir en compra de ropa y variedad de cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes y vender mas, para obtener buenas ganancias, este es su quinto ciclo y da las gracias Afodenic por los logros alcanzados. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener una tienda, dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lizeth Margarita Z. is 32 years old and lives in the Los Solises neighborhood of Managua with her two children, ages 7 and 8. She has been in the business of selling clothing and cosmetics for 12 years and began saving and looking for new alternatives. With this loan she wants to invest in purchasing more clothes and cosmetics to offer her customers as well as obtain good sales. This is her fifth cycle and she thanks Afodenic for the achievements. Her plans for the future are to be able to have a store and to give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Merly Benidia

texts.es:
La señora Merly Benidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 323, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 1 hijo, que ya no dependen de ella.

Se inicio con la venta de pescado seco salado y verduras; hace muchos años atrás, junto con su pareja que también la apoya, salían a  vender en los pueblos aledaños, nos cuenta que se iniciaron con S/. 150.00 y ahora que cambio de negocio a la venta de golosinas, se siente muy bien y tranquila.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, lo invertirá comprando golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invirtió comprando dos maletas mas grandes para exhibir sus productos. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro,  cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Merly Benidia belongs to the “Las Margaritas II” Communal Bank and lives in the La Banda de Shilcayo district of San Martín Province in the San Martín region of Peru. She is 45 years old, lives with her common-law partner and has one grown-up child.

She started selling dried salted fish and vegetables many years ago. She would go out and sell in nearby towns together with her partner who also supports her; she tells us that they started with 150 nuevos soles. She feels much better and calmer now that she has switched to selling sweets.

With this loan of 1800 nuevos soles, she will purchase sweets like Sublime and Cañonazo chocolate bars, lollipops, chewing gum and different brands and flavours of candy to satisfy her customers. She’ll use part of the money to purchase two bigger cases to display her products.

She feels very satisfied with her work because it is hard work; she believes it is worth the sacrifice to realise her dreams and life goals. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting her and other women who want to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different brands of sweets

loans.name: Nolvia Jaquelin

texts.es:
la Sra. Nolvia M. inicio su negocio desde hace un año y es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar, ella vive en union libre y su comañero de hogar trabaja para una institucion privada, ella es madre de dos hijos uno de ellos esta pasando sus estudios primarios, ella opto por buscar a poner un negocio en su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos y asi estar generando dinero tambien, ya que la situacion se ponia critica y solo a su compañero de hogar le tocaba pagar todos los gastos del hogar, ahora ellos estan mas nivelados economicamente ya que este negocio a sido una bendicion segun nos comento ella, en estos momentos su compañero de hogar empezo de nuevo a estudiar y esta saliendo adelante, ellos se sienten muy felices.
su clientela cada dia es mas grande y por eso ella necesita el credito para poder invertir mas en su negocio y asi tener una tienda con muchos productos.
texts.en:
Nolvia M. started her business one year ago and it is worth noting that during this time she has learned to manage the business. She lives with her common-law partner who works for a private company. She is a mother to two children, one of whom is in primary school.

She chose to set up her business in her home so that she could look after her children and also contribute to the family income; their economic situation had become critical and her partner was obliged to cover all household expenses.

She tells us that this business has been a blessing and now they are better off. Her partner has resumed his studies, they are moving forward and are very happy.

Her client base increases every day and this is why she needs a loan to invest more in her business and stock her store with many products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, rice, soap, sugar, coffee, sauces, soups, diapers, pasta, beverages, dairy products, embutido, meat, chicken

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
La señora Leyla, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Martín de Porras”, vive en el A.A.H.H. Maria Parado de Bellido – Psje. Sta. Rosa, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 30 años, 03 hijos, en etapa escolar y que aún dependen de ella.

Se inicio en la venta de pescado fresco hace varios años atrás, llevada por la intención de ayudar a su familia en sus ingresos económicos, contando para esto con un capital de S/.300 que fue muy bien invertido, por lo que hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio pero ya en mayores cantidades y variedad de  especies.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará pescado fresco en kilos tanto los que produce la región como los de la costa del país como: bocachico, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, pejerey para así mantener surtido su negocio y satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. 

Ella nos manifiesta su complacencia por pertenecer muchos años a un grupo de mujeres que le ha ayudado a superar dificultades que en algún momento tuvo que pasar pero que ahora los enfrenta con mucha fortaleza.
texts.en:
Leyla belongs to the San Martín de Porras community bank. She lives at A.A.H.H. Maria Parado de Bellido – Psje. Sta. Rosa, Juanjui district, San Martín department. She is 30, in a common law marriage, and has 3 school aged, dependent children. She started selling fresh fish several years ago. She was driven by the desire to help her family economically. She started with a very well invested 300 PEN. Today she continues with the same business but with larger quantities and varieties of fish. With a loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy kilos of fresh fish. She will buy fish produced in the region and fish from the coast of the country like bocachica, palometas, toa, gamitada, tilapias, toyo, and pejerey. This way she will keep her business stocked and satisfy the discerning tastes of her customers. She is pleased that for many years she has belonged to a group of women who have helped her overcome difficulties that she had. Now she can confront problems with much strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more and different kinds of fish

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Martín de Porras”, vive en el Jr. Pilar Nores Mza. C – Lt. 02, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años, 03 hijos, uno que dependen de ella.

Se inicio con la venta de gallinas vivas hace muchos años atrás, iniciando con un capital de S/. 300.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio en horas de la mañana  en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad y por las tardes  se dedica a la venta de aguajes, un complemento mas para su negocio, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus negocios y esta muy  contenta con lo que hace.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, lo invertirá comprando gallinas criollas vivas en javas, estas aves son criadas a base de maíz y no de alimento balanceado,  así mismo comprará sacos de aguajes (fruta silvestre de esta para del país)  y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. 

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto asu familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marilu, belongs to the communal Bank “San Martin de Porras,” and lives in the Pilar Nores Mza. C – Lt. 02, Juanjui District, in the San Martin State. She is a partner, is 32 years old, has three children, and one who depends on her still. She began selling live chickens several years ago, starting with a capital of 300 S/. Presently she continues with the same business in the mornings at the central Market in the City, and in the afternoons she sells a variety of fruit drinks, another complement for her business. She tells us that her business is going very well and she is very happy with what she’s doing. With the loan of 1000 S/. she will invest in buying young, living chicks in Javas, these birds are raised on corn and not balanced foods, likewise she will buy sacks of fruits for drinks (made from wild fruits from this part of the country) and in this way she will meet her client’s demands. She feels very content, now despite the difficulties of her family. She recognizes the great support that the Manuela Ramos Movement is giving her and other women in the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy young chickens and sacks of fruit

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
La señora Aura Maria , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo ”, vive en la Calle Colina  s/n, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 56 años, 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes, pero una de sus hijas que vive con ella es quien le ayuda en el negocio. 

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en muy pequeña cantidad poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  
En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Aura Maria  se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vejez tranquita y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Maria belongs to the Comunal Bank, “Huicungo ”, she lives on Colina Street s/n, Huicungo District, in the Mariscal Cáceres Province, Juanjui, in the San Martín State. She is a widow, 56 years old, 5 children; all independent now, but one of her daughters lives with her and helps her with the business. Her fighting spirit which has always characterized her desire to move forward with her own means, has made her start her own business selling groceries in small quantities, gaining experience little by little in this kind of activity and making her well known and loved among her clients. At the present time she has loyal clients that come daily to her shop where she buys everything necessary for the housewife’s needs. She personally waits on them with the charisma that characterizes her service. With the loan of 1,000 S/ she hope to invest it in buying rice and sacks of sugar, bags of beans, milk and preserved canned fish, and in a variety of brands cleaning utensils for the home, personal hygiene products to give her clients her best attention. Aura Maria feels very strong continuing to work and move forward ensuring a tranquil later years in life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her ability to achieve her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy basic necessity articles

loans.name: Lides

texts.es:
La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Huicungo”, vive en el Jr.  Magdalena s/n –, Distrito de Huicungo, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 35 años y es madre de 03 niños aun en etapa escolar, quienes son quienes lo impulsan a seguir adelante.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  negocio de venta de carnes de ganado vacuno y porcino en kilos que los ofrece a diario a sus clientes,  con  el carisma y la buna atención que le caracteriza. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará  un ganado vacuno para sacrificarlo en el camal y vender su carne y vísceras en kilos. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Laura, belongs to the Comunal Bank ““Huicungo”, she lives in the Jr. Magdalena s/n, Huicungo District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín State. She is a partner, 35 years old, and is a mother of three children still in school, and those are the ones who pushed her forward. Before needing to support the economic income of household, driven by her husband, she began her business selling beef and pork by the kilo, which she offers daily to her clients. She is characterized by her charisma and good attention to her customers. At the moment, she continues with this same business, operating in her own home where her main clients are neighbors in her vicinity. With the loan of 500 S/ she will buy a beef cow for slaughter in the butcher house and sell its meat and entrails by kilos. Today she feels very happy about the service offered and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue in this way for a long time and help many entrepreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy beef cattle to take to the butcher

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: la Sra. Margarita T. nacio el 15 de agosto de 1970, ella tiene 38 años de edad, ella hace mucho tiempo empezo a gustarle el comercio y vendia cosmeticos, ropa y carne por libras pero en cantidades minimas, pero poco a poco fue creciendo y con el pasar de los años tuvo la idea de poner un puesto en el mercado los dolores de la ciudad capital, despues de tanto tiempo de solicitar el local se lo aprobaron y puso una carniceria con el nombre de MANOA, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante, la vida de ella ha sido muy dura pero en estos momentos la recompenza es buena y su negocio esta creciendo mucho ya que ahora compro otro local para ampliar su negocio pero necesita capital para poder comprar mas carnes y tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita T. was born August 15th, 1970, and she is 38. A long time ago she started to like commerce. She sold cosmetics, clothes, and meat by the pound, but in small quantities. Little by little her business was growing. With the passage of the years, she had the idea to set up a stall in the Los Dolores market in the capital city. After applying, much time passed, and then she was approved. She set up a butcher shop named Manoa. She has three children, and together with her husband they have been able to get ahead. Her life has been very hard, but now the reward is good. Her business is growing a lot. She bought another place to expand her business, but she needs capital to buy more meat and have more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, pork and chicken

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
Maria Nieves es una mujer muy trabajadora y es  socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, es conviviente con 02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en la comunidad de Punta Sahuacasi Sector de Acochupa, tiene estudios de 1er grado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, ella se dedica a la compra venta de ganado menor (ovinos),  su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.
 
Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con el que comprará más cabezas de ganado y luego los venderá en las ferias de la zona.
 
Maria nieves nos dice que le gustan mucho las reuniones porque así puede compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Maria Nieves is a very hardworking woman. She is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Village Bank in the Azangaro Province in the Department of Puno. She is 56-years-old and lives with two children that she is responsible for. She lives in the Punta Sahuacasi Sector of Acochupa, and has a first grade education. Maria has been wokring with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past 3 years. She earns her living buying and selling small livestock (sheep). Her first loan was for 300 soles. She would like an additional loan at this time of 1000 soles, with which she plans to buy more livestock to sell at the fairs in her area. Maria Nieves tells us that she really enjoys the meetings because they allow her to share with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Ada Marina

texts.es: La Sra. Ada G. tiene 42 años de edad, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo popular, ella antes tenia una chiclera en la cual vendia pero poco y un dia se propuso poner su propia pulperia, con esto ha venido saliendo adelante y esta muy feliz de tener su negocio propio, junto a su esposo han luchado para poder brindarles todo el apoyo a sus hijos y a su hogar, ella esta muy agradedida con todas las personas que le han ayudado en su vida, y ella quiere que su tienda sea mas grande para poder tener una vida mas tranquila con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ada G. is 42. She has a basic goods stores. Before that she had a candy store. She sold very little, and one day she proposed setting up her own mini market. This has been going well, and she is very happy to have her own business. Together with her husband they have fought to be able to offer their support to their children and their home. She is very grateful to all of the people that have helped her in her life. She wants her store to be bigger to be able to have a more tranquil life with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soup, butter, soft drinks, salt, coffee, bread, crackers, oil, corn, canned goods, toilet paper, churros, beans, rice,sugar, powdered milk, chilies, sardines, spices, pills

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Marina C. D. C. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. Casa GranD., provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa.  Tiene 3 hijos.
Rosa antes vendía productos D. belleza en mínimas cantidades (lo distribuía entre amigos y familiares), ahora con el crédito otorgado le ha permitido ampliar su negocio adquiriendo nuevos productos D. belleza y ampliando su cartera D. clientes. Sus productos los distribuye en Ascope (como ha vivido en ese lugar tiene muchos conocidos).
Recién ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II
Con el crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá para adquirir productos D. belleza como cremas, esmaltes, perfumes y otros para su stock.
Rosa tiene como sueño instalar su tienda D. perfumería.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Marina C. D. C. is 55 years old and lives in the Casa GranD. district of Ascope, in La Libertad, Peru. She completed high school and has three children. Rosa used to sell small quantities of beauty products to friends and family. With this loan, she has been able to grow her business by acquiring new beauty products and increasing her clientele. She sells her products in Ascope since she lives here and knows many people. She has recently become a member of Manuela Ramos and a member of the communal bank Romanas Luchadoras II. With the loan of 300 soles, she will invest in beauty products like creams, nail polishes, perfumes, and other things for her stock. Rosa’s dream is to have a perfume store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: lo invertirá para adquirir productos en stock

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: la Sra. Maria Angela L. tiene 37 años de edad, ella tiene una pequeña pulperia en la colonia sosa de la ciudad capital, ella logro poner este negocio con las prestaciones que le dieron cuando la despidieron del trabajo que tenia anteriormente, con este negocio ella apoya a su esposo economicamente para cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos los cuales estudian en colegios publicos, con el credito ella piensa surtir mas el negocio y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que ella tiene pensado comprar mas productos diferentes para ofrecer a sus clientes. ella nos comento que este negocio es todo para ella y que lo cuida mucho ya que este sera su fuente de ingresos por el resto de su vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Angela L. is a 37-year-old woman who owns a general store in the Sosa housing development of the capital city. She managed to set up this business with the loans that she was granted after she was let go from her previous job. With this business, she helps out her husband financially in order to cover the household expenses. They have 3 children who attend public school. With this loan, she is planning on restocking her shop with a wider selection of products for her customers. She states that this business belongs solely to her and that she cares meticulously for it because this will be her source of income for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase churros (fried dough-pastry), soft drinks, sugar, lard, beans, tortillas, cooking oil, coffee, bread, rice, meat, chicken, canned goods, and instant soup

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Somos De Cristo Group

texts.es:
el Grupo Somos de Cristo esta formado por 3 personas de las cuales todas tienen su negocio propio y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y cabe mensionar que han trabajado juntos, ellos son muy unidos y parecen como si fueran hermanos. las actividades de este grupo son las siguientes:
el Sr. Francisco M. tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero, tiene 4 hijos y a todos los apoya economicamente, el se dedica a la venta de refrescos de botella, papitas fritas, chicharrones y agua, el realiza viajes a domicilio con su bicitaxi, en esta localidad lo conocen como una persona honorable.
la sra. Maria M. tiene 66 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 12 hijos de los cuales 11 ya estan casados y uno vive con ella. 
Tiene una pulperia en la cual vende frijoles, maiz, arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, leche, pollo, mantequilla, jugos, refrescos, jabon etc.
con este negocio ella logra salir con todos los gastos de su hogar, ella tiene 11 años de tener su negocio y esta ubicado en el barrio santa maria  y la conocen como una persona muy especial.
la sra. Alba N. tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos estan estudiando. ella se dedica a la venta de papas fritas y chicharrones con tortillas, ella tiene su puesto en el mercado de nacaome, cabe mensionar que los productos que ofrece son de bastante aceptacion en la zona ya que las personas de esta ciudad consumen mucho su producto ya que es muy sabroso y muy higienico.
texts.en:
The Somos de Cristo Group is comprised of 3 people who all have their own business and have known each other for a long time. It is important to note that they have all worked together. They are very close-knit, and they seem as if they were siblings. They are involved in the following businesses: Mr. Francisco M. is a 37-year-old single father with 4 children that he supports. He sells bottled drinks, French fries, pork rinds, and water. He also provides transportation services to peoples’ doors on his bicycle taxi. In this locality, he is known as an honorable person.

Ms. Maria M. is a 66-year-old single mother with 12 children, 11 of whom are married, while one lives with her. She has her own general store in which she sells beans, corn, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, milk, chicken, butter, juice, soft drinks, soap, etc. With this business, she manages to cover all her household expenses. She has been in business for 11 years. Her business is located in the Santa Maria neighborhood, where she is known as a very special person.

Ms. Alba N. is a 35-year-old single mother with 3 children, all of whom attend school. She sells French fries, pork rinds and tortillas. She has a stand in the Nacaome Market. One must note that the products that she sells are well-accepted in the area because the people in the city consume her delicious and sanitary meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soy products, soft drinks, canned goods, water, coffee, rice, sugar, beans, bread, and spare parts for bicycle taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nery Maria

texts.es:
la sra. Nery N. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, desde hace 3 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "NELY".  Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos, todos depende de ella y su esposo, tres de sus hijos estan cursando la educacion secundaria y primaria.
La Señora N. es una mujer muy emprendedora y con espiritu de superacion, ella comenta que con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ella apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar,  el esposo trabaja en Danli,  es comerciante y los ingresos que le genera el negocio se  apoyan mutuamente para  cumplir con los compromisos y poder salir adelante.

Actualmente ella necesita surtir un poco mas su negocio ya que en las pulperias vende el que mejor surtido tiene.
texts.en:
Ms. Nery N. has owned a general store, located inside her home, for three years. It operates under the name of Pulperia “NELY.” She is a married mother with 4 children, all of whom depend on her and her husband. Three of her children are in elementary and secondary school.

Ms. N. is an enterprising woman with a spirit of self-improvement. She states that with the profits that she generates from the business, she helps her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works in Danli. He, too, has his own business. He helps out his wife with the profits from his business so that they can take care of any commitments they have, thus being able to get ahead.

She currently needs to restock her shop because the general stores that offer the best products sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lard, sugar, rice, soap, bathroom tissue, coffee, soft drinks, and dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Gladys A. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, es casada  tien un hijo el que esta bien pequeño, tambien trabaja como docente en el Centro Educativo Rafael Pineda Ponce en su tiempo libre se dedica a distribuir su mercaderia.
ya que la situacion en esta zona es muy critica y el dinero no ajusta para cubrir con todos los gastos necesarios para mantener a su hijo que esta pequeño.
Actualmente ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar mas ropa,  ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente. Ella siempre a querido tener su propio local y esta luchando por  montarlo y que los clientes pueden llegar a efectuar sus compras. ha podido mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Gladys A. works in retail. She has her own clothing and shoe business. She has been working both as a street vendor and by order for several years. She is married and has a young son. She also works as a teacher at the Rafael Pineda Ponce Educational Center. During her free time, she distributes her merchandise because the situation in her area is very difficult and she does not have enough money to cover all of her son’s expenses. She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase more clothing because she does not have enough capital to meet customer demand. She has always wanted to have her own business space, and she is struggling to set it up so that her customers can come and make purchases. She has been able to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk clothing and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn Otilia

texts.es: La Sra. Evelyn M. es comerciante su actividad princiapal  es la elaboracion de comida Buffet, boquitas, reposteria y Comida Mexicana,  actividad que realiza junto con su esposo desde hace varios años, cuentan con muy buena clientela,  ya que sabor que le dan a las comidas es exquisito,  son contratados pàra eventos y tambien venden almuerzos a los empleados de las fabricas de tabaco,  tienen 3 hijos uno de ellos esta iniciando su educacion primaria y las otras 2 niñas estan pequeñas, ellos estan solicitando un credito ya que se les presenta una oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, instalaran un cubiculo en uno de los Supermercados de Nuestra Ciudad y no cuentan con los instrumentos y materia prima necesaria para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena atencion y asi lograr mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Evelyn M. is a businesswoman whose main activity is making buffet-style food, appetizers, pastries, and Mexican food. She and her husband have been in the food preparation business for several years. They have a good clientele because of the exquisite flavor that they add to their dishes. They are hired to cater events, but they also sell lunch to the tobacco factory workers in the area. They have 3 children—a son who is in elementary school, and two daughters who are younger. Ms. M. and her husband are requesting a loan because they have the opportunity to expand their business. They will set up a cubicle in one of the supermarkets in this city, but they do not have the tools and materials they need to offer their customers good service and improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove and a freezer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en: Ma. Liza D. is a pig grower. She is 39 years old and has six children. Her husband, Cristuto Dieparine, is a farmer. Together, they work very hard to sustain their family and provide a future for their children. "I started my piggery in 2004. Now, I still stick to this kind of business because it is profitable and I very much enjoy having pigs at the back of our house," Liza said. Liza is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. The loan will really help her to increase the size of her business. She is excited about the possible growth of her business. CEVI helps people start and have their own livelihood. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E., 37 years of age, is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Her husband, Antonio E., is a tricycle driver. With her husbands income alone, Mercy always had financial difficulties, especially in dealing with the educational finances of the children.

Mercy needs to help her husband through buying and selling chicken and pork meat in order to source additional income. As of now, they’re planning to venture into another business. They are planning to buy five heads of piglets for hog fattening. Mercy wants to obtain a loan of PHP 9,000 to realized their plan.

loans.use: To buy 5 heads of piglets and to buy pork and chicken meat

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita P. V. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de Secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de verduras y de comida rápida, cuando inició tenia un pequeño puesto donde vendía verduras, al darse cuenta que aumentaban sus clientes empezó con la venta de comida rápida (esto desarrollado desde su puesto y en su casa).
Recién ha iniciado como socia, y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con el crédito de 300, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida.
María tiene como sueño poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
María Margarita P. V. is 28 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, in La Libertad, Perú.  She studied until the 2nd year of Secondary school, and has 3 children that depend on her financially. María dedicates herself to the sale of vegetables and fast food. When she first started, she had a small stall where she sold vegetables. When she noticed that her customer base was growing, she started selling fast food (from her stall and from her house). She recently started as a member of the Fighting Romans II cooperative bank. With the loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she will invest in purchasing ingredients for preparing food. María’s dream is to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Vesitacion

texts.en:
Vesitacion A. is on her 2nd loan from HSPFI micro-finance. She is from Hinaplanan, Clavera, Mis. Or. in the Southern Philippines. She is married and blessed with seven children.

At present,the family's main sources of living are Vesitacion's variety store coupled with her husband's cultivated land which is planted with corn. At the age of 56, Vesitacion's humble desire is to expand their current business. Therefore, she is applying a loan from HSPFI, Kiva’s field partner, for a loan of PHP 6,000.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store and finances for her cultivated area

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (1037061100) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has four school-aged children. To making a living, V. owns & operates a manufacturing business venture.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tailoring.  V. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2000, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.  V. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to invest in her business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a business raising livestock, mainly cattle, for sale. She is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has three school-age children.  L. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.
In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous L. was used to purchase livestock.  L. is now requesting a L. of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her fifth L. from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the revenue to expand her business.
No. 1037061088.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (1001060010) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has five adult children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 15000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by L. from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Ngại Nguyễn Thị (100060021) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Ngại owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Ngại has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2001, Ngại joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ngại has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ngại is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Ngại plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: At 53, Felicitas L. helps her husband earn a living through her variety store. Her husband is an on-call carpenter in their village. With five children, Felicitas experienced financial problems since her business is small and her income is just enough for their food expenses. She is planning to expand her business with additional capital from an HSPFI micro-finance loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00. With this, she may be able to increase her income and cater to the rising demands in her local market.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị owns and operates a business venture primarily raising pigs for sale. She is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two small children. N. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock. N. is now requesting a loan of 10,000,000 VND to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the revenue to expand her business. No. 1014060415.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Abida Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Abida baji operates a sewing business. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids. She is a 42-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 18 years. She got her education up to the 5th standard, but couldn’t continue her studies further due to the limited financial resources of her parents. Her husband's name is N. A.. He works at a factory on a monthly salary. She is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Her older son is a janitor. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Abida baji has successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries because her son wants to run a grocery shop when he comes home from work.

Abida baji is the leader of this group of three women from her locality. Zubaida baji and Irshad baji both want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a grocery shop

loans.name: Kalsoom M. Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji operates an embroidery business. She is a 30-year-old married lady and has been living in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past four years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is M. I.. He is an electrician. Kalsoom baji works to lessen the financial burden of her husband because she knows that her husband’s income is insufficient. She is applying for a loan to buy another embroidery machine, because her customer list is getting long and it’s difficult for her to fulfill her orders on time.

She is the leader of this group with two other women from her locality. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switchboards, etc.) to sell. Rasheeda baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Lượng Nguyễn Thị (1014060416) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has two infant children. To making a living, Lượng owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Lượng has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Lượng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand the business.  Lượng is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Lượng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hanifan M. Hanif Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 58-year-old married lady and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 20 years. Her husband is M. H. and he is a fruit seller by profession. He has been selling fruit for the last six years. He sells his products in different communities by calling in a loud voice. Hanifan baji helps him by arranging the fruits on the cart. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart because his old cart is rough.  

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shaher bano baji, Seema baji and Zahooran baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.
