This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Suraiya Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of A. S. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari city is their birthplace. Suraiya baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is enrolled in a local school and is getting an education. Suraiya baji operates a sewing business by taking orders from her neighbors. She charges $2 per dress. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her daughter. Her husband has a business selling bed sheets. He buys the bed sheets from a market in Lahore named “Ichra” and sells to the native city. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more bed sheets to increase her husband's profit.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Pathani baji, Naziran baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy bed sheets to sell. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en:
Nolie is a good father to his three children. His children are Nolie V. Jr. and Aliah Shaira, who have started their schooling, and Aira Heart Zian, who is 3 years old. He is married to Arsenia who is a public teacher in their village at Centro 3, Angadanan, Isabela. Nolie wants to see his businesses grow so he can provide for his family, especially for his children’s education. 

Nolie manages many businesses. These businesses include soft drink vendor, furniture maker, and landlord since he rents one of his rooms to university students from the near-by university.  He gradually started all the businesses with the income he was able to generate by renting out a room. His soft drink business is growing fast, and he would like to borrow PHP10,000. This would help him satisfy his customers’ demands.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Naseem Abdul Aziz Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of A. A. and has been living in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. People come to him to buy groceries. Naseem baji helps him by arranging the groceries in a good manner so that her husband easily finds the groceries. She also sews clothes to share the financial burden with him. Her husband is very happy with her supportive behavior. He has five years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Khursheedan baji wants a loan to buy eggs to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Riva is 47 years old, and has been blessed with six children: Mary Ann, Ernie Mark, Magno A. Jr., Rose Ann, Sherry Ann, and Antonette. Her children are currently studying in college, high school and elementary school. Riva puts a lot of hard work into developing her snack vending business in order to support her children’s education. Her family lives happily in Barangay Centro 3 of Angadanan, Isabela.

Riva has been selling street food in front of her house in the village for almost four years. Her weekly net income from the business is around PHP 6,000.00 and it is used for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education. Riva would like a loan of PHP 6,000.00 from Kiva to develop her business further. The loan will help her purchase additional food to sell, satisfying her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en:
Thái Nguyễn Thị (1036061070) is a 32 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc.  She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, Thái owns & operates a business raising livestock. The focus of this business is raising cattle for sale. Thái has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Thái joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Thái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. Her previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Thái is now requesting a loan of 12,000,000 VND. These funds will be used to expand the shelter for her livestock. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Thái from TYM Fund.  Thái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the shelter for the livestock.

loans.name: Jamila M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
My name is Jamila and I have been residing in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 14 years. My husband’s name is M. A.. He runs a cosmetics selling business. He buys cosmetics from different markets and sells to the cosmetics shops. He has 3 years of experience in this business. I have one son and he is enrolled in a local school and is getting an education. I operate a business sewing clothes. Because I want to see my son established in the education field, I am applying for a loan to expand my husband’s cosmetic selling business. 

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality. Nasira baji wants a loan to buy supplies (cooking oil, lentils, and spices) to expand her food selling business. Rafiqan baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. Tasneem baji wants a loan to buy old computer parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Manzooran M. Mustaq Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is the wife of M. M. who lives in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school located near their house. Her husband operates a cosmetics selling business. He takes orders from the cosmetics shops and buys supplies from the city named Lahore, because Lahore city is famous for its varieties. Manzooran baji herself handles a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay off the school fees for her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more cosmetics to expand her husband’s cosmetics selling business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell. Riaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Najma yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each individual will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee on one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ulfat Nisah M.iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Ulfat nisah and I have been residing in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. My husband has a business selling garments. He sells both ladies & gentlemen’s garments to different cloth shops. He buys garments from a city named “Multan” at cheap rates and sells to the cloth shops and earns a good profit. He has been doing this work for the past 6 years. I prepare embroidered clothes on order and earn income. I invest all the income from my husband’s garment business. I am applying for a loan to buy garments to increase the profit of my husband. 

I’m leading this group for another lady who is also a citizen of Vehari, and her name is Nasreen mai. She runs a food selling business and she requires supplies (lentils, spices and cooking oil) to expand the food business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Shazia M.asghar Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of M. who lives in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. He has been driving this for the past 3 years. Shazia baji is a very hardworking lady. She performs all the duties of a mother and wife efficiently. Moreover, she operates a sewing clothes business. She learned this art from her mother and she wants to improve it. Her neighbors are amongst her customer list. Her activity gives her reward in the form of money. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) because it’s creating trouble. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Ramzana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Salma baji wants a loan to buy supplies (sugar, cooking oil and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat selling business. Sabira baji wants a loan to buy empty bottles. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Abuali

texts.ru: Калонов Абуали житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст33 года, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Всю жизнь обеспечивает семью путем разведения крупно рогатого скота. Покупает скот для откормки и перепродает на рынках. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Таким образом он сможет улучшить свое финансовое положение , а так же обеспечить рынки качественным мясом.
texts.en:
K. Abuali lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 33 years old, is married and has one child. For his entire life he has provided for his family by raising livestock. He purchases livestock to fatten it and resells it at the markets. He turned to us for a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. This way he will be able to improve his financial situation and to provide the markets with quality meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mahran Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Mahran baji is the wife of N. A. who has been living in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 11 years. Her husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items (e.g. construction supplies, fruits & vegetables) on carts and delivers them to the specified places. She is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near to the house. Mahran baji is a very determined lady. She knows that her husband’s income is small but she never realized him about it. She supports him financially by selling thread. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old cart is rough and rotted.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy material (chairs, mirrors and scissors) for her salon. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Калонов Нурулло житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 47 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Нурулло занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота уже 20 лет. Основной источник дохода его семьи является этот бизнес. Нурулло планирует увеличить поголовье скота и развивать бизнес. Для этого он обратился к нам за кредитом. Это поможет ему наладить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Nurullo K. as a resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 47 years old, is married and has three children. Nurullo has been fattening and selling livestock for 20 years now. His main source of income is this business. Nurullo plans to increase his livestock count and grow his business. Because of this he has turned to us for credit. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramzana M.waryam Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is the wife of M. W. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 14 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community where people come to buy groceries for their houses. He has four years of experience in this business. Ramzana baji also runs an animal food selling business. She saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with the committee amount. Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Hajran baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Suraiya M. Anwar Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M. A. who lives in Vehari, Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Her husband is a very hardworking guy but he couldn’t get all the rewards of his struggle.  This hurt Suraiya baji very much. She operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes without thinking about day and night and collects orders from her neighbors. She saves her income in a committee and plans to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw because she is lacking Pak Rs. 15,000 for the new rickshaw. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Rani baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Saeeda Shoqat Hussain Group
loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз Тошматов 1962 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Дома содержит скот. Разводит скот более 18 лет. Бизнесом занялся когда женился. Жена домохозяйка помогает муже в бизнесе. Утром доит коров убирает коровник. Кредит получил  на покупки коров. Каждую конец недели  есть рынок купли продажи скота. Абдуазиз через три- четыре месяца   выводит скот на продажу и приобретает в замен молодняк.
texts.en:
Abduaziz T. was born in 1962, he is married and has four children. He does not have higher education. He keeps cattle at his home and has been breeding it for more than eighteen years. He has started his business when he got married. His wife is a housewife and helps him with the business. She cleans the cowhouse and milks the cows in the mornings. He received the loan to buy more cows. He goes to the cattle markets at the end of every week. Abduaziz takes the cattle out for sale after every three to four months and buys a younger stock instead.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Нормуродова Саломат в возрасте 41 года имеет 4 детей, живет в районе Турсун-заде и занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она этим видом бизнеса занимается более 15 лет. Саломат обратилась к нам за кредитом чтобы купить бычка. Муж находится на заработках в России, высылает деньги не часто, и поэтому ей приходиться много работать, для того чтобы обеспечить свою семью.
texts.en:
N. Salomat is 41 years old, has 4 children, lives in the Tursun-zoda region and fattens and sells livestock. She has been working in this type of business for more than 15 years. Salomat turned to us for a loan in order to buy a bull. Her husband is earning money in Russia and does not send money often, because of this she needs to work a lot in order to provide for her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rukhsana M. Wakeel Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband name is M. W. and he has a timber-selling business and has four year’s experience.

Rukhsana baji herself runs a clothes-selling business. She sells clothes to her neighbors and relatives and buys from different cities named Lahore and Multna. Rukhsana baji is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s business.

Rukhsana baji is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Noor ilahi baji and Sajida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Ricardo Aníbal

texts.es: Ricardo Aníbal R. vive en un pequeño cantón llamado La Labor ubicado en el departamento Cuscatlán, Ricardo es un padre de familia soltero, su hijo Javier  tiene 12 años. Ricardo se dedica a la venta de sabanas para cama; negocio que con mucho esfuerzo le ayudo a comprar su casa, en la que vive actualmente con su hijo, madre y hermana. Ricardo solicita este crédito para mejorar su vivienda  como poner piso, techar una parte de la casa y construir la acera frente a su casa.
texts.en:
Ricardo Aníbal R. lives in a small village named La Labor, located in the Cuscatlán region. Ricardo is a single father, and his son Javier is 12 years old. Ricardo dedicates himself to selling sheets for beds a business that, with much effort, helped him buy his house. He lives there currently with his son, mother and sister. Ricardo requests this loan to make improvements to his home such as installing a floor, adding the roof over one section, and building the sidewalk in front of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Солиева Мухаё 1972 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Высшего образования не имеет. Муж помогает разводить скот. В основном она сама ухаживает за скотом, помогают и сыновья. Муж или дети выводят только на продажу и выгуливают на пастбище. Кредит получил на покупки скота.
texts.en:
Muhayo S. was born in 1972, she is married with three children. She does not have higher education. Her husband helps her raise cattle. She mainly takes care of the cattle and her sons also help her. Her husband and children take the cattle out only for sale and for grazing. She received the loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Noor Sabra Ghulam Murtaza Group

texts.en:
Noor Sabra baji is the wife of G. M. and lives in Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Noor baji is a very devoted lady. She always motivates her husband to go ahead no matter what the circumstances. Her motivation gives power to him and he has started a clothes selling business. From this business, they are able to send their two children, a daughter and a son, to school. Noor baji is very happy with his efforts. Noor baji also operates a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to increase the profit of her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Saeeda baji is requesting a loan to buy wood to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane for her juice corner. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Sultonjon

texts.ru:
Султонжон Зарифов два раза в месяц посещает Кыргызстан город Каросу, для того чтобы закупить от туда товар, привезти его в Таджикистан, и реализовать приобретенный товар на рынке Зафар города Истаравшана.
 Торгует Султонжон детской одеждой, у него достаточно опыта в сфере предпринимательской деятельности, так как занимается этим более 8 лет.
 Султонжон женат и имеет одного ребенка. Жена Наргиза Ахмедова работает воспитательницей в детском саду, а в выходные дни торгует вместе со своим мужем на вещевом рынке.
 Султонжону нужна сумма в размере 2300 сомони сроком на 4 месяца, для того чтобы увеличить свой товарооборот.С этой целью он подал заявку на Кива.
texts.en:
Sultonjon Z. visits the Kyrgyz city of Karosu twice per month in order to obtain his goods. He then brings the goods to Tajikistan and sells them at the Zafar market in the city of Istaravshan. Sultonjon sells chidlren’s clothing. He has plenty of entrepreneurial experience because he has been working in this field for over 8 years. Sultonjon is married and has one child. His wife, Nargiza Ahmedova, works as a kindergarten teacher and works with Sultonjon at the clothing market on the weekends. Sultonjon needs a loan in the sum of 2300 somoni in order to increase his goods turnover. He will repay the loan within 4 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Fatima Amjad Saeed Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji has resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a CD center in the market. He has 3 years of experience in this business. He buys CDs from the famous market of the city of Lahore named “Hafiz center” and sells to his native city. Fatima baji operates a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her husband’s CD center.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Qamar baji, Rafiqan baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy fruits & vegetables to sell. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy CDs for CD center

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат Солибоева 1955 года рождения , замужем имеет 6 детей. высшего образования не имеет. На рынке торгует около 10 лет. Продает муку на оптовом рынке.  В Микроинвест обратилась по совету подруг. Получила  кредит и приобрела партию товара . Муку у нее раскупают оптом. Так выгодней и оборот идет быстрее на сбыт. Планирует расширить свой магазин на будущий кредит.
texts.en:
Born in 1955, Salomat S. is married and has 6 children. She does not have a higher education. She sells flour at a wholesale market and has almost 10 years of experience in this business. Salomat reached out to MicroInvest on an advice from her friends. She obtained a loan and purchased new product inventory. Her customers buy her flour wholesale, which is quicker and more profitable. Salomat plans to expand her store with this new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Farhat Jannat Ghulam Fareed Group

texts.en:
Farhat jannat baji is a wife of G. F., owns a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 10 years. Her husband has run a grocery shop in the community for the past 3 years. Farhat baji is a very hardworking lady. She does all the household work and then after she starts preparing to embroider clothes. She prepares clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Mussarat parveen baji wants a loan to buy paint to resell. Sultan begum baji and Muafia baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Samina baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switches and switch boards) to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар кредитор Фонда с 2008 года.Она занимается продажей детской одеждой на рынке Костакоза.Ей 33 года , мать одного ребёнка. За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан один раз в месяц.кредит берёт на расширение своего дела.По сезону она закупает товар для детей.Поэтому на сей раз хочет в кредит закупить ассортимент летней детской одежды.Муяссар благодарит за поддержку KIVA и желает ей процветания и удачи.
texts.en:
Muyassar has been a borrower at the fund since 2008. She is involved in sales of children’s clothing at a Kostakoz market. She is 33 years old and a mother of one child. She brings her goods herself from Istaravshan once per month. Muyassar wants to obtain this loan for business expansion. She buys children’s goods seasonally and now wants to purchase an assortment of summer clothing. Muyassar is grateful to Kiva for the support and wishes it luck and prosperity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer goods assortment

loans.name: Rasheeda Sultan Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Rasheeda and I have resided in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I am an uneducated lady as I didn’t realize the value of education at that time, why it’s compulsory. Now I know the value of why it's really compulsory when I see my two sons free.

I have set my mind that I’ll send my sons into a school and for this purpose I started operating a business sewing clothes. I saved income from my business and admitted my sons into school. My husband's name is S. A. and he sells construction supplies and specifically wooden beams to his customers. He has 5 years of experience in this business. I am applying for a loan to buy beams to increase the profit of my husband. I am the group leader of two other women from my locality. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) to sell. Khursheedan baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to resell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy beams for shuttering business

loans.name: Irshad Falaq Sher Group

texts.en:
I. baji is a wife of F. S. who has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is an uneducated lady because her father was the only breadwinner of the family and it was difficult for him to fulfil the family's individual desires.

She is the mother of four kids: three daughters and one son. Her daughters help her in her decorative embroidery business. Her son is enrolled in a local school and getting an education. Her husband runs a paint selling business. He buys paints wholesale and sells it in his paint shop. He has 3 years of experience in this business. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s paint selling business. She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zareena baji and Mumtaz baji each want a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. Saleem baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Mumtaz bano baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes to sell

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru:
Скоро исполнится 20 лет, как  Зайнура Маъруфходжаева занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. За 20 лет работы она увеличила  ассортимент своего товара. Начинала она с продажи верхней женской одежды, сейчас в ее ассортименте женские и мужские костюмы, брюки, сорочки.
 Зайнура, так же хочет присоеденить к ассортименту своего товара женскую обувь, для этого ей нужны средства. Услышав о том, что "Микроинвест" выдает займ на предпринимательскую деятельность, она обратилась к нам за помощью. Зайнура запрашивает сумму в размере 1000 сомони.
 Зайнура живет с мужем и 2 детьми. Ее муж работает сварщиком, и в свободное время помогает жене на рынке.
texts.en:
It will soon be 20 years since Zaynura M. began her entrepreneurial activity. She increased her goods assortment over the last 20 years of work. She started her business with sales of women’s outerwear, and now her assortment includes women’s and men’s suits, pants and undershirts. Zaynura wants to also add women’s shoes to her goods variety, but she needs funding to do this. Having found out that MicroInvest provides financing options to entrepreneurs, Zaynura reached out to us for help. She is requesting a loan in the sum of 1000 somini. Zaynura lives with her husband and 2 children. Her husband works as a welder and helps Zaynura with the business during his free time.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand goods assortment

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
"I am happy being a farmer. I help my husband till the farm. I never mind working under the heat of the sun, feeling the wet soil, just to have enough food on our table", says Remedios M., a 41 year old CEVI client with two children who are going to school.

She is asking a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a gallon of crude oil to run farm machinery and payment for the other laborer. The loan will help her increase her income. This will help in sending her children to college.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to start and have their own business. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy a gallon of crude oil and payment for laborer

loans.name: Bilquis Begum M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Bilquis begum baji is married to M. A., and they have been living together in Borewala, Pakistan since past 10 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. Bilquis baji runs a clothes sewing business and she takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. Bilquis baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Saleem baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell. 

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Jamila Khanum M. Roshan Group

texts.en:
Jamila khanum baji is married to M. R., and they have been living in Borewala, Pakistan, since past 10 years. Her husband is a painter by profession, who goes to people’s houses to paint when they place an order with him. Jamila baji helps him by sewing clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy material (paint brushes, big paint drums) for her husband’s painting business.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Bushran baji wants a loan to buy CDs for her CD shop. Nasira baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак кредитор в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она использует свои кредита для увеличения своего оборотного капитала. За товаром ездит в Истаравшан.У неё трое детей, муж работает таксистом на своей машине. его доход не хватает на семейные расходы семьи, поэтому Муборак помогает мужу по жизни выходя на торговлю каждый день. Она благодарна Фонду , за то, что она смогла увеличить своё дело и стала самостоятельно ездить за товаром.Просит выдать ей очередной кредит в размере 300 сомони.
texts.en:
Muborak has been a borrower of MicroInvest since 2007. She uses her loans in order to increase her working capital. She travels to Istaravshan for the products. She has three children, her husband works as a taxi driver using his own car, his income is not enough to cover family expenses and this is why Muborak helps her husband in life and goes out to sell every day. She is grateful to the Fund for allowing her to increase her business and to be able to travel for products herself. She is asking for another loan of 300 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
“When I started farming, I didn’t know how to plant rice. My husband taught me how to. Now, I am his assistant when we are to prepare the land for another planting season. I would say it’s really hard. But when you think of your children, it doesn’t seem like hard work," says Elizabeth T., a 28-year-old mother of two children.

She is asking a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. The loan will help her achieve better yield in her farm. In that way, she believes, she could easily provide her children education.

CEVI gives not only loans to its clients but also offers trainings and insurance coverage services to help small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Shahbaz Ali Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji has resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past eleven years. Her husband’s name is S. A. and he has a business selling chicken meat. He runs a shop in the community. Mostly people come to him to buy meat because of his good behavior and good balance in the meat weight. He has two years of experience in the business.

Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy chickens to increase the profit of her husband’s business. 

Naseem baji is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Muniran baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business.

Ramzan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Khalida baji wants a loan to buy paint to sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her husband's business selling chicken meat

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: "Before I started tilling my farm, I had been into a lot of struggles. I didn’t have job to support my family and my children are growing and so are their needs," says Edwin D., 30-year-old father of two children. He has been a farmer for five years already. His harvest is what he uses to feed and clothe his family. Edwin is asking a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase herbicide, fertilizer and seed. He is also looking to some other possible income areas to supplement their earnings. CEVI aims to help small business grow. It provides not just loans to its clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide, fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Махфират - женщина, которая торгует на рынке Паншанбе нижнем женским бельём. Она замужем , имеет двоих взрослых детей. По мимо нижнего белья она имеет ассортимент женской  и мужской одежды.Махфират хочет получив следующий кредит съездить за товаром в Истаравшан и привести летний ассортимент товаров.Махфират выражает свою благодарность инвесторам за сотрудничество и своевременное финансирование.
texts.en:
Mahfirat sells women’s undergarments at the Panshanbe market. She is married and has two grown children. Besides undergarments, she also has an assortment of women’s and men’s clothing. Mahfirat wants obtain this loan in order to bring a summer goods assortment from Istaravshan. Mahfirat expresses her gratitude to investors for collaboration and timely financing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain an assortment of summer merchandise

loans.name: Ramzana M. Bashir Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to increase the profits of her husband. Ramzana baji is a very devoted lady. She will always stand by her husband and encourage him if he doesn't get good profit. Her husband is M. B. and he has five years of experience operating a fruit and vegetable selling business . He buys fruits and vegetables wholesale from the famous market (Sunday Bazaar) and sells to different shops. Ramzana baji has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.

She is the leader of this group including three other women from her locality. Hanifan baji and Irshad baji both want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy sugarcane for her juice corner.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru:
Собир Сайдалиев 1964 года рождения, проживает в городе Истаравшане, женат, отец 2 детей.
 Собир занимается торговлей. В ассортимент его товара входят полотенце, носки и нижнее белье.
 Стаж его деятельности 10 лет. Торговля на рынке, приносит ему основной доход в его семью. Кроме этого он подрабатывает банщиком.
 Жена Собира Мухаббат, тоже вкладывает свои усилия для содержания семьи. Она умеет красиво вышивать.
 Мухаббат вышивает национальные головные уборы, тюбитейки на заказ.
  Собир запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев. Полученный займ планирует потратить для своего товарооборота.
texts.en:
Born in 1964, Sobir S. is married, has 2 children and lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is involved in sales. His merchandise includes towels, socks and undergarments. Sobir has 10 years of experience in this business. Sales is the main source of income for his family. In addition, he works as a bathhouse attendant. Sobir’s wife, Muhabbot, also adds her effort to support the family. She is a talented embroiderer and embroiders traditional hats, tubeteiki. Sobir is requesting a 6-month loan in the sum of 1200 somoni. He plans to use the loan for his goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Goods turnover

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has been selling shoes, handbags and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her business for 8 hours every day. Mwanaisha is 22 years old, married, and has two  children: ages 7 and 4.
Mwanaisha is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more shoes, handbags and clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.
She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070).

loans.use: To buy shoes, handbags and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.ru: Лутфи - женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест с 2005 года.Она торгует на рынке паншанбе города Худжанда.У неё в основном товары для подросткового возраста.она хочет получив кредит съездить за товаром в Истаравшан.Сейчас идёт спрос на мальчиковые бермуды и футболки, поэтому Лутфи хочет пополнить свой товарооборот.За все годы своего сотрудничества с Фондом Лутфи на разу не подводила во время погашения.Она в числе хороших клиентов.
texts.en:
Lutfy is a woman, she has been taking out loans at MicroInvest since 2005. She sells on the Panshabe market in the town of Khujand. She mainly sells clothing for teenagers. She wants to use the loan to travel to Istaravshan for the merchandise. Right now the demand for t-shirts and bermudas for boys is very high. Lutfy wants to increase her merchandise circulation. During all these years in her partnership with the fund Lutfy has never been late with a payment. She is one of the good clients.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Fakhra Ali Abbas Group

texts.en:
Fakhra baji is applying for a loan to buy medicines to increase the profit of her husband. Her husband, A. A., belongs to a medicine selling business. He has been selling medicines for the past five years. He buys medicines wholesale and supplies different medical stores. They live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines.

Fakhra baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Zubaida baji is requesting a loan to buy fruits to sell. Azra baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for a dairy business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Bushran M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Bushran baji is the wife of M. N. who has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past twelve years. Her husband buys sugarcane from the fruit market and sells its juice in the community. He charges them ten Pak rupees for each glass.

Bushra baji helps her husband by cleaning the sugarcane with the duster and she also embroiders dresses on order to earn income. She is applying for a loan to buy more sugarcane for her husband so that he is able to earn more profit.

Bushra baji is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy cloth to sell.

Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane for her husband to sell its juice

loans.name: Yataka Moyo Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been a bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items (wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items) for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Fatma is 26 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Siasa who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and other items for her business

loans.name: Najma Kosar Banyameen Group

texts.en:
Najma kosar baji is the wife of B. who has been residing in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband belongs to the timber-selling business and has six years of experience. He has a good number of customers because gas is not available and so people use wood for cooking food.

Najma baji is a very hardworking lady and shares the financial burden of her husband by sewing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy timber for her husband’s business.

Najma baji is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Jamila baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Shahnaz kosar baji, Kaniz Fatima baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy donkey carts for their loading business.

loans.use: To buy timber for her husband to sell

loans.name: Mukadis

texts.ru:
Мукадис Худойбердиева родилась в 1968 году,заботливая мать 4 детей, проживает в городе Истаравшане.
 Клиентка занимается предпринимательской деятельностью,продает детскую одежду на рынке Истаравшана.  
 За товаром Мукадис ездит в Кыргызстан. 
 Хочет получить займ в размере 2300 сомони, для своего товарооборота. 
 Супруг клиентки Абдувохид продаёт на рынке кондитерские изделия, тем самым вносит вклад в бюджет семьи.
texts.en:
Mukadis H. was born in 1968. She is the caring mother of four children, and lives in the town of Istaravshan. Mukadis is an entrepreneur who sells children's clothing at the Istaravshan market, and she travels to Kyrgyzstan to buy her goods. She would like to take out a loan in the amount of 2300 somoni to increase turnover. Her husband Abduvohid sells confectionary products at the market, thereby contributing to the support of the family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal K. has a bar and beauty salon business at Nabweru near highway road. She is a hardworking business lady, age 35, married with four children. She is requesting a loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair braids, hair weaves, hair combs, hair treatments, etc. and also bar items such as beer, wines, sodas, etc. to meet her customer's expectations. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase hair salon items and also bar items such as beer, sodas, wines etc .

loans.name: Muiddinhoja

texts.ru: Муиддинходжа парень, который торгует на рынке города Худжанда.Его ассортимент составляет мужская обувь.Он привозит товар с оптового рынка Истаравшана. Муиддинходжа в этот раз на один месяц решил снизить сумму займа в связи с достатком товара, а в следующий месяц планирует увеличить связи с поездкой за летним товаром.На снимке Шодмонов Муиддинхлджа на месте торговли.
texts.en:
Muiddinhoja is a young man who trades at the Khujand town market. He carries a range of men's shoes, which he brings in from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. This month Muiddinhoja decided to decrease the amount of the loan he takes out to buy inventory, and next month increase it to buy summer goods. Muiddinhoja is at his stall in the photograph.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to Tuache uvivu group loan (Group code 2065). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Mwanajuma is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy items like wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Mwanajuma is 32 years old, married, and has five children: ages 14, 9, 8, 4 and 4 months. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and beans for her business

loans.name: Umm-E-Kalsoom Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is a very determined and hardworking lady. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. She operates a clothes-sewing business to pay for the school fees of her children so that they able to study without any difficulty. 

Her husband’s name is B. A. and he is a tailor by profession and runs a tailoring center in the community. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine so that her husband is able to grow his business.

Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Bushra parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Syeda Tahzib baji wants a loan to buy items (table covers, a tent and chairs) for her catering business.

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs) for her salon.

Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her husband's tailoring center

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small shop in addition to selling clothes and cosmetics in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six months. She belongs to Nia moja group loan (Group code 2032). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Fatma is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, cosmetics and other items for her shop to add to her current stock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use

Fatma is 32 years old, married, and has given birth to a child that is now 11 years old.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, cosmetics and other items for her shop

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
N. Salima is a hardworking businesswoman aged 37. She is married with four children that are all in school. She has a permanent residence at Yesu Amala Area in Nansana.

She has a cloth business at Nakasero market. She is requesting a loan to buy more cloth which she does not have in order to increase her stock to fulfill her customers’ demands.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth to increase her stock

loans.name: Rubina Kosar M. Tariq Group

texts.en:
Rubina kosar baji is a wife of M. T.. She has lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 16 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. Rubina baji wishes to give her daughters a good education, which her parents couldn’t give her. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He has 5 years of experience. Rubina baji helps him by arranging the fruit in boxes so he able to pack them easily and sell them to the fruit shops. She is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality. Sultana baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy a beam shuttering business. Salma baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Parveen kosar baji wants a loan to buy material (scissors and a sewing machine) for her tailoring center. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: In this picture Parveen kosar baji shows a cushion, the cover of which was sewed by her husband.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Razia M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a widow. She has lived in a city famous for its shrines, Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 20 years. Razia baji is a very strong lady. She had totally lost hope after the death of her husband, but she was able to summon up her courage for her kids. She is the mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters. All of her kids are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. Razia baji operates a vegetable selling business in the community and earns income to pay the school fees of her kids and manage her house. Her family feels proud of her. She is applying for a loan to buy vegetables to expand her business.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Qubra baji wants a loan to buy leather to resell. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira has been fish seller and has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Jipe moyo loan group (group code 2088). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $85. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and fish for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Subira is 32 years old, married, and has a 9-year-old child. She also take care of one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fish for resale.

loans.name: Herenest

texts.en: T. Herenest is a hard working businessman aged 45 years old and married with seven children. He has a wholesale grocery shop and a house in Kawempe. He is using the loan to purchase more grocery commodities such as ground nuts, rice, beans, maize, etc. to increase business stock and fulfill customer demands. His dream is to see his children through school.

loans.use: To expand wholesale foods business inventory

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru:
Рафоат Азимова добрая, трудолюбивая женщина. Занимается Рафоат продажей пищевых продуктов на рынке города Истаравшана.
 Ее муж Чурабой Мамуров и их сын работают мастерами по производству деревянных окон и дверей.
 Предпинимательская деятельность Рафоат и мастерство ее мужа и сына, все вместе взятых, приносят доход в их семью.
 Рафоат подала заявку на получение займа.На полученный займ хочет приобрести компьютер для своего любимого внука. Она мечтает, чтобы ее внук  мог свободно владеть компьютером, а сам Далерджон (имя внука Рафоат),  с нетерпением ждет подарок от бабушки.
texts.en:
Rafoat A. is a good, hard-working woman, who sells food at the Istaravshan town market. Her husband Churaboy Mamurov and their son are master craftsmen who manufacture wooden doors and windows. Rafoat's business endeavors and her husband and son's craftsmanship, all told, provide income for the family. Rafoat applied for the loan to purchase a computer for her favorite grandson, Dalerjon She hopes that her grandson will become an adept computer user; he is waiting patiently for the gift from his grandmother.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer purchase

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Тошмиров Илхом в возрасте 37 лет, имеет 3 детей, живет в районе Турсунзаде. Илхом работает по своей специальности бригадиром, и занимается  дополнительным бизнесом т.е. земледелием. Т.к. семья преумножилась, заработной платы не хватает и поэтому он начал свой бизнес, который длится уже более 10 лет. Илхом просит у нас кредит для посева риса.
texts.en:
T. Ilhom is 37 years old, has 3 children and lives in the Tursun-zoda region. Ilhom works as a foreman in his profession and also has a supplementary business, farming. Since his family size has increased, his salary is not enough and this is why he started his business which has already lasted for more than 10 years. Ilhom is asking us for a loan in order to plant rice.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant rice

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 30 years old and married.

Riziki has been a dress maker and sells clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Maendeleo loan group (group code 2054). She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $90. She works at her business for 8 hours every day.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy clothes and other items for resale

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo T. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une ferme d’élevage à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kodzo exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans et a considérablement augmenté son chiffre d’affaires au cours du dernier exercice. Il désire avec ce nouveau crédit élargir sa bassecours afin d’accroître la taille de son activité et mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kodzo T. is a young man aged 35 and is married with 3 children. He is the owner of a livestock firm in Avetonou, a village situated about 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kodzo has run this business for 7 years and has significantly increased his sales over the course of the last fiscal year. With this new loan, he would like to enlarge his flock of polutry in order to increase the size of his business and better respond to the needs of his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his flock of poultry

loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua has been a clothes and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 16 years. She belongs to the Vijana imara loan group (group code 2038). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale and wheat flour to cook bread. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwamvua is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 20 and 15.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale and flour to make bread

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru: Уразов Мамур-мужчина 46 лет. Женат отец 1 ребенка. Занимается продажей запчастей на рынке Аппон и Булок Аштского района. Мамур также по специальности мастер телемеханик. Мамур закупает товары у оптовиков на рынках Гули Сурх города Истаравшана. Мамур ездить за товаром в месяц один раз. Кредитуется в нашей организации с 2008 года ему нравятся все наши условия поэтому он решил продолжить с нами сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Mamur U. is a 46-year-old man. He is married and the father of one child. Mamur sells spare parts at the Appon and Bulok markets in the district of Asht. Mamur is also a television repairman. He buys items from the wholesalers at the Istaravshan Guli Surh town markets, and travels there once a month to buy goods. He has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2008. He likes the terms and has decided to continue his collaboration with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Agé de quarante neuf ans (49),Adama chauffeur de camion, transporte des fruits de la Casamance vers la capital Dakar. La Casamance, région située au sud du Sénégal, est la principale région productrice de fruits du pays. Chaque semaine il  fait  le trajet avec son camion pour livrer la marchandise. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de payer les traites pour le camion mais aussi de nourrir  sa famille. Pour payer  la vignette et les taxes annuelles, il sollicite un prêt de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Adama is a truck driver and transports fruit from Casamance to the capital, Dakar. Casamance, a region situated in the south of Senegal, is the main fruit-producing region of the country. Each week, he makes the journey with his truck to deliver merchandise. The income drawn from this activity allows him to pay the costs for his truck and also to feed his family. To pay the road and annual taxes, he is seeking a loan through IMCEC.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay road taxes

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Мутабар Умарова торгует на вещевом рынке города Истаравшана. В ассортимент ее товара входит детская и подрастковая одежда, которую она привозит из Кыргызстана. Торговля-основной источник доходов в ее семью.
У Мутабар двое детей, а ее муж уже 3 года, как уехал на заработки в Россию. Регулярно, он старается отправлять часть заработанных им денег своей семье.
Мутабар нужны деньги для товарооборота, с этой целью она подала заявку на получение займа в размере 1200 сомони сроком на 3 месяца.
texts.en:
Mutabar U. has a trade outlet at the Istaravshan town clothing market. She carries a variety of goods, including clothing for children and teenagers that she brings in from Kyrgyzstan. This business is her family's main source of income. Mutabar has two children, and her husband has been away for three years working in Russia. He regularly tries to send part of the money he earns to his family. Mutabar needs money for inventory, and with this goal in mind applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover of inventory

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Happyness has owned a small cafe in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She belongs to the Jipe moyo loan group (group code 2088). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Happyness is 33 years old, divorced, and has two children, ages 11 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more food for her cafe

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar T. lives with his wife and four children, whose ages range from 13 to 23, in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's Northern provinces. His two youngest children are local high school students. He has a small retail business selling secondhand clothing. He usually travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and purchases imported secondhand clothes at wholesale markets. He rents a small stall in the local market in Arhangay province to sell his clothes from.

Since the start of his business in 2004, his business capital has increased from 200,000 Mongolian Tughrik (about US $142) to 1,500,000 tughrik (about US $1063). In the future, he would like to have his two high school children enter universities of their choices without any financial strains. He requests a loan to purchase more secondhand clothes from Ulaanbaatar for his business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke is 30 years old and married with three children. She styles hair and sells hair extensions, creams, and women's wares. She started this business eight years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Milda has been a bites seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 15 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, cooking oil and other food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Nikusubila is 40 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 12 and 8. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Milda, who has her own small business selling used clothes in Iringa.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Musa M. sells earrings and necklaces and is requesting a loan in order to stock more ornaments in her shop to sell. She is 42 years old and lost her husband during the 21 year Liberation war in southern Sudan. Musa has four children, three boys and one girl. Only three attend school at Walang-walang primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. 

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Batmonh

texts.en:
Batmonh D. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangha, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Batmonh's three children are all high school students. Batmonh has a small business printing newspapers. He started his business in 2000 by printing just a few copies of a local paper with only 150,000 Mongolian Tugriks (about US $105).

His printing business is doing well, and now has capital that ranges between 400,000 to 500,000 tugriks (about US $280 - $350). He hopes to expand his printing business and would like to focus on his sales management. Batmonh requests a loan to purchase necessary raw materials such as paper and ink for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for printing

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola,an active LAPO client, is 36 years old and married with one child. She has a video store where she rents out VCDs, and she also sells drinks at both the wholesale and retail level. Fumilola hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.ru:
Угул Абдувахобова замужем,имеет 5 детей. Ей 47 лет. Место ее деятельности вещевой рынок, где она торгует школьной одеждой. В этой сфере деятельности ей помогает ее  старший сын.
 Для товарооборота ей нужны денежные средства, поэтому она запрашивает 1000 сомони, сроком на три месяца. В будущем она планирует разнообразить ассортимент своего товара и открыть еще одну точку торговли для своего сына.
 Дополнительным источником доходов в ее семью, является работа ее мужа Абдурахмона. Он водитель такси.
texts.en:
Ugul A. is married and has five children. She is 47 years old. She works at the clothing market, where she sells school uniforms, and her eldest son assists her with the work. She needs funds for inventory, so she is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni. In the future she plans to expand the variety of goods she carries and open an additional trade outlet for her son. Her husband Abdurahmona's work is an additional source of family income. He is a taxi driver.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A., 22 and married to a driver in the Ministry of Fisheries, Government of southern Sudan (GOSS), currently sells beer at home and requests a loan to set up a bar at the market in order to expand her customer base.  The mother of two children in primary school, Richard hopes to build a house for rental purposes with the extra profits from the loan. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 4,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up a bar at the market.

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Neema is 20 years old, and is married. She has been a local alcohol maker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya  for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $230. Every day she works at her business for ten hours.

Neema is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation, and to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation

loans.name: Maendeleo 'a' Group

texts.en:
Rehema is a local alcohol seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Maendeleo 'A' group loan (Group code 2015). Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Rehema is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for the preparation of local alcohol for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rehema is married, and has six children: ages 22, 16, 13, 9, 4 and 2.

Rehema will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Sifa who has her own small business selling rice in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for preparation of local alcohol for resale

loans.name: Gafor

texts.ru: Субхиев Гафор- мужчина 47 лет. Женат отец 3-х детей. Гафур занимается торговлей скота. Гафор сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2008 года. Гафору помогают жена и старший сын. Свой скот он перепродает на Жигда, Булок и Аппон Аштского района. Также он работает фермером в колхозе и занимается сельской хозяйственной культурой. На полученный заем она хочет купить скот у оптовиков и перепродать по выгодной ему цене.
texts.en:
Gafor S. is a 47-year-old man. He is married and the father of three children. Gafor trades in cattle, assisted by his wife and eldest son, and has worked with MicroInvest since 2008. He resells the cattle at the Jigda, Bulok and Appon markets in Asht district. He additionally works as a farmer on a collective farm, raising agricultural crops. With the loan he wants to buy cattle wholesale and resell them at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle trade

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli Q. is a 40-year-old man who keeps his own café. He is also a cook and serves his clients with dishes of meat and tea. He has more that twelve years of experience in this field. His café is located in the open air in spring and summer which makes it very attractive.

Fizuli is married and has two children. He would like to improve his working conditions in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To improve his working conditions

loans.name: N’Towosso

texts.fr: N’towosso A. est une femme de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de poissons et légumes au marché d’Avetonou. N’towosso  détient cette activité depuis des années et arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle désire avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce afin d’augmenter ses recettes pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants. dans la vue, Ntowosso est celle assise derrière l’étalage.
texts.en:
N'towosso A. is a 49-year-old woman who is married and has 5 children. She is a retailer of fish and vegetables at the market in Avetonou. N'towosso has had this business for many years and finds it difficult to provide for her family. With this loan, she would like to enlarge the size of her business in order to increase her sales so that she can better satisfy the needs of her children. In the photo, N'towosso is the woman seated behind the display.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Bashiran M.ramzan Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji has resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband’s name is M. R. and he is a farmer. He grows vegetables and sells them in the shops to earn income. He has been in this business for the past twenty years.

Bashiran baji is a very hardworking lady. She has a business selling artificial flowers. She sells those flowers in gift shops at good prices. She is applying for a loan to buy seeds to grow vegetables and increase her husband’s income. 

Bashiran baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business.

Bismillah baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to sell.

Safia baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business.

Nargis bano baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her husband's vegetable-growing business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Aisha K. from Mbeya. She is single with two children aged 6 and 10. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Aisha has been running a grocery business since 2006. A grocery store is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people send their children running to, to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient. Aisha works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Aisha currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase various items for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Aisha thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga T. lives with his wife and one-year-old son in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Battulga married his wife two years ago and since then has been running a small business with his wife selling women’s and men's clothing.

Battulga rents a small stall in the local apparel market and sells clothing that he buys from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When he travels to Ulaanbaatar to purchase new inventory his wife runs their stall.

They started their business with 50,000 MNT ($1 equals approximately 1,400 MNT) of working capital which today has increased to 250,000 MNT. Battulga and his wife aim to set aside some profit in the savings account of their baby boy. Battulga requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ulaanbaatar for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from the capital city for his business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin N. is a 40-year-old woman whose business deals in selling clothes and used shoes at the market. She requests a loan to stock more clothes and used shoes to sell in order to enhance her business. N. has four children since her marriage: three are girls and one is a younger boy. Two of her children attend secondary school at Supiri, one attends primary school and the youngest one doesn't go to school. With the extra profits from her loan in future, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
